loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia A. is from the town of Talibon. She is 54 years old. Delia is married and has 7 children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years now.

Delia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Delia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and supplement the family's income.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ronerie

texts.en:
Ronerie J. is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in Zone 4, Brgy Tabao, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living owning and operating a general store.

Ronerie’s 29-year-old husband, Archie, is an employee of Sugar Central, and they have two children who are 6 and 7 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Ronerie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income through the general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000 from her business activities.

Ronerie is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 was used to fund operations for her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 13th cycle loan, the amount of PHP 10,000, which she intends to use on her general store. Ronerie is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Suosdei Meoung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 19 people who live in Kaoh Krabei village in Kandal province. Mrs. Suosdei M. is the village bank president selected by the other members, who will use their loan in different ways. She is 50 years old. She is a flower and banana seller in the local market, where she earns little money to support her family because she does not have enough capital to invest. So to improve this business, Mrs. Suosdei M. is asking for a loan to buy more bananas to resell. 

Her husband, Mr. Saroeurn Dy, is a chef. She is the mother of seven children, four of whom are chefs and help her to sell flowers and bananas, while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to resell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not in school. Jane has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for two years. To help expand her business, Jane is requesting a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, a Kiva partner. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal. Jane hopes that the loan will help her by allowing her to expand her business. In the future, Jane hopes to make her business international. About BRAC Uganda: This loan is administered by BRAC Uganda, a registered non-governmental organization (NGO) in Uganda that is also a part of the BRAC international network. BRAC Uganda attempts to address poverty through a holistic model, offering programs in education, health, water and sanitation, agriculture, and microfinance. BRAC Uganda’s microfinance program aims to provide the poor with easy, reliable and efficient access to institutional financial services, and reaches more than 150,000 families in Uganda. For more on BRAC Uganda, please see our partner page at http://www.kiva.org/partners/65, and join our lending team, Friends of BRAC Uganda, at http://www.kiva.org/team/friends_of_brac_uganda

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Fight For Progress Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Fight for Progress” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. However, with the help of this new loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Alimamy K.. Alimamy is now age twenty-eight; he was born in Magburaka town where he lives with his wife and one child. Alimamy’s wife is a businesswoman and his child is still not of school-going age. 

For four years now, Alimamy has been running an Internet café wherein he also does photocopying for a fee. Alimamy will use his share of this loan to expand his business. He will use it to buy some stationery, pay internet connection fees, etc.

loans.use: buy some stationery, pay internet connection fees, etc.

loans.name: Hernestina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es  la Sra. Hernestina;  Ella tiene 44 años de edad,  es madre soltera  y  tiene 1 hijo, se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia compra al por mayor fruta y vende en el mercado central en la sección de frutas.  Ella también vende verduras pero por medio de su hija.  La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de frutas y verduras de los proveedores.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” communal bank. This bank is located in the Santiago district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Hernestina, and she is 44 years old. She is a single mother with 1 child. Her work is in trade, buying and selling fruit wholesale, and also selling it in the fruit section of the central market. She also sells vegetables but through her daughter. She is requesting the loan to invest in buying merchandise. The borrower appreciates and values the loan, and accordingly she is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in buying merchandise

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Qorimankacha”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marina; ella tiene 53 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, juguetes y regalos en forma independiente, ella lleva a diferentes tiendas y también a sus amigos para poder venderlos, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender la ropa que trae de diferentes lugares como Bolivia, Tacna y Lima. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería, ella compra pantalones, polos, blusas y juguetes.

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marina, 53, is married and has three children. She’s a member of the “Qorimankacha” communal bank located in Wanchaq district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She combines her household chores with the sales of clothes, gifts and toys. She takes her wares to various stores to sell and also to friends. She’d like to have a store of her own to sell the clothes that she brings from various places like Bolivia, Tacna and Lima. She is asking for funds to buy merchandise; she will buy pants, polo-type shirts, blouses and toys. She uses this forum to thank all those who form part of her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like: pants, polo-type shirts, blouses and toys.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lucila S. Ortiz vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 26 años, es casada con 2 hijos menores.
La señora Lucila S. montó una despensa  la cual tiene una antigüedad de 6 años; ubicada en el barrio San Vicente de la misma ciudad;  cuenta con casa propia.
Su cónyuge se dedica a la reparación de embarcación, y apoya con sus ingresos a la canasta familiar.
El crédito otorgado será de gran ayuda para acrecentar su despensa teniendo en cuenta la demanda existente en los meses venideros. El crédito destinrá a la compra de productos empaquetados, enlatados, verduras, carnes, aceites y articulos de limpieza, bazar, bebidas, etc. al por mayor 
Agradece a Fundación Paraguaya por el préstamo otorgado y afirma tener muchos emprendimientos para más adelante y seguir trabajando con nosotros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucila S. Ortiz, 26, lives in the city of Carapeguá. She’s married and has two minor children. She set up grocery store six years ago in Carapeguá’s San Vicente neighborhood. She owns her house. Her spouse is a boat repairman and his earnings help meet household expenses. The loan will be of great use to increase stock keeping in mind the increased demand that will occur in the coming months. The loan will be used to buy packaged items, canned goods, vegetables, meats, cooking oil, cleaning supplies, kitchenware, beverages, etc. at wholesale. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the loan granted and states that she has several enterprises planned for the future and intends to continue collaborating with us.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy packaged products, canned goods, vegetables, meats, cooking oil, cleaning supplies, kitchenware, beverages, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una madre de familia de 51 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el caserío Fanupe Casa Blanca del distrito de Mórrope, una zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, se encuentra situado a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de desayunos y almuerzos en un pequeño establecimiento situado en su domicilio. Su casa se encuentra situada frente al paradero de autos y mototaxis que se dirigen hacia las diversas zonas aledañas y esto le permite ofrecer sus productos a los transportistas y transeúntes que suelen visitar la zona. Adicionalmente suele vender salchipollos en su carrito sanguchero por las noches.

Yolanda desea adquirir calaminas (material para techar viviendas) para poder reforzar el techo de su vivienda, así como algunas sillas y mesas para implementar su negocio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Yolanda es una mujer tranquila y responsable. El negocio que tiene le permite sentirse activa y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su familia. En la zona las personas que le conoce le quieren y estiman mucho.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 51 years old and a mother who lives with her husband in a farmhouse called Fanupe Casa Blanca in the Mórrope district, in a rural area of the  Lambayeque district. It is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells breakfast and lunch in a small establishment located in her home. Her house is in front of the whereabouts of cars and motorcycle taxis that go to various surrounding areas and this allows her to offer her products to carriers and bystanders who often visit the area. In addition, she also sells salchipollos in a vending cart at night. 

Yolanda wants to purchase "calaminas" (material for roofing houses) to reinforce the roof of her house and also some tables and chairs for her business. Because of this she has decided to apply for a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her to achieve her goal. 

Yolanda is a quiet and responsible woman. This business allows her to be active and help her husband with family expenses. People in the area who know her love her and think highly of her.

loans.use: Purchase of furniture for expanding business selling food.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta P. is a single woman who lives in Brgy. Himaya, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  Guava jelly production and a pig fattening business. Violeta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Violeta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5000, uplifting the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to buy feeds for her pigs and ingredients for her guava jelly-making business so that she could continue to save up for future improvements of her business. Violeta P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of Food Products

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane, age 24, owns a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells such items as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, instant noodles, and snacks. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have one small child and live in the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. 
  
Earlier this year, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell in her shop. Mary Jane is requesting a second loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and employed as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Mr. Aun Chhorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The ten people who make up this village bank loan group live in Kampong Pou village in Takeo province. They will use their portion of the loan in various ways to support their family's. All the members have selected Mr. Aun C. as the village bank president. He was born in 1954. 
 
Mr. Aun C. and his wife, Mrs. Yen Yung, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell and support their family. His problem is that his rice field has infurtile soil. So to improve production, Mr. Aun C. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. He is a father of two children who all are employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: James Ndirangu

texts.en:
James has operated a transport business for one year in Naivasha town. He is 38 years old, married to Beth Wambui and they have four children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of Kshs 64,800 well and in good time. He plans to diversify his sources of income so he will use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow and sell the milk locally.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nub

texts.en: Nub K. is 46 years old, married, and has three children.  She and her family live in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area knows for pre-ankorean temples.  K. sells food and coffee, earning $6 per day. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more food to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. The family has to spend $30 on food, $15 on electricity supply, and $30 on other necessary expenses every month. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase food to sell

loans.name: Roxana Katherine

texts.es:
Roxana Katherine V. M. tiene 19 años, es soltera, y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Babahoyo en la provincia de Los Ríos. 

Roxana Katherine es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.   

Roxana Katherine se dedica a quehaceres domésticos. Ella solicita el crédito para su propio negocio. El crédito incrementaría sus ingresos. 

Para el futuro la meta de Roxana Katherine es aumentar su negocio y tener buenos ingresos para su familia. El mayor desafío para ella y su familia es no tener suficiente dinero. 

Los hobbies de Roxana Katherine son leer y disfrutar las fiestas de patronales de su cantón.
texts.en:
Roxana Katherine V. M. is 19 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents in Babahoyo canton, in Los Ríos province.

Roxana Katherine is a member of the 'Unidos Somos Más' (United We Are Stronger) rural loan group.  This new group is located in the community of Matilde Esther, in Guayas province, 2 hours from our Chillanes office in Bolívar province.  The group has 23 members who work in different business activities such as farming, livestock raising and running small restaurants and eateries.

Roxana Katherine does household chores.  She is requesting this loan for her own business.  The loan will help to increase her income.  In the future, Roxana Katherine's goal is to increase her business and to have good income for her family.  The biggest challenge she and her family face is not having enough money.  Roxana Katherine's hobbies are reading and taking part in the local fiestas in her canton.

loans.use: Own business

loans.name: Edreda

texts.en: Edreda is fifty-one years old, a single mother of six children, living in her own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a retail shop and a bar and has been running it for four years after farming. Her dream is to own a wholesale shop and her hardship is limited capital. Edreda needs the loan to buy sugar, salt, and rice for resale.

loans.use: Buying sugar, salt, and rice for resale

loans.name: Bodesmus

texts.en:
Bodesmus is a farmer from Kitale, in western Kenya. He has been farming for six years and his main products are milk, beans and maize, which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his hotel business in the same region. Bodesmus is 33 years old and married with 2 children, ages 2 and 12. 

Bodesmus has requested a loan of 31,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this acquisition will guarantee his family enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. He plans to acquire 3 quality dairy cows in the next 5 years to improve his milk production.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ana Viviana

texts.es:
Ana Viviana de 24 años vende calzado y ella necesita comprar al por mayor, pues quiere vender estos productos a un mejor precio que su competencia  y con este sistema de compra podrá ofrecer una   opción superior a sus clientes;  esta es la razón por la cual acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo pues quiere acceder a un crekiva, porque va a hacer esta inversión, que proyecta ser exitosa pues su venta está asegurada en pedidos de calzado colegial y además competirá con unos muy buenos precios en el mercado. 
Ana  inició su negocio en el año 2010 pues antes trabajó como empleada en diversos almacenes y allí tomó toda su experiencia emprendedora y en el manejo del mercado.  Su negocio está situado cerca a un centro comercial de gran tamaño en el sur de Barranquilla y muy cerca a uno de los escenario de futbol profesional mas importantes de Colombia, allí Ana vende sandalias, chancletas plásticas en diferentes modelos y estilos, formales e informales, su horario de permanencia en el negocio es de 8:00 am a 8:00 Pm todos los días, sus principales clientes son las personas que tranansitan por este lugar, conocidos  y jóvenes estudiantes que constantemente concurren a hacer compras, recibir clases o a practicar deportes.   Aunque su principal desafío es la competencia, ella se sostiene con buenos precios y una excelente servicio al cliente. Su meta más próxima es formalizar su negocio y también tener   su propia casa. Su persistencia en el trabajo es su gran fortaleza y desde su trabajo proyecta su crecimiento personal y familiar porque con su cónyuge, están haciendo todos los esfuerzos  para que su hija de dos años tenga un futuro exitoso.
texts.en:
Ana Viviana, age 24, sells footwear.  She needs to buy wholesale because she wants to sell these products at a better price than her competition.  With this sales system she will be able to offer her customers a better option.  

That is the reason that she comes to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; she wants to gain access to a Kiva loan.  She will make this investment, which she plans to be successful.  Her sales are assured because of the orders for school footwear.  Also, she will be competitive with the very good prices in the market.

Ana started her business in the year 2010.  Before that she was an employee with different stores.  That is where she got all of her entrepreneurial experience and experience in handling the market.  Her business is located close to a very large commercial center in the southern part of Barranquilla.  It is very close to one of the most important venues for professional soccer in Colombia.

Ana sells sandals and plastic flip flops in different patterns and styles, both formal and informal.  Her schedule for working in her business is from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. every day.  Her main customers are the people who travel through the area, acquaintances, and young students who always come shopping, for classes, or to practice sports.

Even though her main challenge is the competition, she maintains good prices and excellent customer service.  Her next goal is to formalize her business and to also have her own house.  Her persistence in her business is her great strength.  Through her work she plans her personal and family growth.   She and her husband are making every effort for their two year old daughter to have a successful future.

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Flora; la socia tiene 42 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias realizando el lavado de ropa ella trabaja de acuerdo a sus clientes que le solicitan a la vez la socia cuenta con un carrito que ofrece el servicio de taxi siendo su esposo quien maneja este carrito y ella administra, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro y para comprar algunos accesorios que necesita.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This is Sra. Flora. She is 42 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Flora divides her time between her daily activities and providing laundry services based on her customers’ requests. She owns a compact car that her husband drives for providing taxi services. Flora is a cheerful person who is eager to move forward. She is requesting a loan to maintain her vehicle and buy some necessary accessories.

Flora is happy to receive this loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: Pay for vehicle maintenance & purchase accessories for her taxi

loans.name: Sypaada's Group

texts.ru:
Сыпаада Жаманакова, 19, молодой лидер этой группы. В отличии от многих своих сверстников, она всегда точно знала чем она будет заниматься в жизни. В выборе профессии Сыпаада руководствовалась не престижем и востребованностью профессии, а тем , к чему у нее настоящая склонность и от чего она получает удовольствие. Этим занятием стало парикмахерское дело. В 17 лет Сыпаада закончила курсы обучения имиджмейкерства и парикмахерских услуг. Два года работы у опытных специалистов в столице помогло ей по возвращении в родной город Токтогул поделиться своими навыками с коллегами. Многочасовая ежедневная работа повысила привлечение клиентов. Таким образом ежемесячная прибыль для Сапаады составляет 10 000 сомов. Чем больше услуг предлагает парикмахерская, тем больше затрат она требует. Основные затраты включают оборудование, инструменты и косметические средства. Сыпаада планирует потратить этот кредит именно на приобретение дополнительных приборов для салона. Ее большая мечта – открыть свой салон красоты с высококачественным обслуживанием. 


        --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.
texts.en:
Sypaada J. is 19 years old, a young leader of this group. Unlike many of her peers she always knew exactly what she wants to do in life. When she chose her profession Sypaada was not driven by prestige or the demand of the profession, but rather by what she had a real aptitude for and what gave her gratification. She became a hairdresser.

When she was seventeen Sypaada finished a school of image making and hairdressing. Two years of working with experienced specialists in the country's capital helped her when she moved back to her home town of Toktogul to share her skills with her colleagues. Daily long hour shifts have increased her clientele base. Thus the monthly income for Sypaada is now 10000 soms. With more services offered in her salon there are more expenses. Most expenses include equipment, instruments and supplies. Sypaada plans to spend this loan mainly on buying additional instruments for the salon. Her biggest dream is to open her own beauty salon with highest quality service.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the hairdressing salon

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old single woman living with one parent and two siblings. She is from Lebanon. She has owned a chocolate shop for three years. She makes different chocolate designs for all occasions such as weddings, newborns etc. She is very talented at her work. Her business is very essential because with its income, she helps support her family.
  
Today, she is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional products needed for her business. In that way, she will be able to create new original designs which will result in attracting more customers. She is very optimistic about her future plans and willing to more expand her business operation. This will be her third Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase additional products.

loans.name: Isata M

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Isata J., who is married and has four children aged 4, 7, 9, and 15 years. In 2001, Isata established her imported assorted foodstuff business in order to generate income and help her husband provide for their family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 350,000 every month from this business.

She is now requesting a loan of Le 4,000,000 to buy more imported foodstuffs for her enterprise. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Isata plans to buy larger quantities to supply other traders, open another food stall, and generate enough income to educate her children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy various imported foodstuffs for her business.

loans.name: Bonifrida

texts.en: Bonifrida is 26 years old. She has 2 children who are 6 and 4 years old. Bonifrida owns a general store where she sells cooking oil, Vaseline, salt, soap, etc.. She works together with her husband. They have been running this business for the past 7 years. She is requesting a loan to buy more cooking oil, Vaseline, salt etc. She plans to save all her profits and use them to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items for her general store

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a single woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has owned a school where children from the neighboring village are her students. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by parents who have enrolled their children and have not paid school fees. She dreams of expanding her school in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase school chairs and tables. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase school chairs and tables.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Dedokpo Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO DEDOKPO est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Véronique (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née en 1978 au Bénin. Mariée et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés, Véronique vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Véronique assure avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Il y a près de vingt ans que Véronique fait le commerce du charbon de bois au Bénin. Cette activité l'aide en effet à subvenir à ses besoins, tout en assurant les besoins de ses enfants. C’est la deuxième fois que Véronique et son groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Véronique  ambitionne dans l'avenir construire sa propre maison.
texts.en: The "Gbenonkpo Dedokpo"  group is composed of two individuals living in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group’s representative, Veronique (raising her hadn in the photo) was born in Benin in 1978. Married and the mother of two children, both in school, Veronique lvies together with her husband and children. Veronique and her husband jointly provide for various family needs. For almost 20 years, Veronique has been selling charcoal. This business activity helps her to support herself and her children. This is the second time that Veronique and her group is seeking financing from ALIDe in order to bolster their working capital and better meet customer demand. Veronique’s goal for the future is to have her own house built.

loans.use: to buy five bags of charcoal

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José de 23 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia que solo cuenta con servicio de luz, esta ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla José  es la crianza y venta de ganado ovino, desde hace unos años el lugar donde cría  sus animales es la parte posterior de la casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y granos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados, ya que cuenta con su propia clientela en la ciudad de Piura. Adicionalmente, José cuenta con una mototaxi que la trabaja para tener más ingresos.  Esto le permite obtener mayores ganancias para cubrir sus gastos diarios. 

José solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar el alimento para sus animales, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados  para ofertarlos a un mejor precio.  José es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive porque siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos.

José tiene muchos deseos de  brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 23 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and child. The only service he receives is electricity. José resides in the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

José has been raising and selling sheep for a few years. The animals are kept in an area behind his house. Their diet consists of balanced feed and natural grasses. Once the animals have reached the ideal size and weight, José offers them for sale at different markets. He has his own customers in the city of Piura. In addition, José drives a motorcycle taxi to earn more income to help with covering daily expenses.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 PEN in order to buy feed for his animals. This will allow him to provide a good diet for his animals so that he can offer them at a better price. José is a person who is well-known in the place where he lives because he is always concerned about the welfare of others. What he desires most is to provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his animals.

loans.name: Yawoavi

texts.fr: Patronne d’un salon de coiffure (GOD IS WINNER), Yawoavi a 34ans et maman d’01 enfant. Elle désire satisfaire ses clientes en leur vendant des mèches pour les rendre encore plus belle. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Lomé et revend dans son salon. C’est une ancienne cliente de WAGES et elle est à son cinquième prêt. Son mari est gendarme et ils ont un enfant.
texts.en: The owner of a hair salon (GOD IS WINNER), Yawoavi is a 34-year-old mother of one child. She would like to satisfy her customers by selling them hair extensions for making them even more beautiful. She gets her supplies at the Lomé market and resells them in her salon. Yawoavi is a previous client of WAGES and is now on her fifth loan. Her husband is a policeman, and they have one child.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and weaves

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 32 years old, married, and they have two children aged seven and three. He operates a motorcycle transport service business at a local market in Kakamega. He has been in this business for two years now. He says the business is profitable and the only major challenge he has is the high cost of fuel. 

Francis plans to use this loan to purchase another motorcycle to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and own a fleet of motorcycles. He also has hopes of giving a quality education to his children. He describes himself as a focused person.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov is working in a restaurant. Her husband is an electric mechanic; their income is $10 per day. She has two children, 5 and 1 year old. Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, $11 on electricity, $10 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 for repairing her house. Her house is getting flooded, so she needs to repair it; otherwise, she could not have a proper place to stay with her family. Before her family used to sell fish, but she could earn so little income with her husband, she tried to find another job to do. Her current job can make quite a good income. In the future, she wants to get a small shop to sell grocery goods at home.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Freddy Alberto

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el señor Freddy Alberto  se dedica   a laborar como recibidor y entregador en una institución del estado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace seis años. Es soltero y con unas personas a su cargo que le proporciona las condiciones necesarias a su familia. 

El señor Freddy Alberto ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción tale como bloque, cemento, arena, y pago de mano de obra, para levantar  muro de frente para darle seguridad a su vivienda, por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Sr. Freddy Alberto works in the shipping and receiving department of a state institution. He has been in this job for six years. Freddy is single, but he has family that he is responsible for, so he has to provide for their needs.

He approached CEPRODEL in order to request a home improvement loan. Freddy will buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, sand, as well as pay for labor. He will build a front wall to provide security for his home and better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to build a security wall.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe is 50 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Phoebe works very hard to provide for them. Phoebe buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 19,500 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional stock of charcoal to sell. Phoebe has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Phoebe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mirzomahmad

texts.ru: Мирзомахмад проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена занимается торговлей одежды на рынке. Сам он тоже занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает продукты питания. В этой области он 15 лет. Мирзомахмад имеет высшее образование, бухгалтер. По профессии проработал 6 лет. Он берет кредит для покупки сахара, масла, муки, натуральных соков и мороженного.
texts.en: Mirzomahmad lives in the Khuroson district.  He is 42 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is involved in sales of clothing at the market.  Mirzomahmad is also involved in sales.  He primarily sells food products and has been in this business for 15 years.  Mirzomahmad has a higher education as an accountant.  He spent six years working in that field.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of sugar, oil, flour, natural juices and ice-cream.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, flour, natural juices and ice-cream

loans.name: Eudosia

texts.es: Eudoxia, de 30 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Abrahán de 33 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Giuliana de 12 y Frans de 08 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Trabajando arduamente, Eudosia ha logrado que sus chacras le brinden los productos necesarios, para mantener a su familia. Antes que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale de su casa y camina cerca de una hora para llegar a sus tierras, donde tiene sembrado plantas de cacao, café y árboles maderables, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender a distintos acopiadores. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que siente que les da un buen uso. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los costales que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar sus ingresos. Este será su sexto crédito con MFP, está muy feliz de seguir accediendo su crédito y quiere agradecer a todas las personas que harán posible que obtenga el dinero que necesita. Con el dinero contratará jornaleros para que aren la tierra.
texts.en:
Eudosia, 30, is an unassuming, hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Abrahán, 33, and their two beloved children, Giuliana, 12, and Frans, 8, who are the motivating force behind all her efforts.  

Working hard, Eudosia has managed that her fields produce the necessary products to support her family.  Before the first sun’s rays appear she leaves her house and walks nearly an hour to reach her fields where she has cocoa beans, coffee and hardwood trees planted - products that she subsequently takes to various gathering sites.  

What she most likes about her work is cultivating her fields because she feels she’s putting them to good use.  She’s been in this activity for 10 years and considers the most difficult part having to transport her products because the sacks she carries are very heavy and they tire her out quite a bit.  In time, she’d like to buy more land to increase income.

This will be her sixth MFP loan.  She is very happy to continue to access credit and wants to thank all the people who will make it possible for her to obtain the money she needs.  She will use the money to hire day laborers to till the soil.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a hardworking business woman aged 25. She is married and blessed with two children. For the last two years, she has been managing a salon to earn a living. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business.

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy hair chemicals and braids.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals and braids

loans.name: Miguel Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Carlos es casado, tiene 21 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educación primaria, aun no tiene hijos, se dedica a la fabricación de zapatos, inició este trabajo como empleados para otro negocio y ahora con su propio negocio lleva 2 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo para la compra de una maquina pegadora ya que de esa forma mejorará su productividad y por lo que puede mejorar sus ganancia, espera en el futuro tener un negocio grande.
texts.en:
21-year old Señor Miguel Carlos has four years of primary education. He doesn’t have any children yet. He earns his living making shoes. He started out as an assistant in another business and now has had his own shoe-making business for two years.

Miguel is seeking a loan to buy a sewing machine so he can improve productivity. This will lead in turn to more earnings. In the future he hopes to have a large business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Kelvin David

texts.es:
El Señor. Kelvin es socio del banco comunal El Ahorro, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, cuenta con una gran belleza natural y cultural, su amplia gastronomía cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente es amble, cordial y carismática, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

El Señor. Kelvin tiene 21 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de un año y seis meses. Su esposa se dedica al comercio, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.

Él se dedica al comercio, vende variedad de productos como ollas, cucharas, jarros, etc., se dedica a esta actividad desde que tenía 12 años y aprendió este oficio que era de su padre, trabaja ambulantemente todos los días sin un horario fijo.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  cucharas, jarros, ollas, etc. para incrementar su mercadería.

Su meta es comprarse un vehículo para el negocio.
texts.en:
Kelvin is a member of the 'El Ahorro' community bank and lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.  This is a cold-climate area which has great natural and cultural beauty.  It has a wide-ranging cuisine which delights visitors' palates.  The people are kind, friendly and charismatic.  They still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

Kelvin is 21 years old, lives with his partner, and has an 18-month-old child.  His wife is a saleswoman.  They do not own their own home but live in his in-laws' house, sharing the household expenses.

Kelvin is a salesman.  He sells a variety of products such as pans, spoons, pitchers, etc.  He has been in this business since he was 12 years old and learned the trade from his father.  He works as an itinerant vendor every day and does not work regular hours.

Kelvin has been a member of his community bank for four years and he will invest his new loan in buying spoons, pitchers, pans, etc. to increase his stock of merchandise.  His goal is to buy a vehicle for his business.

loans.use: to buy spoons, pitchers, pans, etc.

loans.name: Raga

texts.en:
Raga is married and has four children. She is 42 years old and resides in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Raga operates a business venture in fish-selling in her barangay (village) to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to purchase new equipment and tools.

Raga has been a member of GDMPC for nearly one year. Raga's plan is to finish the studies of her children and to gain double income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 57 años de edad, esta acompañado con dos hijos.

Él aprendo los trabajos de la agricultura, desde los 14 años de edad. Fue su padre quien le enseño, ya que era esta la manera en que se ganaban la vida.

Don Juan compra los insumos agrícolas en una ciudad del oriente del país, para esto el debe caminar a pie durante treinta minutos hasta llegar a la calle pavimentada, donde aborda un vehiculo (pick up) durante cuarenta minutos hasta llegar al lugar donde compra los insumos agrícolas.

Don Juan esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 12 sacos de abono, 80 libras de semilla, 15 litros de insecticidas, entre otros insumos para sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz bajo riego  por gravedad (sistema a través del cual se dispersa el agua para regar los cultivo, sin usar dispositivos solo por la gravedad, se busca una pendiente para derramar el agua y que esta busque su cause, atravesando todo el cultivo).

Al comprar los insumos de una sola vez, don Juan estará seguro de dar a sus cultivos un manejo adecuado y a tiempo; esto permitirá que su producción aumente y también sus ingresos,  asegurando la alimentación de su familia y cancelar su préstamo a tiempo.

Don Juan espera proporcionarles el estudio a sus hijos, para que ellos estudien en la universidad y puedan graduarse.
texts.en:
Señor Juan is 57 years old and has 2 children.

He learned how to farm when he was 14 years old. He was taught by his father who made a living by farming.

Don Juan buys his consumables in a city to the west of the country. To get there he has to walk for 30 minutes to get to the paved highway where he boards a pick-up and travels 40 minutes to get to where he buys his agricultural supplies. 

Don Juan is asking Fundacion Campo for a loan to buy 12 sacks of manure, 80lbs of seed, 15 litres of insecticide and other items to allow him to sow 14,000 square metres of corn with a gravity watering system ( a watering system which disperses water to the crops without storage tanks using only gravity, as the water seeks to flow downhill naturally and so waters the entire crop).

By buying the items at the same time, Don Juan will be certain of providing his crops with adequate and timely care. This will give him a bigger yield and income and guarantee his being able to provide food for his family and make the repayment of his loan on time.

Don Juan hopes to provide his children with an education so that they are able to attend university and graduate.

loans.use: to buy 12 sacks of manure, 80lbs of seed, 15 litres of insecticide and other consumables.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is 27 years old and a married man with one child. He lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with his family.

Alejandro has been engaged in seaweed farming for two years. He also sells fish to add to his income.

Alejandro has requested this 4,000 PHP loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw and wooden poles necessary for seaweed farming. He hopes to buy a fishing boat and start his own fishing business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw line and wooden poles.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es: Nicanor de 33 años casado con julia de 33 años, que fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Monterrico del distrito de Sivia. Cuando Las necesidades se hicieron constantes en la vida de Nicanor desde el momento que contrajo matrimonio con su adorada julia ellos aún no contaban con ningún bien, menos tenían suficiente economía, es donde ambos decidieron trabajar con el único fin de ver crecer su estatus familiar, al principio trabajaron de peones en las tierras de cultivo de sus vecinos sembrando y cosechando café, que después de un tiempo tuvieron su primer hijo quien les lleno de satisfacción y las ganas de seguir trabajando con més entusiasmo. De un tiempo adquirió un pequeño capital que le sirvió para comprarse una pequeña parcela de terreno agrícola donde ahora se dedican juntamente con su esposa en el cultivo de café y árboles maderables, ellos están contento con los logros que vienen obteniendo. Este será su tercer credito con MFP, por el que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente su tercera cuota. Con los 500 nuevos soles Nicanor comprará abono orgánico para fertilizar su campo agrícola de café
texts.en: Nicanor is 33 years old, married with Julia, has three children, and they all live in their own home in the Monterrico community, Sivia district. When his needs became constant after marrying his beloved Julia they had no resources to count on. They did not have enough money either and decided to begin working in order to improve their family's conditions. First they began working as farmers in neighbor's crops sewing and growing coffee beans. Soon after, they had their first child who brought them much satisfaction and a stronger enthusiasm to continue working. At one time he was able to have the funds to buy a small plot of land where he and his wife now grow coffee beans and timber-yielding trees. They are happy with the achievements they are accomplishing. This will be their third loan with MFP with which he commits to punctually cancelling his third payment. Nicanor will use the 500 Peruvian Soles loan to buy organic fertilizer for his coffee bean crops.

loans.use: buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Kwayedza Group

texts.en:
This is 57-year-old Entineth from Machipisa, a high-density surbub in Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. She is a single mother of two children.

Entineth runs a business of selling clothes that she buys from local shops as well as from Zambia. The business has been in operation for three years. She says the main challenges she faces are low business activity due the mid-month and competition from established shops. 

Entineth has requested a loan of $400 to buy clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of her family. 

In the future Entineth plans to be operating a big and well-stocked clothing shop in the city center.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking and patient mother. She is 57 years old and has sent all three of her children to school. They are now living separately from her. Through the income from her retail business, she provided their allowances when they were still completing their studies. 

Lilia still generates income from her business and would like to keep improving it, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, and vegetables to sell. She promise to pay her loan on time and use it well for further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Batbileg

texts.en: Batbileg wants to assist his younger brother to pay his school fee. His younger brother Erdenbaatar studies as a human resource manager in Mongolian State University of Education. Erdenebaatar has a plan to establish his own human-resource agency which is a professional job. He needs to graduate from school successfully first. It is one of his biggest wishes and plans of life he said. Therefore, his good brother Batbileg is taking a loan to assist his younger brother in paying his school fees so he can successfully graduate.

loans.use: to assist his younger brother in paying his school fees

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et mènent leurs activités dans le même marché. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pierrette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pierrette est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Pierrette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pierrette est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Gilbert. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Pierrette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Pierrette vend depuis huit ans, des friperies dans un marché du Bénin. Pierrette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Pierrette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
DIEU EST GRAND Group is made up of three persons who live in the same neighborhood and run their businesses at the same marketplace. This is the third time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group's representative, named Pierrette, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 38 years old, lives in Benin, and is married to a tailor named Gilbert. The couple has three school-attending children to support.

Pierrette lives together with her husband and children. The couple covers the various household expenses together. Pierrette never attended school. In order to cover the various family expenses, she's been selling secondhand clothing in one of Benin's markets for eight years.

She gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets. Eager to satisfy her customers and to increase her revenue and income, Pierrette, together with the other members of the group is seeking a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing

loans.name: La Chilana Group

texts.en:
The members of La Chilana Group are the heads of the families living in that Mexican village, who have decided to improve their living conditions by accessing, for the first time, to a basic electricity service with the installation of Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in their houses. Funding is asked for financing the 53% of the cost of those SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that these farmers pay for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

Adela is the woman standing second from the left in the picture. She is a housewife of 35 years old, married, with 2 children of 14 and 12 years old. The SSHS installed in her home will provide all her family with an electricity service during the next 20 years, approximately, that allows them to have 4 additional hours of lighting to use in increasing their productivity, but especially Adela's children to do their homework.

loans.use: for paying PV systems installed in their houses.

loans.name: Noemi Del Rosario

texts.es:
Noemi, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, está casada, su esposo trabaja como albañil y son padres de tres jóvenes que están estudiando.

Noemi, tiene dos años de tener venta de productos básicos, este negocio decidió colocarlo porque solo su esposo era el que trabajaba y necesitaban más ingresos y fue por esa razón que decidió colocar una tienda y su horario es de 6 de la mañana a las 7 de la noche.

Noemi, necesita el préstamo para comprar frijoles, sodas, jugos, arroz, condimento, azúcar y jabón; el crédito le ayudará para surtir más su tienda.

Los sueños de Noemi son, que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos se prepare academicamente, para que en un futuro tengan mejores oportunidades.

loans.use: para comprar frijoles, sodas, jugos, arroz, condimento, azúcar y jabón; el crédito le ayudará para surtir más su tienda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan would like to buy shares from the stock exchange market.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.en:
My business is located near the public hospital in my country. Many people go to this hospital which helps me sell more in order to support my family. I now need to buy a greater variety of high-quality food so that I can increase my income even more.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi negocio esta ubicado cerca del hospital publico de mi pais, y es bastante las personas que lo visitan, lo que me ayuda a tener buenas ventas para apoyar a mi familia. Ahora necesito surtir mi negocio con producto de calidad, variado y bueno para poder mejorar mis ingresos aun mas.

loans.use: To buy candy, churros, water, soft drinks, and other food

loans.name: Vali

texts.en:
Vali has 4 years  of experience in this business . He is 51 years old and an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan ,Fizuli region, settled in Makhmudlu village,. He is married and  has 3 children.
Now he needs a loan of $950 to buy a cow.
He plans to produce milk, cheese and to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Kim-Heak

texts.en: Kim-heak was married in 1977 and has 3 children. She is currently in the business of planting and selling flowers in the village. She started this business in 1993. Her husband also farms in the village. He has a tractor and contracts himself out to prepare land for villagers from one village to the next, so that he can generate extra income for the family. She has borrowed loans from MAXIMA twice. The current loan amount is $1,000. She will use this loan to repair the house. She has the ability to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: To repair the house.

loans.name: Betty Emerita

texts.en:
Mrs. Betty is 25 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in the district of la Peca, Province of Bagua, Department of Amazonas. She is a member of the Communal Bank of Las Bagüinas and sells fruits for a living. She started her own business in order to be in control of her own income and to improve her quality of life and that of her family. The business is growing more every day, which allows her to cover all the necessities for her and her family. In the future, she is aiming to acquire her own kiosk and she is working hard in order to accomplish that goal, so she can employ other people. With a recent loan for S/. 500.00 (Approximately US$160.00) obtained from Manuela Ramos, she will purchase a larger amount of fruits such as apples, grapes, peaches, pears, oranges in boxes and by the hundreds. She is also into the production of extract from NONI (fruit with healing attributes) among others. Her business requires her to be well supplied in order to satisfy the needs of her customers from the surrounding area, considering that she receives weekly purchasing orders from public organizations and from villagers from nearby districts.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Betty tiene 25 años, vive con su cónyuge y una hija en el distrito de La Peca, Provincia de Bagua, Departamento de Amazonas. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Bagüinas y se dedica a la venta de frutas, inició su negocio para manejar sus propios ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia. El negocio esta creciendo cada vez más, lo cual le permite cubrir sus necesidades tanto de ella y de su familia. Para el futuro quiere tener un kiosco propio, para lo cual está trabajando bastante, y de esta manera llegar a cumplir su objetivo y así poder dar trabajo a otras personas. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 500.00 (US$ 160.00 aprox.) comprará más cantidad de frutas como manzanas, uvas, duraznos, peras, naranjas en cajas y cientos. También se dedica a la producción de extracto de NONI (fruta curativa) entre otros, ya que necesita tener su negocio bien surtido para atender a sus clientes de la misma localidad, pues tiene pedidos semanales de entidades publicas y de pobladores de los distritos aledaños.

loans.use: Buying fruits for wholesale.

loans.name: Thi Dung

texts.vi: Cô Dung trồng khá nhiều loại rau.Hàng ngày cô thường đi chợ bán rau, chồng cô đi làm thợ xây. Ngoài ra cô còn chăn nuôi thêm lợn, bò.Cô chưa từng vay  vốn ở đâu vì ngại thủ tục rườm rà.Tuy nhiên, khi có chương trình tài chính vi mô, cô đã vay để mua thêm 1 con bò. Hiện tại nhà cô có 5 con bò nái.Thu nhập hàng ngày từ rau , cô có thể hoàn trả dần, còn lại cô đầu tư vào nuôi bò và lợn.

loans.use: Having loans for poultry

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mrs. Meas M., age 33, works selling grocery products at home, earning around $4 each day in revenue. Her husband is a teacher, earning around $4 each day. They have four students who are students. She would like to request a loan of $700 in order to purchase 15 piglets to raise and buy feed for her livestock supplies.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Central A (I) Group

texts.en:
Christine is 48 years old and married with three children. She is a poultry farmer. She wants to use the extra profits to construct another poultry house, purchase more chicks and pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Amarilis Del Carmen

texts.en:
Amarilis has been a member of the “La Kantuta” community bank for two years. In the community bank, she has learned how to avoid sickness, the importance of punctuality and responsibility, and, above all, to save. Amarilis mentioned that she enjoys the bank meetings, particularly sharing ideas, experiences, and conversation.

Amarilis is 30 years old. She is married and has a two-year-old son. By profession, Amarilis is a teacher, but she currently sells clothing to friends and family. For the past two years, she has been traveling to the cities of Lima and Puno to buy the clothing, which she then sells in Ayacucho. In addition, Amarilis manages phone booths located in several areas around the city. She has had this business for eight months. She is also planning to open a chicken restaurant in a rented building near her home.

Amarilis needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy an oven, decorations, and tablecloths.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Amarilis plans to use her savings to build her home. Her dream is to own a home, establish her businesses, have stability, and to raise her son with as much love as possible.

loans.use: Amarilis needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy an oven, decorations, and tablecloths.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en: Parviz was born in 1975. He is married, and has 2 children, and has settled in Baku city in Azerbijan. Parviz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory in the Agdam region of Azebaijan. Nine years ago he started a taxi businesss. Now he is requesting a loan of $600 to buy the spare parts to maintain the taxi.

loans.use: To buy the spare parts to maintain taxi

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a forty-year-old married father of a three-year-old son. His wife is a seamstress. Eric has been selling auto parts of different kinds for over twelve years. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase more clutch disks and pressure plates from Canada and Korea. In Ghana there are no auto parts stores, but there is a high demand for parts as the taxi networks are the main transportation option. His stand operates in an area of Accra called Abossey-Okai that is a conglomeration of hundreds of entrepreneurs who each sell specific auto parts.

Eric hopes the loan proceeds help him increase his sales volume and profits so that he can continue saving for his son’s school fees.

Eric is a member of the lending group Respect. The lending group works as a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: Eric would like to buy more clutch disks and pressure plates for his store.

loans.name: Mirzonazir

texts.ru:
Mirzonazir Abdulazizovich N. lives in Abdurahmon Jomi district with his family. He is married and has two children. After finishing school, Mirzonazir started a business selling cattle. He buys calves, fattens them up and then sells them to butchers. He has been in this business for six years, and it brings him a modest income that allows him to feed his family. However, in order to increase his income, Mirzonazir needs a loan to buy a few more calves. He will fatten them up and sell them for meat, allowing him to provide the local markets with high quality meat. Mirzonazir plans to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Назаров Мирзоназир Абдулазизович живет в районе Абдурахмони Джоми.Проживает со своей семьей. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. Закончил школу и занялся бизнесом. Торгует бычками. Предварительно скупив , он их откармливает и продает мясникам на мясо. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже шесть лет. Эта деятельность приносит ему небольшой доход , который позволяет ему прокормить свою семью. Но для того . чтобы увеличить доход он хочет получить кредит и купить еще несколько молодых телят. Он их откормит и так же продаст на мясо, что позволит ему обеспечить рынки полноценным мясом. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase his number of head

loans.name: Marcelino Pascual

texts.es:
Mr. Marcelino has run a livestock business for many years which he has used to support his wife and three small children. Since he began his business, he has worked hard to use his earnings to sustain his home and his livestock business has helped him to achieve his goals.

Currently, he needs to purchase more livestock in order to grow his business. Intelligently, he is seeking a loan from Ceprodel in order to acquire additional animals to offer in his neighborhood of San Rafael del Sur in Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Marcelino se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de ganadería con el cual alimenta a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y tres pequeños hijos. Desde sus inicios en el negocio se ha esforzado para llevar siempre el sustento a su hogar y lo ha logrado gracias a sus múltiples esfuerzos en el trabajo ganadero.

Actualmente la necesidad que atraviesa el señor Marcelino es que le urge la compra del ganado para su respectiva comercialización. Es por esta razón que muy inteligentemente busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual adquirir los animales para luego ofrecerlos en su sector de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Affiwavi Kafui

texts.fr:
Mrs. A. Affiwavi Kafui was born on March 27, 1981 in Agoè. She is married and has one child. She did not pursue a higher education, choosing instead to complete a course in secretarial computer services. In 2007 she opened a small business office, equipped with a computer, and started offering her secretarial services. This service is limited to word processing as her photocopier has broken down. This is Mrs. A.'s first loan and she is requesting it to purchase a new “Sharp” photocopier.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 27mars 1981 à Agoè, madame A. Affiwavi Kafui est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle n’a pas fait de grandes études. Dès qu’elle abandonne les études elle a fait une formation en informatique bureautique. Ainsi elle a ouvert en 2007 un petit bureau équipé d’ordinateur qui lui permet de faire des prestations de services bureautiques. Cette prestation se limite essentiellement au traitement de texte car sa photocopieuse est tombée en panne. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir une nouvelle photocopieuse de marque sharp.

loans.use: Purchase of a Photocopier.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou D., age 51, is a widow and the mother of 5 children, out of which she has to support four. She's been a member of the Manguiline Kadiamor village bank for 7 years. She wants to strengthen her business of transforming seafood. Fatou purchases shrimps in Pointe Saint-Georges, transform them, and resell them in Dakar. In doing so, she improves the living conditions of her family and support her four student children. She's seeking a loan that will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatou D., 51 ans est veuve et mère de 05 enfants dont 04 à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Kadiamor depuis7 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de transformation de produits halieutiques. Fatou achète des crevettes à la Pointe Saint George, les transforme elle même et les revend à Dakar pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et soutenir ses quatre enfants qui sont étudiants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Transformation and reselling of seafood

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 49 years old, is married and has five children. He owns a home decoration shop in the city of Tripoli, Northern Lebanon. Ahmad sculpts beautiful wooden decorations for the home.

This is the first time Ahmad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs a loan of $US1,200 to purchase a new machine to sculpt wood and thereby improve his business.

loans.use: Purchase a new machine to sculpt the wood

loans.name: Leutu

texts.en: Leutu F., 41, is married with 2 children. She has many years of experience in a taro plantation business. She sells to the villagers 4 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 320 Tala (approximately 133 USD). SPBD loans are Leutu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband and children will do the farming.

loans.use: To purchase taro tubers, weed killer, pesticides, chemicals and a shovel

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu is 36 years old and married to O., who is a roadside mechanic. They have five children. The family lives in Abulegba area of Lagos state, Nigeria. Idowu sells drinks and she has been in this business for the past three years. She buys drinks in crates and then sells through retail to her customers. Idowu needs the loan amount of 140,000 Naira to buy more crates of drinks to sell. Idowu says thank you to all Kiva lenders for putting smiles on the faces of people.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has a gift shop near her home where she sells costumes, paper goods, and gift items. She began over ten years ago making costumes for school events. She has expanded her goods to included stationery and other products.

While Ruth initially began the business to help her husband provide for the family, she is now a widow and the store is her primary source of income. Her three children are now aged 20, 22, and 24. With the loan she hopes to buy additional items to sell for the Christmas season.

loans.use: additional items to sell for the Christmas season

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia es soltera, de 48 años de edad, tiene 2 hijas, una es profesional y la otra esta estudiando en la universidad; trabaja como conserje, alquila un pequeño cuarto para vivir con sus hijas, esta incerta en los proyectos del INVUR y la Alcaldia, y ha logrado la construccion de una vivienda, sin embargo no esta finalizada , está solicitando su credito numero 5 para poder comprar ventanas de metal y vidrio y anexar las berjas, en el futuro cuando su hija halla terminado sus estudios y encuentre un trabajo ayudara a su mamá a ampliar un poco mas la vivienda.  Antonia sueña con ver su casita con comodidades para sus hijas, pues es el patrimonio que les dejara.
texts.en:
Antonia is single, is 48, and has 2 daughters. One is a professional and one is studying in college. She works as a receptionist. She rents a small room to live in with her daughters, which is located in the INVUR and city projects. She has succeeded in having a home constructed, but it still isn't completed. She is requesting her fifth credit to purchase windows of metal and glass and to attach bars to them. In the future when her daughter has finished school and has found a job, she will help her mother expand the home a little more. Antonia dreams about seeing her home with comforts for her daughters since it is the inheritance that she will leave them.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of windows and bars

loans.name: Alba Esperanza

texts.es:
Doña Alba Esperanza G. P. tiene la edad de 61 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Alba no tiene hijos solo tiene 1 nieto a su cargo de la edad de 17 años y cursa el 4 año de secundaria, Doña Alba no tiene compañero de vida, los propósitos de Doña Alba son de mantener su negocio activo para que este le siga generando ingresos a pesar del incremento de la gasolina ya que tiene que recorrer las calles en busca de pasajeros los sueños de Doña Alba son de adquirir otra unidad de transporte para que su nieto lo administre y pueda obtener experiencia en este tipo de negocio y este sea otro medio de trabajo y así pueda mantenerse para el día de mañana sus deseos son  que  el nivel de vida del país mejore ya que la ayuda de muchos países donantes son importante ya que son los refuerzos de las personas que realmente lo necesitan.

La actividad económica son los servicios de taxi, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 4 años, Doña Alba inicia este negocio como una alternativa de generar ingresos y este servicio de taxi lo obtuvo al vender un negocio de granos básicos que poseía en el mercado del mayoreo en Managua conocido como el Bisne y por medio de los financiamientos que también fueron  necesarios para este negocio al principio Doña Alba no poseía muchos conocimientos de este tipo de negocio y así la persona quien se encargaba de prestarle los servicios como chofer le entregaba poco dinero y de esta forma no le proporcionaba ganancias y con el apoyo de su familia logran designar a una persona confiable para este cargo y es así que por medio del tiempo transcurrido alcanza la experiencia en este negocio pero todavía necesita un financiamiento propuesto para capital de trabajo para proporcionarle mejoras a la unidad de trabajo como seria el cambio de radiador, llantas entre otras cosas y reconoce la ayuda de la Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alba Esperanza G. P. is a single, 61 years old woman. She has no children, just one nephew in her care that is 17 years old and in his 4th year of secondary school. Alba doesn't have a partner in life. Her purpose is to keep her business active so that it continues to earn her income in spite of the increase in the cost of gas, now that she has to go through the streets looking for passengers. Alba hopes to acquire another vehicle so that her nephew can manage it and get experience in this type of business. That way, he'll have another means of work so he can help himself in the days to come.
