Ya tiene parte de los materiales, pero necesita comprar el cemento y el pago del albañil que le hara el trabajo.  Espera poder contar con el apoyo de la institucion para poder llevar su proyecto a cabo.
texts.en: Martha, 42, is married and has four children who are 16, 14, 12 and 10 years of age.  She works as a merchant in Santo Domingo.  She’s asking for her first home improvement loan to erect a wall that’s in poor shape because she fears that an accident could happen at any moment.  She already has part of the materials but needs to buy cement and pay the bricklayer who will do the work.  She hopes to get support from the institution to be able to carry out her project.

loans.use: to erect a wall.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia es una persona muy trabajadora, ella solicito el crédito para cambiar las paredes de su casa ya  que  están construidas de lamina  y  desea hacerlas  de  ladrillos ya  que  la  temporada  de invierno se  acerca y ella se  preocupa   por el  bienestar  de  sus  hijos, quiere  protegerlos  de los  cambios  climáticos y de  las enfermedades que  esto puede  ocacionar, agradece el apoyo brindado  para la realización de su proyecto.
texts.en: Patricia is a very hardworking person. She requested a loan to renovate the walls of her house. They are currently made of aluminum sheeting and she wants to rebuild them from bricks. The winter season is approaching and she is concerned over the well-being of her children. She wants to protect them from the changes in climate and from illnesses that can result. She is thankful for the support provided in helping her realize her project.

loans.use: to rebuild her house walls with bricks.

loans.name: Muterian

texts.en:
Muterian is 46 years old and is married with five children. He has been farming on his piece of land for the past 15 years.

He has applied for his third loan with KADET LTD to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer, and to buy more animals. He has been a good client. He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand his farm.

Muterian hopes to make a profit and use it to re-invest in other businesses. He is a persevering man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer, and to buy more animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sodas, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Abdumannon

texts.ru: Абдуманнон проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена занимается торговлей. Сам Абдуманнон занимается изготовлением и продажей трубы для печи. В этом ему помогает его сын. Целью получения кредита является закуп сырья для изготовления.
texts.en: Abdumannon lives in the city of Istaravshan.  He is 43 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is involved in sales.  Abdumannon is involved in manufacturing and selling oven pipes.  His son helps him in this business.  The goal of obtaining this loan is the purchase of raw materials for manufacturing.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Ray

texts.en:
Ray is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Foailuga. She is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Ray owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means of generating revenue, her main source of income is selling fried foods in the local community.  Ray has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 600 WST per month from these activities.

In 2011, Ray joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ray is requesting her first loan from SPBD, in the amount of 1000 WST. She will use the loan to purchase freezers such as mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, foam cups and cooking utensils. Ray plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, foam cups and cooking utensils

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en: Mrs. Davaa, 45 is a seamstress in a company which makes clothes. She has been working as a seamstress for over 20 years. She started her job at this company in 2003. During the past 20 years she had made very many kinds of outfits for sale. Davaa lives with her husband and her 2 children in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She decided to run her own leather clothes shop beyond her job or on her days-off. It is important and beneficial to increase her family income for serving her family necessities in enough. Initially she needs to build her working capital and buy equipments such as a sewing machine for leather material. She is planning to purchase the new sewing machine which is made in Japan. It costs about MNT 1.500.000 in the market. Therefore she is taking a loan to purchase the sewing machine to start the new business beyond her job.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to start a new business beyond her job.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 29-year-old woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food items in Kator, South Sudan, for two years. Joyce is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread and tomatoes to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a structure to house her business.

loans.use: to purchase bread and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a 40-year-old, married woman with three children, two of whom are in school.  She has had a business selling food in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Loice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase cabbages and rice.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase cabbages and rice to sell.

loans.name: Bon Coeur Plus Group

texts.en:
Marie is the leader of the Community Bank named “Bon Coeur Plus". It is composed of 26 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Marie is 58 years old and divorced. She is a mother of five children aged between 31 and 44 years old. She sells miscellaneous goods. She has been active in her business since 2001. She began her business selling miscellaneous goods. She joined a group of Hope (a DRCongo Microfinance Program) in order to achieve her dream of one day developing an orchard of fruit trees and a field of manioc.

loans.use: to buy her goods in larger quantities.

loans.name: Amira's Group

texts.en:
Amira is a member of this group from Iraq. Amira is 36 years old widow mother of three children. Amira started her sewing business five years ago with an old sewing machine. She lives in rent house with her children.
She is requesting this (Qard Hassan ) loan that Izdiharona provide for divorced and widow women to buy embroidery machine  and iron  to help her increase her income.
She aims to open big place for her business and create jobs for other women.
The story of Amira and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients .
They preferred to blur their face to cultural reason.

loans.use: A portion of Amira's Group $ 3,000 loan is to buy embroidery machine and iron.

loans.name: Alpa

texts.en:
Alpa is 29 years old and has four children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Alpa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Alpa has been farming rice for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alpa would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Juan Virgilio

texts.es:
Juan Virgilio es un hombre de 40 años de edad es soltero con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 6 y 17 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad del barrio choacruz.

Juan Virgilio es un padre de familia muy responsable, lleva 8 años de dedicarse a la agricultura con esta actividad mantiene a su familia, gracias al empeño que le dedica a su cultivo todos los años obtiene una muy buena cosecha, y con el afán de incrementar esta época su cultivo, ha decidido solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra cebollines por cuerda. Él espera poder fortalecer su negocio  y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de cebollines por cuerda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to pay secondary school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en: Vladimir B. is 60 years old and has lived in the village of Pruteni as the town's mestre de limb (literally master of wood) for 40 years.  He uses his skills to make anything someone would need out of wood, whether this consists of using his trade to make different kinds of furniture, doors or window frames he can make it all. Like any Moldovan living in a village he also has many different animals around his house which he uses for his own personal use. He would like a loan to purchase wood and have it milled down so he can use it in his shop to have a steady supply.

loans.use: To purchase wood and have it milled into usable wood to use for his trade as a carpenter.

loans.name: Afi Ayoko

texts.en:
Born in 1980, Afi Ayoko K. is married and the mother of two. In addition, she also takes care of another child from her sister, who was killed in an accident. Her husband works primarily as a specialty fisherman. Because of very difficult conditions at home, she has been compelled to work to help cover household expenses. That is why she started selling basic food items. Given the flood of customer demands, she tried turning to loan sharks for help. But they made her situation worse with their exorbitant interest rates. And so she is requesting a loan of $800 as capital to stock and to transport food items, in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Née en 1980 Madame K. Afi Ayoko est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a à sa charge, en plus de ses propres enfants, un (01) autre enfant de sa sœur décédée suite à un accident. L’activité principale de son mari est la pêche artisanale. Les conditions de vie étant très difficile dans le ménage, madame KAOWO a été contrainte de se lancer dans une activité génératrice de revenu afin de pouvoir contribuer aux charges du ménage. C’est ainsi qu’elle entreprit la vente des produits alimentaires de première nécessité. Vu la demande de la clientèle qui ne cesse d’affluer, elle tenta de faire recours aux usuriers, ce qui l’a ruinée d’avantage car le taux était exorbitant. Elle sollicite donc aujourd’hui un crédit de $800 afin de pouvoir constituer un fonds de commerce pour l’approvisionnement, le transport et le stockage de ses produits pour pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying, transporting, stocking, and selling basic food items

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a widow with two children. Her husband died of cancer. Nataliya’s daughter is divorced and her son is in prison. Despite these hardships in life, Nataliya has managed to run a successful small business selling sells toys and clothing in the local market and support her family. Currently, she has two vending facilities which bring in good profits.

Loans from Nadiya Ukraine have helped the growth of Nataliya’s business. She purchased a vending stall and has been able to offer a better assortment of inventory as a result of loan capital. She has requested a new loan that will give her more working capital to use in developing her business. We believe her ability to make profitable sales and ensure that her products are chosen in response to the needs of her customers will help Nataliya boost her sales and succeed in her trade.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Columba

texts.es:
Columba considers herself a very honest, hardworking, and nice person. She is married and her husband is a merchant. They have 3 children. She began her business because her husband used to be a security guard, and the salary he received wasn’t enough to support the family. Little by little, they got together some capital. Then her husband came down with a heart condition, and he could no longer work. They decided to invest their capital by buying small commercial properties and then renting them out. This was due to a stroke of good luck, because a friend of her husband’s offered them a piece of land at a good price and they were able to buy it. They began by building one small property and with the rent they received from that, they continued building. They now have 4 properties.

Columba is requesting a loan of $550.00 to remodel and make some repairs at one of their properties. They would also like to put a bathroom in another building, because it doesn’t have one. She offers to repay the loan in 5 months. She thanks you for your support in helping her to maintain this business and provide good service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Columba se considera una mujer muy honesta, trabajadora y simpática, esta casada y su esposo es comerciante, ellos tienen 3 hijos, ella inició su negocio por que su esposo antes era vigilante y el sueldo que percibía no les alcanzaba para mantener a su familia y poco a poco juntaron un capital y su esposo enfermo del corazón, así que ya no podía trabajar, por ello invirtieron su capital en la compra de locales comerciales pequeños para luego rentarlos, y todo fue por oportunidad, ya que el amigo de su esposo les ofreció un terreno a un buen precio y pudieron adquirirlo, iniciaron construyendo un localcito y con la renta del mismo continuaron construyendo y a la fecha ya tienen 4 locales.

Columba ahora esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 550 para remodelar y darle mantenimiento a sus locales, así como construirle el baño a uno de los locales que le hace falta, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Ella agradece mucho tu apoyo para continuar manteniendo su negocio y brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: To remodel and make repairs to her business properties

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah owns the Mirembe Drug and Clinic Shop. Her business is the only one of its kind in the area. This is important for her over-the-counter medicines and her advice is essential to the health care of the villagers. Although her stock is limited, she takes great care in making sure that she keeps needed health care items in her inventory.

Sarah has operated her business for 7 years and she has been a member of her lending group for the same period of time. She is married with 5 children and she is 40 years old. She is a very kind and gentle person who cares deeply about her community. Her dream is to complete the building of her house and to make sure that her children get a good education. With her loan she plans to add to her health care products.

loans.use: To add to her health care products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her clothes and shoes business.

loans.name: Kabowa 1(A) Group

texts.en:
The group has been together for one year. Each memeber has their own current businesses and reasons for acquiring loans. Florence has a poultry farm; Dorothy has a saloon business; Sumaya sells raw foods; Fiona sells crafts. Harriet, the group leader, is 40 years old. She sells raw foods in the market. She intends to use the extra profits to construct a house and pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more raw foods, thus expand business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in his rice crop/harvest.

loans.name: Veasna

texts.en:
Mr. Veasna P. and his wife, Yin Sam, have been married since 1991. They have three children; two sons and one daughter, two of whom are employed full time. The other is in school. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Mr. Veasna has been a motor taxi driver for two years. He carries people around Phnom Penh City. His wife has been a garment factory worker over ten years.

Mr. Veasna is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $1200 to repair his house.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Sadatu

texts.en:
Sadatu is forty two years old and the mother of two children, who are currently in school. She prepares and sells “Tuo Zaafi” (a local dish prepared from maize and cassava flour). It is a popular food in the Northern Regions of Ghana and also a delicacy for most Ghanaians. Sadatu wants to use her loan to buy more bags of maize, assorted meat, dry fish, vegetables, spices, etc. to prepare her food.

She is a member of the group called “Baa Meyi” (meaning no one is bigger than God). Members use group guarantee principle on members to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: Sadatu would like to buy more bags of maize, assorted meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Bunneang

texts.en:
Mrs. Bunneang K. and her husband, Mr. Ngoun Men were married in 1985 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. Two of their children have full time employment and other two children are in school. Mr. Ngoun Men has been a taxi driver since 1979. He drives in Phnom Penh and other provinces. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Bunneang has been in the business of selling groceries for three years. She bought grocery items from the Ta Khmao Market to resell at her shop in front of her house. The shop is very old and broken so she needs some money to rebuild it. Now she is requesting a loan of US$600 to rebuild her shop to sell grocery items.

loans.use: To rebuild her shop for selling grocery items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy body cream

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
The group Progreso consists of 15 members, all women, who meet in the house of Ms Doris M. located on pagador street.

They meet every Thursday afternoon in accordance with their weekly plan.

Name of member, Activity, Sex, Years in the field

B. H. KARL., Beauty product sales, Female, 4

C. C. CARMEN JEANETH, Sale of masitas and sandwiches, Female, 3

F. G. MARTHA, Food sales, Female, 10

F. M. CONCEPCIÓN, Sale of rellenos and food, Femalwe, 25

F. V. GLORIA DEYSI, Sale of enlozados, Female, 30

G. V. PAULINA, Sale of varieties, Female, 4

I. G. MARIA JOSE, Sale of masitas, Female, 5

L. M. FABIANA ELVIRA, Sale of products, Female, 3

M. B. DORIS, Craftwork, Female, 5

M. Y. MARIA ELENA, Sale of products, Female, 5

O. P. CLAUDIA ELIZABETH, Sale of fabrics and masitas, Female, 10

B. A. IVONE MABEL, Baking and masitas, Female, 12

T. G. JHENNY CLAUDIA, Sale of cosmetics, Female, 2

T. P. LUISA ANGELICA, Sale of varieties, Female, 10

Z. D. L. B. ANA LOURDES, Sale of varieties, Female, 30

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

El grupo Progreso consta D. 15 integrantes siendo el 100% mujeres, se reunen en L. casa D. L. señora Doris M. ubicado en L. calle pagador.

Se reunen todos los días jueves por L. tarD. D. acuerdo a su plan semanal.

Nombre del socio Actividad Sexo Años en el Rubro

B. H. KARL. VENTA D. PRODUCTOS D. BELLEZA Femenino 4

C. C. CARMEN JEANETH VENTA D. MASITAS Y TORTAS Femenino 3

F. G. MARTHA VENTA D. COMIDAS Femenino 10

F. M. CONCEPCIÓN VENTA D. RELLENOS Y COMIDA Femenino 25

F. V. GLORIA DEYSI VENTA D. ENLOZADOS Femenino 30

G. V. PAULINA VENTA D. VARIEDADES Femenino 4

I. G. MARIA JOSE VENTA D. MASITAS Femenino 5

L. M. FABIANA ELVIRA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS Femenino 3

M. B. DORIS ELABORACIÓN D. ARTESANIAS Femenino 5

M. Y. MARIA ELENA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS Femenino 15

O. P. CLAUDIA ELIZABETH VENTA D. TEJIDOS Y MASITAS Femenino 10

B. A. IVONE MABEL ELABORACIÓN E MASITAS Femenino 12

T. G. JHENNY CLAUDIA VENTA D. COSMETICOS Femenino 2

T. P. LUISA ANGELICA VENTA D. VARIEDADES Femenino 10

Z. D. L. B. ANA LOURDES VENTA D. VARIEDADES Femenino 30

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Massan V., age 39, is married and the mother of 3 children. She's a fish reseller in Avetonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, she'd like to meet customer demand by buying more fish and ingredients. In doing so, she will increase her profits to better support her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Massan V. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de poissons à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite par ce crédit satisfaire la demande de la clientèle en achetant beaucoup plus de poissons et des ingrédients. Ce faisant elle dégagera plus de bénéfices pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy more fish and ingredients

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 8 años, su esposo es comerciante. Ella inició el negocio por la necesidad de apoyar en el gasto familiar, siempre le han gustado las ventas, por lo cual se dedico a esto, empezó vendiendo joyería entre su amigos y conocidos y poco a poco fue haciendo una cartera de clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así poder cumplir unos pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Francisca is married and has two children who are ten and eight years old. Her husband is a salesman. She started the business to help with household expenses. She has always liked sales and for that reason started selling jewelry to her friends and acquaintances and little by little built a client base. She needs a loan for US$575, which she will repay in six months, to buy merchandise and thereby be able to fill orders that she has pending.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Farheen

texts.en: Farheen baji, the wife of B. A., has lived in an area of Lahore, Pakistan named Yadgar for the last 22 years. She is the mother of two preschool-aged daughters. Farheen baji's husband, who has made lath machines for the last nine years, sells them in various Pakistani cities.  Farheen is applying for a loan to buy spare parts to make another lath machine in order to earn a good profit.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to make a lath machine.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica A. sells drinks at wholesale and retail. In the evenings, she prepares and sells fried meat and pepper soup. She needs the loan to purchase more drinks and bottled water to sell. Veronica is 38 years old and is married with three children. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and bottled water to sell

loans.name: Luz Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Luz Maritza Pérez  señora tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es soltera, esta Señora tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo 3 de sus hijos dependen de ella su hijo mayor tiene la edad de 27 años y trabaja por cuenta propia, su hija de 35 años trabaja de forma independiente vendiendo productos de la avon y su otra hija de 33 trabaja con ella en le mercado de la Estación, sus deseos son de tener su propio establecimiento ya que todavía no tiene un lugar estable para ofrecer sus productos, en sus propósitos esta el proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda quiere acondicionarla de una forma sencilla pero que este sea a la ves un lugar sencillo  donde sus hijos y ella puedan permanecer tranquilos.


Su actividad económica es la de  mercadería en general en la que vende los productos como: pantalones, camisas, bolsos, gorras y lentes para el sol, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 35 años, su negocio da comienzo por que su mama ya tenia la experiencia de vender ropa y desde la edad de 15 años ella ayudaba a su mama en este negocio y al fallecer su mama es Doña Luz Marina quien se hace cargo de este negocio y así es como lo obtiene, el financiamiento es para  capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de sus productos ya que tiene que abastecerse para ofrecer los diferentes tipos de productos ya que se acercan los días festivos y así aprovechar la ocasión.
texts.en:
Luz Maritza P. is 53 years old, is single and has four children, three of whom live with her. Her older son is 27 years old and is self-employed, her 35 year old daughter works independently selling Avon products, and her 33 year old daughter works with Luz in the Estación market. Her goals include having her own store, as she still doesn't have a fixed location to offer her products. She also hopes to make simple improvements to her home so that it will be a place where she and her children can live peacefully. She works selling clothing including pants, blouses, bags, gloves and sunglasses. She has run this business for 35 years. The business was started by her mother who already had experience selling clothes, and Luz started helping her mother with the business when she was 15 years old. When her mother passed away Luz took charge of the business. The loan is for working capital that will be used to increase her stock of products as the festive season approaches.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un S., 47, lives with her husband and two of her five children in the Siem Reap Province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make $5.5 each day. During the past year, the weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia and inflation has also been spiraling out of control. These factors have led to a difficult economic year for many Cambodians including Un S.. She is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase fertilizer and gas for the farm. She hopes this will help increase her current profits and prospects for the future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and gas

loans.name: Benkadi (Bonne Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Benkadi de l’association Sérieux  de Bougoula Ville(toutes  mariées), ont en moyenne  28 ans et 2 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies  dans le quartier  Bougoula ville de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mlai).
Elles  exercent la même activité commerciale à savoir la vente de pomme de terre et  quelques fois des patates, des choux pommés et  de la banane plantain. Pour mener à bien leur activité et  satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle, ils sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Les prêts précédents se sont bien dénoués.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de 100kg de pomme de terre. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso ville (3eme Région administrative du Mali) et dans les villages environnants auprès des paysans producteurs.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et au comptant dans les différents marchés de la ville de Sikasso (Médine, grand marché de la ville), dans le quartier à domicile à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes et de quelques hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 27 000 FCFA par mois qu’elles utiliseront pour soutenir les conjoints dans la prise en charge de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités. 
Chacune d’elle souhaite devenir une grossiste en allant au prêt individuel..
texts.en:
The seven women (all married) of the group Benkadi of the association Sérieux de Bougoula Ville average 28 years of age and two children. They live in traditional extended families in the Bougoula Ville district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They each do the same kind of commerce, namely the sale of potatoes and sometimes sweet potatoes, cabbages, and plantains. To carry out their work and satisfy their customers, they are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their eighth solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loans were settled.

The group members plan to use this loan to buy five 100-kg sacks of potatoes. They stock up locally in Sikasso and in surrounding villages from peasant growers. The goods are sold retail for cash in the different marketplaces of Sikasso (Médine, the grand marketplace of the city) and in the district out of their homes. Customers are composed essentially of women and some men.

The group members each hope to realize a monthly profit of 27,000 francs CFA that they will use to support their spouses in caring for their families and to invest the rest in their businesses. Each of the women in the group would like to become a wholesaler while taking out individual loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has owned a small shop in the Tengeru neighborhood of Arusha for 5 years. She belongs to Neema group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Every day she works at her business from 8am to 21.30pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Joyce is 22 years old, married, and has one child.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her stock.

loans.name: Luaupu

texts.en:
Luaupu F., 30, is married with four children. She has four years of experience in the bingo business. She sells to the general public/villagers three days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 750 Tala (about $312).

SPBD loans are Luaupu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will help pay her children's school fees because the business is running well and it is generating enough income for her family to survive on.

loans.use: To pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea H., born in 1942, is the widowed mother of six children; three of them are single and the other three are married and live away from the family home. She currently runs a business by mobile transportation selling a little clothes and medicines at her client's house. Chea H.'s investment is going very well and she has gained more income, because she is skilled in communication. To earn additional income and to make her business more successful, she is asking for a loan to accrue business capital. (She and her daughter are pictured.)

loans.use: To accrue her business capital

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr:
A. Madeleine est âgée de 38 ans; elle est mariée à SAGBO Claude. Madeleine a deux enfants tous scolarisés. Madeleine réside à Gbégamey un quartier populaire de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Madeleine vend dans le marché de Gbégamey de beignets faits à base du haricot ou du blé; elle frit aussi des tubercules d'igname et de pomme de terre. Grâce à cette activité Madeleine arrive à supporter une partie des charges du ménage notamment la scolarité des enfants. Madeleine a déjà bénéficié de prêt de ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement. Actuellement Madeleine sollicite un nouveau prêt toujours dans le cadre du renforcement de son fonds de roulement afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Madeleine A., age 38, is married to Claude SAGBO. She has two children, who both attend school. She lives in Gbégamey, a working-class neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Madeleine sells beignets (a kind of doughnut) made out of bean at the Gbégamey market. She also fries yams and potatoes. Thanks to this business, she manages to pay for part of the household expenses, notably her children's schooling. Madeleine already benefited from loan from Kiva's partner, Alidé, to bolster her working capital. Now, she's seeking a new loan, still to bolster her working capital, in order to better meet customer demand.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of beans, sacks of wheat, yams, and potatoes,

loans.name: Gnoem

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 27, lives in Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. She earns a living by selling a few grocery items from her house for her neighbors. She has a long experience in this business. S. is married and currently takes care of two children; both of them are single and also attend school. Her husband has owned a machine to charge the villagers' batteries to earn income for the family.

The family's living conditions are not so comfortable because the roof of their house is leaky during rains. Because of this problem, S. has requested a loan to replace their old roof.

loans.use: To replace their old roof

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma L. is about 43 years old. She is married with five children. They live in the peaceful village of Barangay Cambong in Lallo, Cagayan. Thelma raises hogs and also sells fruits and vegetables in their village. She earns PHP 250 a day in income from vending. Some of the income is invested in hog raising and some is used to pay for her family's basic needs and the allowances of her children who are still studying. She is thankful that her husband accompanies her in their business undertakings.

Three of Thelma's children are currently attending school and so, together with her husband, she is working hard. She is seeking the support of lenders to loan her even the small amount of PHP 4000 to maintain her hog raising and vending business. She hopes to diversify her business someday to create a brighter future for her children. Thelma says that she believes that through this loan, she will be able to pursue all her business plans with patience, hard work, and trust.

loans.use: To mainain her hog raising business and diversify her vending inventory.

loans.name: Bùi Thị

texts.en:
X. Bùi Thị (803991516) is a 29-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has 2 infant children. To earn a living, X. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. X. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,900,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1999, X. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. X. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. X. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the 10th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. X. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business.

loans.use: used to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes R. C. tiene 32 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, en la provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 5 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Mercedes se dedica a la fabricación de calzado, su taller esta ubicado en su domicilio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para la fabricación de dicho calzado, los cuales son vendidos a tiendas comerciales ubicados en Trujillo y Chiclayo.
Sus materiales son adquiridos en tiendas comerciales ubicados en el distrito donde vive (El Porvenir). 
Recién ha ingresado como socia del Banco Comunal Viva con Esperanza II.
Con este crédito de 300 soles lo invertirá en la compra de tacos, cuero, badana y cajas esenciales para la fabricación y venta de su producto (calzado).  
Mercedes tiene como sueño ampliar su taller, adquirir nuevas maquinas para fabricar calzado, generarse mejores ingresos y brindar comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes R. C. is 32 years old and lives in the El Porvenir district in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. She completed her secondary school education and has 5 children who depend on her financially. Mercedes dedicates herself to making shoes, and her workshop is located right in her own home. She has the support of her husband for making said shoes, which she sells in the stores located in Trujillo and Chiclayo. She acquires her materials in the stores located in the district where she lives (El Porvenir). She has recently joined as a member of the Live with Hope II cooperative bank. With this loan of 300 soles, she will invest in the purchase of heels, leather and boxes for making and selling her product (footwear). Mercedes dreams of expanding her workshop, buying new machinery for making shoes, generating more income, and providing comforts for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase heels, leather, and boxes, essential for making and selling her product.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: El Señor José M. N. tiene 44 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de productos lácteos, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que su mayor interés es como padre responsable dedicarse a ofrecer los productos como queso, cuajada y crema. El inicio este negocio, porque no tenía  un lugar estable donde ofrecer sus productos, y decide recorrer algunas calles, esto no fue tan fácil para José por que todos los días, camina bajo el sol pero esto no le impide llevar una sonrisa y mostrar esa amabilidad con sus clientes. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Su mayor deseo es ser el propietario de una distribuidora.
texts.en:
José M. N. is 44 years old. He is a married man. He has 3 children under his care. His business is in the sale of dairy products; he has run this business for over 6 years, and his biggest interest as a responsible father is to have this business in which he dedicates himself to offering products such as cheese, cheese curds, and cream. He began this business because he did not have a stable place in which to offer his products so he had to sell them on the street; this was not easy for José who had to spend everyday walking under the sun, nevertheless, this didn’t stop him from having a smile on his face, and also showing his clients kindness. The loan will be used as work capital to purchase basic materials. His biggest wish is to be the owner of a distribution center.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase basic materials).

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Esperanza Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Esperanza está conformado por Carla Vanesa C. Zeledón y Ana Felicita Aragón Díaz. Ambas tienen diferentes actividades económicas. Ana se dedica a la venta de productos farmacéuticos. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, y lo realiza de manera ambulante ella tiene 2 hijos a su cargo es por eso que no quiere dejar de trabajar pues tiene que sacar adelante a sus hijos. Carla Vanesa tiene 34 años. Es una mujer casada. Su actividad económica es una librería. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. las dos se unieron con las mismas razones para salir adelante con sus negocios y aportarles a su familia la esperanza de mantener sus negocios. Por lo que el motivo de su financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que servirá para la compra de cada uno de sus productos.
texts.en:
The Esperanza Solidarity Group was established by Carla Vanesa C. Zeledón and Ana Felicita Aragón Díaz. They both have their own businesses. Ana started selling pharmaceuticals more than 4 years ago and does so as a street vendor. She has two children to look after and needs to work in order to help her children get ahead. Carla Venesa is 34, married and started running a bookstore 3 years ago. The two women got together with the same goal of improving their businesses and supporting their families from the profits. Such is their motivation for seeking this loan which will help buy the goods they need to keep their businesses going.

Translated from Spanish by Patty Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosemonde

texts.en:
H. Rosemonde is married and has four children. Her oldest child is 16 and her youngest is 6. Her husband is an electrician.

There she sells a variety of goods in a stand near her home. Her stand is on the edge of a dirt road, a short walk from a busy Porto-Novo street. Among other things, Rosemonde sells candy, soap, medicine, toothpaste, drinks, and snacks. She has been selling in this place for seventeen years. Before, when she was younger, Rosemonde sold goods near her parents’ home. She buys her products at the Ouando Market.

Supplementing her income, Rosemonde is the owner of a motorcycle taxi. She employs someone to drive the motorcycle and they share the profits.

Rosemonde is seeking a loan from Alidé, a Kiva Field Partner, in order to restock her inventory. In the future, she also hopes to be able to start selling Beninese fabrics, necklaces, and jewelry.

loans.use: To buy more candy, soap, medicine and other products to sell

loans.name: Mame

texts.fr: Mame D. est une femme mariée 45 ans. Elle s’active dans l’embauche bovine et ovine. Ce prêt lui servira à renforcer son élevage et ainsi à mieux améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille.

loans.use: Faire de l'embauche bovine et ovine

loans.name: Elas

texts.en:
Elas T. is from the village of Agong-ong, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old. Elas is married and has 4 school-aged children.

To make a living, Elas owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Elas has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elas joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elas has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to pay for services to increase crop yield. Elas is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business.

This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elas from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Bendia Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Bendia sont mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies, avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent dans le village Noumouwèrè, dans la préfecture de Ségou (4ème  Région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Village des forgerons comme son nom l’indique, elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et appartiennent à une association  traditionnelle de femme. Ce groupe de femmes vend des mortiers, des louches, des pilons, et des calebasses décorés. 
Dans le but d’associer autres activités artisanales à celles qu’elles mènent, elles ont  adhéré au programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 7ème cycle, après six prêts solidaires tous correctement remboursés.
Ce  nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 15 colis de calebasses (chaque colis contient 20 à 30 calebasses) et 20 mortiers. Les calebasses et les mortiers achetés sont limés et gravés  de dessins avant d’être mis au marché. Elles se ravitaillent en calebasses dans les foires de Tonan, Cinzana, au grand marché de Ségou et en mortiers dans le village de Togo avec les hommes. Les produits sont revendus au comptant au bord du goudron à côté de la grande mosquée et en ambulant dans les quartiers de Ségou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
 Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 28.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et acheter les condiments au quotidien. 
Elles ont pour ambition l’installation d’un moulin dans le village afin d’avoir plus de temps pour leurs activités génératrices de revenus et l’achat du matériel de travail qu’on appelle soufflet.

loans.use: Achat de calebasses et de mortiers.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel A. is from the village of Barangay 26, Kahulogan, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Isabel is married and has 5 school-aged children. Isabel owns and operates a motorcycle repair shop for local community members. Isabel has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and she earns approximately 6000 PHP  a month.

In 2009, Isabel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services.  She is requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand a motorcycle repair shop.

location.town: Barangay 26, Kahulogan, Gingoog City, Misamis Orie

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine T. is the loving wife of Mr. Harold T. of Barangay San Nicolas, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. They are blessed with three school-aged children: Harold T. Jr., Henson Paul T., and Harine Mae T.. They want their children to become successful in their chosen professions and have a better future.

Katherine manages a small sari-sari store at home while her husband uses their tricycle to earn an income. Being an industrious couple, they are able to earn an income of 1,000 PHP a week, which they use to provide for their basic needs and pay their children's tuition fees. They want to increase their income so they can save for their future, but they have inadequate capital. Therefore, Katherine wants to borrow 6,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to improve her sari-sari store and maintain their tricycle. She hopes that, with this financial assistance, they are able to improve their small businesses through patience and sacrifice.

loans.use: To improve sari-sari store and maintain tricycle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with seven children and is 42 years old. She lives in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. 

She is a fashion designer and also sells tailoring materials. She makes lovely designs for her customers. She is happy because it is the high season during which she hopes to make more profits. She is requesting a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. 

She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sary Oem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of 18 people, is located in Prey Theat village in the Takeo province. All the members will use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sary O. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small field on which to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Nop Sokhom, helps her with the farming. Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support the family. 

In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sary O. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to improve their living conditions after she sells her cow. Mrs. Sary O. is the mother of seven children, six of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because this child is only 1 year old. 

Mrs. Kea M. did not come to take a loan but her husband did, so he is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Romelia's Group

texts.en:
Romelia F. is from the village of San Rafael, Roxas, Isabela. She is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Romelia F.'s Group.

Romelia is 45 years old, is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Romelia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Romelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Romelia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the products offered. This will be the fourth loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the products offered

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna M., who is 46 years old, lives in Veruela Agusan Del Sur. She makes her livelihood through rice farming. She works from early morning to late in the afternoon in order to monitor her crops to ensure an abundant harvest. 

Myrna has three children. Her eldest is 22 years old and was not able to go to school. She would like to expand her business to support the educational needs of her children. 

She hopes to receive a loan of 6,000 PHP through the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo C. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. He is 58 years old. Alfredo is married and has 5 school-age children. To make a living, Alfredo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Alfredo has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alfredo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alfredo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 21000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto A., 39, lives on an island at Talibon Bohol. He has seven children. His eldest child is 17 years old. He says that fishing is his only source of livelihood. Aside from fish, he is also engaged in seaweeds farming. These two occupations have helped Modesto pay their daily household expenses. 

He would like to apply a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fishing boats and a compressor.

loans.use: To buy compressor machine and fishing boat

loans.name: Viktor

texts.en:
Viktor is married, has two daughters and lives with his family in the town of Kahovka, in the Kherson region. Viktor is a cobbler who offers shoe-repair services in the local market. He launched his own small enterprise 15 years ago when his family was faced with financial challenges. Ever since that day, he has expanded his business and now produces profits every month.  

Viktor has applied for a 15,000 Grivnya loan to buy supplies. He enjoys his work because it involves helping people and it is easy to see the results of what he does. He hopes that his enterprise will continue to bring him a stable income and allow him to meet his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his shoe-repair business

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando P. M. tiene 44 años y vive en el barrio Las Palmas de la ciudad de Barranquilla, se dedica a vender en su negocio llamado Arreglos florales “La bendición García” allí él y su esposa compran flores y los jarrones rudimentarios que convierten en hermosos floreros decorados externamente, portando las mas hermosas flores artificiales, que a través de dos vendedores y distribuyen por toda Barranquilla en dos vehículos de madera con 3 ruedas llamados carretillas. En la actualidad aplica a un crédito por valor de $2.000.000 para comprar floreros rudimentarios, flores artificiales  en Ponedera, un pueblo del departamento del Atlántico y también compraran mecedoras que vienen desde San Pues en el Departamento de Sucre.  

Su negocio de arreglos florales lo inició hace cuatro años y su venta de mercancías como mecedoras entre otras, la agregó hace 2 años, su venta las hacen 2 empleados mediante el sistema de crédito y Orlando cobra semanalmente o de acuerdo al plan de pagos que hayan pactado con los clientes.
Este es su tercer crédito con la Fundación Santo Domingo, con los financiamientos ha logrado mayor impacto en las ventas y por eso hoy tienen 2 trabajadores que son los que ahora reparten. Su sueño es montar una distribuidora que reparta mercancía en todas las poblaciones del área metropolitana de Barranquilla
texts.en:
Orlando P. M. is 44 years old and lives in the Las Palmas neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla. He has a flower-arranging business called "La Bendición García." He and his wife buy flowers and plain jars, which they turn into beautiful decorated vases containing gorgeous artifical flowers. They have two salesmen and deliver throughout all of Barranquilla in two three-wheeled wooden vehicles called "carretillas." They are currently requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 pesos to buy vases and artifical flowers in Pondedera, a town in the department of Atlántico. They will also buy rocking chairs that come from San Pues, in the department of Sucre. They started their flower-arranging business four years ago, and started selling rocking chairs and other merchandise two years ago. Two employees take care of the sales, and the business offers weekly and other types of payment plans, which Orlando charges for. This is his third loan with the Fundación Santo Domingo. He's used the financing to increase his sales, which is why they now have two employees to share the work. His dream is to set up a distribution business that would deliver merchandise to all the communities in the greater Barranquilla metropolitan area.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plain vases, artificial flowers, and rocking chairs

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia C. is from the village of Pagalungan, Cgayan de Oro City. She is 46 years old and married with eight school-aged children. To make a living, Melecia sells firewood. Melecia has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Melecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Melecia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Melecia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto R. L., tiene la edad de 49 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y su hijo de 16 años de edad, y son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Luis también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. 
About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Luis Alberto R. L. is 49 and married. He lives with his wife and 16 year old son, who are his main priority. Luis wants a loan to buy fertiliser to help him cultivate coffee on his farm. He wants to adequately maintain his coffee cultivation to achieve better quality coffee and in turn better profits when sowing time comes. This is the first time he has sought a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very content with the facilities that they have. Luis has worked in agriculture for many years. He hopes in the future to give his family a better quality of life and better economic stability, and to continue growing as a person and producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilisers

loans.name: Kevin Otieno

texts.en:
Kevin Otieno O. is 30 years old, a husband and a father of two children. He lives in Migori, Kenya, and used to be a mechanic before venturing into sugar cane farming in 2002. He wants to boost his business and eventually expand it to owning rental houses.

He would like to get a loan of KES 20,000.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Thoeurn E. is 51 years old and lives in Preaek Thei village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who rents a piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Thoeurn E. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline to support her farming crop. Besides working on her land, she is also a farm laborer so that she can earn a small salary to support her family. Mrs. Thoeurn E. is a widow with four children; three are laborers and one is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
La Señora pertenece al banco comunal Génesis, vive en Totoracocha que es un hermoso lugar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por ser la cuna de escritores, esta bañada por sus cuatro ríos, es una ciudad especial, gracias a sus iglesias, su centro histórico, su gente.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, su primer hijo es de 30 años de edad ya es casado y vive independiente, su segunda hija de 28 y su hijo de 23 años de edad, están estudiando en una universidad de la ciudad, finalmente su ultimo hijo de 17 años sigue estudiando en el colegio y afortunadamente este año se gradúa. Su esposo es ingeniero comercial, gracias a él y su esposa, toda esta familia vive tranquila y feliz en su casa propia.

La señora María tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y también se dedica ala venta de cosméticos por catálogo hace diez  años, es directora de “moda internacional” en la Provincia del Azuay, no tiene horario de trabajo, trabaja de lunes a viernes hasta altas horas en la tarde.

Su nuevo crédito que realiza en la Fundación ESPOIR lo va a invertir para comprar ropa y cosméticos, su meta es darles a sus hijos una educación de primera y que estudien un postgrado.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Genesis village bank and lives in Totoracocha, a beautiful part of the city of Cuenca. The city is known for being the cradle of authors and being surrounded by 4 rivers. It is a special city thanks to its churches, its historical center, and its people. Maria is 52 years old and married with 4 children. Her oldest is 30 years old and married and lives on his own. Her second is a 28 year old daughter and her third, a 23 year old son. They are studying in the local university. Finally her 17 year old son is still in high school and graduates this year. Her husband is a commercial engineer, thanks to him and his wife, the family is happy in their home. Maria runs a business selling clothing and has sold cosmetics through a catalogue for the past 10 years. She is the director of "International Fashion" in the province of Azuay. She doesn't have a fixed work schedule but works Monday to Friday till late in the afternoon. This loan she will receive through Fundacion ESPOIR will be used to buy clothing and cosmetics; her goal is to provide a great education for her children and that they do post-graduate work.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blouses, pants, t-shirts, make-up, perfumes, and creams

loans.name: Mrs. Sokha Och Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has ten people who have been selected. Mrs. Sokha O. is the village bank president, located in Chamkar Ta Ngaet village in Kandal province. All members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sokha O. was born in 1968 and she is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land to grow crops to sell to support her family. Now, she has a problem because her field has infertile soil and it is time to plow, but she does not have enough money to suppor this. So to improve production, Mrs. Sokha O. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and hire a plow machine. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire a plow machine

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen T. was born in Yerevan in 1974. Karen is married and lives with his wife and little son in Ijevan city. His wife doesn't work: she takes care of their child. 

Since 1998 Karen has been running a food shop, where he sells fruits and vegetables, sausages, beverages, ice cream, and other foods. With profit from his business Karen solves his young family's needs, and has bought some furniture and computer equipment for his home.

Karen is requesting a loan of 470,000 AMD loan to buy watermelons, melons, cherries, plums, etc. to sell in his shop.

loans.use: To buy watermelons, melons, cherries, plums, etc. for his shop

loans.name: Cheikh Makhtar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité CHEIKH MAKHTAR a vu le jour en décembre 2009. Il est composé de 15 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles liées par des liens affectifs, de parenté et de confrérie. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de DVF GUEOUL

Madame Aminata N. debout au second rang sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 2 autres enfants confiés par des proches. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de colliers en perle, de ceinture et d’encens. Elle s’approvisionne en marchandises à Touba et à Dakar pour revendre dans son quartier lors des marchés hebdomadaires.

Ave son crédit elle va renforcer sa marchandise en perle, en ceinture et en encens.

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de la famille et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels
texts.en:
The solidarity group CHEIKH MAKHTAR came into being in December 2009. It is made up of 15 women who all come from the same neighborhood. They are bound together by ties of affection or they are related to each other. The group is a part of the "Banc Villageois" of DVF GUEOUL. Mrs. Aminata N., standing in the second row in the photo, is the group leader. She is 34, married, and the mother of six children. She is also responsible for two other children who were confided to her care by relatives. She sells beaded necklaces, belts, and incense. She stocks up on merchandise in Touba and in Dakar and sells her goods in her neighborhood at weekly markets. With her loan, she is going to expand her stock of beads, belts and incense. Her goal is to help support her family and be responsible for her own personal needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of beaded necklaces, belts, and incense

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Work Capital

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos  tiene  24 años de edad vive en la Maica una Zona rural de la ciudad de Cochabamba, el se dedica a la producción de la leche  junto con su esposa con la cual tiene una hijo de tres años.
El es una persona muy responsable y dedicado al trabajo que el realiza  tiene cuatro cabezas de ganado lechero   Juan Carlos  se dedica a esta actividad desde muy joven ya que su madre se dedicaba a la misma actividad el por ser el hermano menor siempre estuvo trabajando con ella, la mamá de Juan Carlos murió hace seis años a causa de una enfermedad que lucho desde niña ya que cuando ella se enfermo de mal de chagas que es una enfermedad con la cual combatió muchos años pero ella estuvo siempre luchando junto a sus hijos para salir adelante ya que el padre les abandono cuando ellos eran niños.

Juan Carlos  lucha todos los días y valora mucho el sacrificio que su madre hizo por sus hermanas y su persona, el crédito que solicita es para la compra un camión de cascara de soya que es  alimento para el ganado  y de esa manera generar más ingresos y podrá  aumentar su producción de leche porque el saca 150 litros diarios los cuales entrega  a su suegra para la realización de quesillos.

Juan Carlos quiere un futuro mejor para su hijo es por eso que él trabaja desde muy temprano y realiza otros trabajos como agricultor, él  y su esposa quieren en un futuro no muy lejano casarse y trabajar juntos  y ayudar a que su hijo estudie una carrera y tenga un futuro mejor que el que tuvo el.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 24, lives in La Maica, a rural zone in Cochabamba. He and his wife are dairy farmers and they have a three year old son. He is a very responsible person who is dedicated to the work he does. He has four head of dairy cattle. He has been in this line of work since he was very young because his mother did the same. Because he is the youngest sibling he was always at her side working with her. Juan Carlos’ mother died six years ago due to an illness she fought against since she was a little girl and got Chagas disease. This is a disease she fought against for many years but still she was always struggling together with her children to get ahead since their father abandoned them when they were children. Juan Carlos struggles daily and values the sacrifice his mother made for his sisters and for himself. He is asking for funds to buy a truckload of soy husks which is the feed for his cattle so that he can generate higher income and produce more milk. He currently extracts 150 liters of milk daily which he delivers to his mother-in-law to make “quesillo” (small fresh farm cheese popular in the Cochabamba valley.) Juan Carlos wants a better future for his son. This is why he works from very early in the morning and does other farming chores. He and his wife want to get married in the not too distant future and work together to help their son study a professional career and have a better future than he has had.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soy based cattle feed.

loans.name: Alicia Halina

texts.es: Alicia Halina tiene 22 años, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, ella es una joven emprendedora le ha gustado trabajar para mantener a su familia. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad son para el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. Solicita este crédito para la compra de pantalones, ropa interior, camisetas, faldas, camisolas y trajes. Su mayor anhelo es ver a su familia progresar y mejorar gradualmente su calidad de vida. Para ello se ha propuesto trabajar arduamente y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Alicia Halina is 22 years old, and devotes her time to buying and selling clothes. For the 3 years she has had this business, this enterprising young woman has enjoyed her work, and enjoyed supporting her family. The income she makes goes to her family. She is seeking this loan to buy trousers, underwear, t-shirts, skirts, vests and suits. Her greatest desire is to see her family progressing and gradually improving their quality of life. For this reason, she vows to work hard and continue to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 38 years old, married with 5 children aged 19, 17, 10, 14, and 8 years old. She has 2 other dependents and lives with a family of 7 members. She owns her home and her family goal is to have a wealthy family. She lives in Masindi, Uganda.

She is into the produce business, selling millet. Her business has been running for seven years now. She started by selling local brew and now has a stock of about 5,000,000UGX. She faces a challenge of transporting the millet from the farmers and of limited capital. In future she expects her business to be in a bigger produce store than today. She wants the loan to enable her to buy more millet to sell at a margin.

loans.use: Buying more millet to sell at a margin

loans.name: Syrga's Group

texts.en:
Syrga A. is the leader of the group. She is 41 years old and married. Her husband is a builder, making 5000 soms per month. The couple brings up 5 children; the eldest daughter is married, all the rest go to the local school. The family runs their own business of cooking and selling national dishes. 3 years ago, one of the neighbors helped Syrga to be employed as cook's assistant. At the present time, the family is building a 3-roomed house, besides breeding cattle. The loan purpose is to purchase hardware. In the future, Syrga is going to increase cattle stock, them to make interior house repairs.

Gulmira T., 39, is a widow. She takes care of 2 children, both of them students. She earns money by selling food items. In order to open a trade outlet in village Myrzaki, Gulmira hopes to get a loan. 

Shairbek I. is 23. With his 2 brothers, Shairbek raises money by offering plastering, painting and building services. His loan purpose is to purchase hardware for shed building. 

Batma K., 43, is a widow. She has 4 children. Batma runs her own business selling wheat and oil. The loan purpose is to purchase 30 kg of wheat in order to increase commodity circulation. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase hardware.

loans.name: Chingerel

texts.en:
Chingerel B. is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a traditional housing tent called a 'ger', in Uvurhangai province, central Mongolia. Her husband is disabled and her oldest child, a son, is a university student and her younger children, two daughters, both attend a local secondary school. 

Chingerel started her own business in 1997 selling a variety of foodstuffs and since 2001, has been operating dairy products and milk trade in a rented stall at Zanabazar market in the province. During the summertime she sells fermented mare's milk. After many years of operation, she has become very experienced in her dairy products trade. 

Chingerel says, " I hope to continue operating my business as a sustainable operation. For the future, I plan to expand my business and establish my own small dairy product factory." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products and consumer goods at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products and consumer goods

loans.name: Chhin's Group

texts.en:
Four people have formed a group to get a loan. They are located in Preaek Reang village in Kandal province. This group selected Mrs. Chhin V., a 32 year old, married woman, as the group leader. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Chhin V. earns her living through selling vegetables in the market. Her husband, Mr. Yun Yim, is 32 years old and works as a construction worker. With their careers, they are able to earn some income to support their family. In order to increase income to improve the family condition, Mrs. Chhin V. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a sewing machine for her use. With the rest of the loan, she would buy more vegetables to support her vegetable-selling business. 

Mrs. Chhin V. is a mother of two children. One is attending the local school and another is 5 years old and not yet in school.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas S., age 36, is a single woman and the mother of four school-aged children. To make a living, Meas S. owns a small store in good location. In her shop, she sells different kinds of goods, such as food, soft drinks, and fish paste. Her children help her with her business. This family normally earns an average of $3.00 per day to help cover their daily living expenses. 

Meas S.'s business is currently doing quite well because she has a skills in public communication. To meet the needs of her family, she is applying for a loan to purchase more fish paste and other goods to sell. Meas S. and her children appear together in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase more fish paste and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
60-year-old Corazon G. is from the town of Banga. She is now a widow and supports her children all by herself. She owns and manages a farm where rice and corn crops are planted. She also grows pigs for fattening. She sells her harvest and fattened pigs to the market. Corazon does her best to provide for her family.

Corazon joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP that will be used to buy farm fertilizers and pig feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To buy farm fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana forma parte del banco comunal “El Esfuerzo”,  perteneciente a la ciudad de Talcahuano. Ella tiene una peluquería establecida en una calle principal de su ciudad, desde hace 6 años, en donde tiene 3 personas a su cargo.
