*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Este Sr. Se llama Juan Ramón S., es casado y con una carga familiar de 7 hijos todos en edad escolar, trabaja para la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace 5 años desempeñándose como guarda de seguridad.
Se le han otorgado 4 créditos los cuales han sido para mejoramiento de vivienda y nos expresaba que le han sido de gran ayuda, ya que ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
This man is named Juan Ramon S.. He is married and has a family of 7 schoolage children. He has worked for the City Hall of Chichigalpa for five years as a security guard. He has been given 4 loans which have been for housing improvement and he has told us thaht they have been a big help, since they have improved his family's life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials (zinc, rods, edging)

loans.name: Sandra María

texts.es:
Sandra L. es otra socia activa del Banco Comunal  Sol Naciente ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca, ella vive en  el sector de la Feria Libre considerado el  sector el más comercial de la ciudad pues aquí se realizan las ferias más grandes de la urbe que se realizan los días miércoles, sábados y domingos, donde se reúnen todos los comerciantes de diferentes partes del país y de la ciudad para ofertar sus productos.

Nuestra socia  tiene una gran amistad con todas sus amigas del Bankito, este es su cuarto ciclo trabajando con los créditos que otorga la Fundación Espoir con ellos ha ido incrementando  poco a poco  su negocio de venta de comida en el cual lleva diez años atendiendo de  6 a 10 a.m. y por la tarde de 3 a 6 p.m. tiempo en el que acaba su rica comida, se decidió por éste  negocio porque es rentable aunque es muy sacrificado, pues antes era consultora de belleza de productos Yanbal pero no le fue muy bien y decidió cambiar de actividad. Con el  credito solicitado va a comprar una carreta para dar un mejor servicio a sus  clientes.

Sandra es oriunda de la provincia de los Ríos y se radicó en Cuenca hace diez años invitada por una amiga, ahora tiene 28 años vive en unión libre y ha concebido tres niños que  se encuentran de 10, 9, 1 año, su primer hijo es un niño especial tiene síndrome de Down  y vive con los abuelos en la costa ecuatoriana,  su esposo le ayuda en el negocio  porque ya tiene su buena clientela, con nostalgia nos comenta que aún  no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando y espera primero hacer realidad el sueño de tener su casita propia.
texts.en:
Sandra L. is an active member of the Sol Naciente Communal Bank, which is located in the city of Cuenca. She lives in the Feria Libre sector. It is considered the most commercial sector of the city. They have the biggest fairs in this major city. The fairs are held on Wednesdays, Saturdays, and Sundays. All of the merchants from different parts of the country and the city gather to offer their products. She has a great friendship with all of her friends in the communal bank. This is her fourth cycle working with loans from the Fundación Espoir. With the loans she has, little by little, been increasing her business of selling food. She has had the business for ten years. She works from six to ten a.m. and from three to six p.m. In that time her she sells all of her delicious food. She decided on this business because it is profitable even though it requires much sacrifice. Previously she was a beauty consultant for Yanbal products. That did not go well for her, so she decided to change her activity. She will use the requested loan to buy a cart to give her customers better service. Sandra is a native of the Ríos province, and she settled in Cuenca ten years ago after being invited by a friend. She has now lived in a common law marriage for 28 years and has three children. They are 10, 9, and 1 years old. Her first son is a special boy. He has Down syndrome and lives with his grandparents on the coast of Ecuador. Her husband helps with the business because she has a good amount of customers. She nostalgically tells us that she does not have her own house yet. They rent where they live. She hopes to make her dream of having her own little house a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cart

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu B. is married with four children; she has one son and three daughters. The two eldest children are in secondary school and the younger two are in primary school. Her husband is a businessman, who does the same type of business as she does. They live in Laka, where she has a provisions shop. She has been in this business for twenty years, and she has taken one previous loan from LAPO Sierra Leone. Isatu is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 SLL to enable her to add to her business and assist her family.

loans.use: This loan will be used to buy provisions for sale.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal D. Virgen D. las Mercedes inicia su primer ciclo con 4 socias.
Las socias son D. la comunidad D. Occollo, Distrito D. Vinchos, la actividad principal D. la zona es la crianza D. ganados.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como es el caso D. la Señora Alejandra que es casada y tiene 11 hijos, la mayor D. sus hijos tiene 25 años y el menor tiene 6 años, Alejandra junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración D. artesanía en piedra D. Huamanga, D. diferentes modelos, actividad que realizan todos los días con la ayuda D. sus hijos, un limitante para el desarrollo D. su negocio es la distancia a la ciudad D. Ayacucho para comercializar sus productos. Con el préstamo que obtendrá comprara piedra D. Huamanga. Los sueños D. Alejandra son aumentar su negocio y tener un puesto en el mercado artesanal D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
texts.en:
The communal bank Virgen D. las Mercedes began its first cycle with 4 members. The members are from the community of Occollo, district of Vinchos. The main activity in the area is cattle raising. The members have different businesses. Alejandra is married and has 11 children. Her oldest is 25 and the youngest is 6. With her husband, Alejandra makes huamanga stone carvings in different shapes. She does this every day with the help of her children. One limitation to the development of her business is the distance from the city of Ayacucho to sell her products. With the loan she will get she will buy huamanga stone. Alejandra's dreams are to grow her business and to have a stall in the artesan's market in Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase huamanga stone

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El Señor Silvio S. ,cliente Nuevo ,  es  persona  muy responsable y muy trabajador como padre, tiene una niña a la cual la cría solo, se dedica a la atención de su despensa; el sale muy temprano para el mercado de abasto a comprar productos frescos para surtir su  Despensa “Despensa S.” tiene muy buena concurrencia de clientes en especial de los vecinos y los mas recurrentes son  las personas que acuden a un del centro de salud que esta ubicado frente de su casa.
Solicita el crédito para la abastecimiento de su local (verduras, frutas, golosinas, enlatados, embutidos, y otros productos)ya que tiene mucha demanda y no tiene capital para satisfacer dicho pedidos.
texts.en:
Mr. Silvio S., a new client, is a very responsible and hardworking person. As a father, he has a daughter who he raises alone. He dedicates himself to his store; he goes out very early to the market to buy fresh products to stock his store, called “Despsensa S.”. He has a great customer base, especially the neighbors and frequent visitors to the health center that is located in front of his home. He is asking for the loan to stock his store (fruits, vegetables, candies, canned goods, and other products) that are in great demand, but he lacks the capital to buy them at this time.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits, vegetables, canned goods, candies, etc.

loans.name: Unice

texts.en:
Unice is 50 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 22 and 33 years old. Her youngest child is currently attending school.

She is a farmer from Western Kenya in Kitale town. She has been farming for 12 years and has one employee. She sells timber, sugarcane, sweet potatoes, honey and vegetables to the local market. She also operates a shop in the same area. She faces the challenge of diseases attacking her dairy cows and lack of enough nappier grass to feed the animals during the dry seasons.

She has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes.31,200 to purchase and feed a dairy cow. This loan will improve his life and that of her family since they will be able to get enough milk for consumption and sale to generate more income. In the future, she would like to build rental houses.

She says that this loan has enabled her to be a dairy farmer and she promises to pay regularly and later make another loan to progress further with her business.

loans.use: To purchase and feed a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rukaya

texts.en: Rukaya M. sells a variety of slippers and children’s wear in Abura. She is single and has received junior high education. Rukaya has been selling slippers for 13 years. She is responsible for her own welfare. Her loan will be used to buy more slippers to fill her shop for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy more children’s wear to sell.

loans.use: To buy more slippers to fill her shop for sale

loans.name: Ma. Elna

texts.en:
Despite the fact that Ma. Elna S.’s two children have their own families now, she and her husband, Ireneo, are always there to support them and their grandchildren. John, and Jessie, Ma. Elna’s children are both high school undergraduates and therefore were not able to get employed for a better paying and stable kinds of jobs. 

By sustaining and growing her salted egg making and selling business, in partnership with her husband, and through the support of ASHI, Ma. Elna is able to have a financial source to support her children and her grandchildren. Her hope to enrich the lifestyle of her children and their family gives her strength and energy to continue her hard work. She requests for a loan so that her business will become sustainable and profitable, thus making her family financially stable. Aside from enjoying her business because of the income it generates, Ma. Elna and her husband are happy for they are able to have a bonding time while making salted eggs. They are also helping each other in selling their products in the market.

loans.use: To purchase large volume of eggs and other ingredients needed to make salted eggs for selling.

loans.name: Mwino Akuwa-Jinja Group

texts.en:
32 year old  Judith E. began her 3 year old retail business in Mpumudde-Jinja with her own savings. She was started in the bakery business but in the course of time, she changed businesses. She has established a niche for herself in her local area and as a result her clientele (who are mostly the local community members), are now accustomed to her good humored nature. Judith has a good reputation and has made a favorable impression on most of her customers.

 In a week, she makes 120,000 shillings out of her retail enterprise. With additional profits from her commercial motorcycle and taxi businesses, she earns a good profit at the end of every week. With this loan, she wants to purchase more bags of sugar, salt and utensils for her shop. She reckons she will resell this and strengthen her profit base.

loans.use: The purchase of more retail items such as sugar, salt and sugar for resell

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo, de 49 años, es un padre de familia muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Adelina de 44 años y su hija menor Mariela de 22 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando todos los días arduamente en sus cultivos, Guillermo trata de cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, junto a su esposa siembran semestralmente choclos, papa y arveja, los cuales venden en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plagas de insectos, lleva 37 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus cultivos hasta el lugar donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Más adelante, espera mejorar la calidad de sus productos y así obtener mejores precios. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultor. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy participativo y solidario. Con los quinientos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la productividad de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 49, a simple and hard working father, he lives in his own home with his 44 year old wife Adelina and their youngest daughter Mariela, age 22. His wish is to provide them with a better quality of life. Guillermo tries to improve his life through hard work tending his crops. Along with his wife he plants corn, potato, and peas semi-annually which they sell in the Tarma wholesale market where they get the best prices. What he enjoys most about his work is defending is crops from insect plagues. He's been doing this for 37 years and feels that the most difficult aspect is transporting his goods to the market since the sacks are very heavy. Down the road he hopes to improve the quality of his goods and so get better prices. This is his second loan with MFP and he feels that this loan will benefit him in his growth as a farmer. He is a supportive and active member of the community group. With the five hundred soles he is requesting he plans to buy fertilizer to increase the production of his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa O. de 27 años, esta casada con el Sr. Jorge Mendoza de 33 años, tienen la dicha de tener 2 hijos una de 7 años con el nombre de Rocio y otra de 3 años con el nombre de Alma.

Rosa  se dedica a este trabajo hace más de 3 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2007; ella empezó con su esposo que es oficial de crédito  junto su dinero y pusieron el negocio, para poder tener una Ropería, que va creciendo por el ingreso que genera, en la actualidad ya tiene su clientela formada, y su local se encuentra en un lugar estratégico en el mercado de Caaguazú.

Ella utilizaría este crédito en compras de mercaderías para el invierno como camperas, buzos, pantalones, sueter y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa O., 27 years of age, is married to Mr. Jorge Mendoza, 33 years of age. They have the good fortune to have two children: Rocio, 7 years old and Alma, 3 years old. For more than three years (approximately since 2007), Rosa, along with her husband, who is a loan officer, began a clothing business This business is growing and generating income due to its customer base and its strategic location in the Caaguazu Market. Rosa plans to use this loan on purchases of goods for the winter like jackets, sweatshirts, pants, sweaters, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de pantalones, sueter, camperas, buzos y otros. (to purchase pants, sweaters, winter coats, jacket, etc.)

loans.name: Delia Concepción

texts.es: Delia Concepción A. González fue construyendo su casa poco a poco, este momento pide el apoyo para poder terminar su baño ya que le falta enjarrar las paredes y pintar para dar mejor aspecto. Ella es madre de tres pequeños los cuales quiere ofrecer un mejor patrimonio, es por ello que trabaja como cajera y su esposo es ayudante en un taller de pintura para automóviles.
texts.en:
Delia Concepcion A. G. started building his house. He requests support to finish the bathroom. The walls remain to be finished and painted. She is the mother of three little ones, to whom she would like to provide living conditions. It is for their sakes that she works as a cashier and her husband is an assistant in an auto body shop.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish the bathroom.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes M. M.  es  una mujer de 70 años y con sueños muy firmes, pues tiene como meta el montaje de almacén para exhibir vestidos femeninos e infantiles, en las líneas clásicas, formales e informales  y disfraces, adaptandose a los requerimientos que trae cada época a nivel comercial, porque ella aprovecha muy bien cada momento para desplegar su creatividad y vender permanentemente.
 
Mercedes desde hace 35 años, tiene el negocio de comercializar ropa femenina e infantil,  negocio que inició al observar en las actividades de su pueblo, Juan de Acosta,  un potencial  de confecciones femenina  dedicado a este oficio, produciendo con buena calidad, pero con poco capital de trabajo para hacer una oferta comercial;  desde ese momento  concibió el negocio que ahora tiene:  "comercializar en las ciudades de Santa Marta y Cartagena  ropa femenina e infantil, mediante el sistema de comprar la tela diseñar la moda y mandarla a fabricar en los talleres de su pueblo natal. Es así como todos los sábados envía los pedidos a estas ciudades, que son cancelados mediante un credicontado de 8 a 15 días. En la actualidad fabricó disfraces  para niñas porque se acerca el día de los niños y Halloween y está preparada para responder a sus clientes; su credikiva es el séptimo financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará telas, e insumos y pagara la mano de obra a las confeccionistas con las cuales trabaja. En sus tres años de ser clienta de la Fundación ha notado el incremento constante de su capital de trabajo, mediante sus créditos y su capacidad de hacer negocios.
  
La  señora mercedes vive con su sobrina pues es viuda y no tuvo hijos, e insiste en alcanzar su  sueño de tener un almacén para vender los productos al publico, pues la competencia todos los días la inspira para que desarrolle su creatividad ofreciendo alternativas que le permiten la sostenibilidad de su negocio y responderle como lo merece a su fiel clientela que desde hace mas de veinte años le compra .
texts.en:
Mercedes M. M. is a 70 year old woman with a goal of having a store for women's and children's dresses. These dresses will include classic cuts, formal and informal designs as well as costumes that would vary with the sales season. She is a woman who knows how to take advantage of the moment with her creativity in order to have consistent sales. For the past 35 yeas Mercedes has had a business selling women's and children's clothing, She started by noticing the possibility of making a quality product with little startup capital in her town of Juan de Acosta. Since that time she has had her current business selling women's and children's clothing in Santa Marta and Cartagena for which the fabric has been purchased, designs created, and sewn in her home town. Every Saturday she sends orders to these town which are purchased on 8-15 day credits. She recently made children's costumes since Halloween is drawing near and she is anticipated her clients' needs. Her Kiva loan is her 7th through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy fabric, related goods, as well as to pay labor costs. In her 3 years as a client, Fundacion has noted the steady growth in her operating capital through the loans and her business skills. Mercedes lives with her niece, as she is widowed and has no children. She is adamant in her dream of having a store to sell her goods to the public, since the competition pushes her to be more creative and offer more variety to sustain the business and react to her loyal (more than 20 years) and deserving customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and accessories as well as pay labor for the sewers she works with.

loans.name: Elizabeth Ekua Kwesiwa

texts.en: Elizabeth Ekua Kwesiwa K. is married and has five dependents. She has no educational background.  Elizabeth Ekua Kwesiwa sells bedsheets, cosmetics and dresses at Elmina. Her husband is a farmer. Elizabeth uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Elizabeth will use the loan she hopes to get to purchase more clothing for resale. With the new revenue from her expanded business, Elizabeth wishes to save to build a shop.

loans.use: purchase more clothing for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish, meat, cooking oil, rice, beans, salt, seasoning, etc.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia Nyangweth is 48 years old from Kisumu city. Her husband, Michael, is currently unemployed and she is left with the sole responsibility of taking care of the family. They have eight children who are all in college.

Patricia has a second hand clothes business that she has been running for the past 25 years. Her monthly income comes to 30,000 KES. She is currently applying for her second loan as she is in dire need of purchasing more bales of second hand clothes to add to her stock. The profits made from this business go to the upkeep of the family.

Her desire is to be able to open up a boutique shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy two bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Nyakwara

texts.en:
Nyakwara is 76 years old, married, and the father of fourteen, aged between 5 and 62 years, with three attending school.  He has been a mixed farmer for fifty years and sells maize, beans, bananas, coffee and milk locally.

He has requested a loan of Kshs. 45,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. Extra income from this loan will assist him in  paying school fees for the children. In five years he aspires to have a posho (cornmeal) mill.

The challenge he is facing is lack of enough capital to purchase farming inputs like fertilizers hence affecting crop production.  He is thankful to Juhudi and promises to continue to fight against poverty.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Nyamhuu

texts.en: Nyamhuu D. is 52 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband works as a fireman in the local company while her daughter is a teacher but currently stays at home with her brother. Nyamhuu operates a cafe in a rented space in her town. She started her cafe business in 2009. In addition, she works in the construction decoration field to supplement her earnings. Nyamhuu is a hardworking woman. She is requesting a 700,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to pay rent fees for her cafe and to purchase groceries and meat to make a variety of meals at her cafe.

loans.use: To pay rent fees and purchase groceries and meat

loans.name: Cate

texts.en:
Cate is a 46-year-old woman who is married to Lawrence, a 50-year-old drive). They are blessed with 7 children, ages 21, 16, 14, 12, 8, 7 and 5 years. She has been selling clothes and housewares for 6 months and she manages to earn a monthly profit of Kshs 10,000/= (10000 Kenyan shillings). She also gets support from her husband’s income from driving, which enables her to meet the family expenses. 

This is her first loan from Kadet Ltd. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who benefited from our loans. With this loan, she plans to add some more household wares which include plastic items like buckets and bowls, and to add shoes to her clothing business. This will bring in more income, especially now that the holidays have set in. She hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand her business and venture into farming.

Her future dream is to educate her children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: To purchase plastics and school shoes

loans.name: La Reforma 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Alexandra is the coordinator of her group named La Reforma 1 & 2 (Reform). She has a long term partner, four children and lives in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activity here is the free trading zone, a cement factory, and other businesses. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

For around seven years Alexandra has operated a colmado, a shop where you can find basic food staples. Colmados are within short walking distances from neighborhood homes. She started her business with a loan she receive from a friend. She plans to use this loan to buy rice, flour and other foods. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business, like her other eight loans. She wants to work. She says, "now I have the strength to work harder. For my future, I want to have a better life, to live tranquil and safe.

Alexandra says that her biggest goal is to have her own house. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to survive and to serve with her business. Her story is generally representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, flour, oil, etc.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista K. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  Teopista has a business selling roasted maize.  She has been in this business for 7 years, working 7 days out of every week.  She also generates additional income through selling tomatoes.

Teopista   sells her products from home by means of wholesale and retail.    Teopista has requested a loan of 700000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of maize and baskets of tomatoes.   The main business challenges for Teopista include the rainy season, transportation, and seasonality of demands.  Her goals and aspirations are to start growing maize and tomatoes herself and to improve her standards of living.   

Teopista lives in a home that she rents.  She doesn't have access to electricity nor to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family, and rent.

loans.use: To buy maize and tomatoes

loans.name: Joyce  Kavele

texts.en:
Joyce Kavele Nzue has been selling fruits and vegetables of various kinds in Mlolongo market for about 10 years.  She earns a profit of KES 10,000 per month.  She is 65 years old and is married to Francis, who is a driver.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client and has never borrowed from any other MFI.  Joyce is applying for her second loan from KADET,  which she intends to use to add more stock of tomatoes and various types of vegetables for resale. With the anticipated profit, she plans to accumulate savings and buy a pick-up truck to transport tomatoes from the farms to the marketplace.

Joyce describes herself as hardworking. She desires to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to resell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman who lives in Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling garlic, onions and spices. Her husband Jerry, who is 54 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 7 and 13 years old, respectively. Rosalie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosalie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future and for her children’s education. D. C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 27 years old, married to a soldier and has no children. She is currently in the business of selling beer. Mary is requesting a loan to stock more beer to sell. With the extra profits from her business, she hopes to buy land in the future.

loans.use: To stock more beer to sell

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 42 years old, married and the father of four children. He has been operating a retail shop for 5 years. With the income from his business, he is able to educate his children. Through Faulu Kenya, Paul has managed to buy a piece of land. He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future. Paul has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy cereals and kerosene.

loans.use: to buy cereals and kerosene

loans.name: Weraga Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Paul M. has been overseeing his motorcycle transportation business for 6 years now in the busy and boisterous Seeta neighborhood of Mukono. This place, like many other sprouting urban areas in Uganda, has taken to the motorcycle craze with gusto. Needless to say, many people in Uganda today prefer using motorcycle transport because it gets them through the taxi grid locks quicker. In this kind of business, as Paul has learned, a lot of good human relationship skills, patience and tenacity are required. It is a highly competitive business that requires a lot of determination. Paul also has a rentals business that he values highly as it brings in additional profit. He says his profits amount to 200,000 UGX weekly, and he says using proceeds from this loan, he is going to revamp and refurbish his rental houses.

About his marital status, Paul is married with 4 lively kids who all go to school.

loans.use: to refurbish rental houses

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El Sr. Anibal de 59 años de edad, un ejemplar padre soltero con cuatros hijos, reside en el barrio Santa Lucia de la ciudad de Ita, se dedica a la venta de menudencias por las noches como ser: asaditos, chorizo casero y empanadas, como también por las mañanas sale a vender ropas interiores acompañado de su hijo quien le ayuda en las ventas.
Él cuenta que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de pan de miel y luego de eso trabajó en montajes de antenas por el chaco, pero hoy en día solo realiza su trabajo por la ciudad para estar más cerca de sus hijos.
El crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de carne para la producción de chorizo casero ya que se demanda mucho dicho producto.
Su objetivo principal es la de ver recibido como profesionales a sus hijos y crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
Anibal is 59 years old.  He is an exemplary single father who has four children.  He lives in Santa Lucia neighborhood, in the city of Ita.

In the evenings, Anibal sells food such as roast meat, home-made chorizo and empanadas.  In the mornings, he goes out to sell underwear accompanied by his son who helps him make his sales.

Anibal tells us that he used to sell 'pan de miel' (honey bread), then he worked installing aerials in rural areas but now he only carries out his work in the city so that he can be closer to his children.

Anibel will use the loan that he is requesting to buy meat for making his home-made chorizo since he has a lot of demand for it.  His main goal is to see his children become professionals and to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Izzat

texts.en: Izzat S. is a 38-year-old cattle breeder who has owned his business for the last 5 years. He is married and has three children. His wife actively helps him feed and look after the animals. Izzar usually buys baby calves for a low price, fattens them and then sells them for a profitable price in two months. He takes his cattle to a livestock bazaar or sells them to local people. Izzar has applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase more cattle and increase his income, which will help improve his family's living conditions. We believe his clear goals and experience will bring him success.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: El señor Alberto es artesano y fabrica cochecitos. Es su principal fuente de trabajo. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como ser: láminas de metal, goma, pintura y otros. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Los Andes de la ciudad de El Alto; Alberto es casado y  tiene tres hijos. Es cliente antiguo de Impro desde el año 2005.
texts.en: Mr. Alberto is an artisan, and he makes baby carriages. This is his primary source of income. He needs this loan to buy supplies for this activity, such as sheets of metal, rubber, paint, and other things. His lives in a house he owns, located in the Los Andes area of the city of El Alto. Alberto is married and has three children. He has been a client of Impro since 2005.

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal, rubber, paint, and other supplies to make baby carriages

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
Abu is 32 years old and lives in the New Kru Area. He’s married and has three children between the ages of 9 and 18, all of whom live at home and attend school.

For the past five years Abu has been selling ladies' and gents' wear (shoes, slippers, jeans and T shirts) in the local market. He enjoys his business because he makes a lot of money. 

He’s requesting a loan to purchase more ladies' and gents' wear for his business. He plans to educate his children and build a house for them.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies' and gents' wear for his business.

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Ricardo Palma del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos (solo uno está a su cargo).
Son 9 años que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos, Rosa se dedica a la confección de  lindísimas sabanas, que luego vende a muy buen precio porque utiliza materiales de calidad.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 20 metros  de telas floreadas y 30 metros de raso de diferentes colores para dar más vida a las sabanas.
En su casa tiene su pequeño taller donde trabaja mayormente por las tardes porque por las mañanas se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, todo el dinero del préstamo lo invierte comprando sus materiales de trabajo, porque sabe que después se va duplicar cuando venda sus productos.
"Manuela Ramos da muchas oportunidades a las mujeres que quieren salir adelante por medio de su trabajo".
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the 'Ricardo Palma' community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 48 years old, married, and has four children (only one of whom is in her care).

Rosa has been working with Manuela Ramos for nine years.  Her business is making beautiful sheets which she then sells for a very good price as she uses good-quality materials.

Rosa will use her new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy: 20 meters of flowery material and 30 meters of different-colored satin to liven up her sheets.

At home, Rosa has a small workshop where she works mainly in the afternoons because in the mornings she takes care of her housework.  She will invest all of her loan money in buying materials for her work because she knows that she will double the money later when she sells her products.

"Manuela Ramos gives lots of opportunities to women who want to get ahead in life through their work".

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Ampah

texts.fr: Revendeur des produits d’alimentation générale (spaghetti, riz, sucre…) Ampah a 53ans. Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des cartons de spaghetti, un congélateur et des divers. Sa femme est revendeuse. Il a démarré en 2009.
texts.en: A retailer of grocery products such as spaghetti, rice and sugar, Ampah is 53 years old. He is requesting this loan to purchase spaghetti boxes, a freezer and various products. His wife is a retailer too. He got his start in 2009.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and food products.

loans.name: Ayyob

texts.en:
Ayyob is a 28-year-old man who lives in Gaza City in Palestine. He is engaged and will get married this summer. Ayyob needs a loan of $2,500 to pay for his wedding expenses as he is having it this summer.  Ayyob is a Palestinian National Authority employee and gets a decent salary that doesn't cover all the expenses of preparing his house as well as wedding hall expenses. Getting FATEN's loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, will be easier.

Ayyob is photographed in FATEN's office in Gaza.

loans.use: to pay for his wedding expenses

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 43-year-old married man with 7 children between the ages of 22 and 5 years, living in Karuguuza, Uganda. He lives in his own house where he stays with 6 people, and his desire is to educate his children up to university. 

For 15 years, Joseph has been operating a retail shop business, and from this business he has been able to build a house for the family. He faces the challenge of the high rate of inflation but hopes to make it a wholesale shop. Joseph needs a loan to buy soap, sugar and cooking oil for resale.

loans.use: To buy soap, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mayra Liliana

texts.es:
Mayra tiene 21 años vive en Tulcán con sus padres, no tiene hijos, se describe como una persona seria, tranquila, correcta que le gusta hacer las cosas bien y con cariño, es muy dedicada a su trabajo y cuida a sus padres a los que mantiene.

Trabaja en un local comercial de venta de verduras con su cuñada, frente al mercado del sur en Tulcán, empezó con un pequeño capital que le dió su madre hace 12 años lo cual por la situación económica ella no pudo seguir estudiando.

Es su tercer crédito que realiza a FODEMI en 2 años, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de frutas y verduras para surtir a su local y poder invrementar las ventas y así poder ayudar a su familia en los gastos que necesiten.

Su sueño es poner un mini mercado, incrementar sus ventas y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia ya que son precarias, también quisiera llegar a mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Mayra is 21 years old and lives in Tulcán with her parents. She doesn’t have children. She is characterized as a serious, calm and correct person who likes to do things well and with care. She is very dedicated to her work and takes care of her parents.
She works at a local business center selling vegetables with her aunt. It is located in front of the market in southern Tulcán. She started this business with a small amount of capital that her mother gave her twelve years ago. She was not able to continue with her studies because of her economic situation.
This is the third loan she has received from FODEMI in the past two years. She will use this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables in order to provide more variety to her customers. In this way she can help her family with the expenses that they incur. 
Her dream is to open a mini-market, increase her sales and improve the quality of life for her family, as it is now precarious. She also would like to improve the structure of their house.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables in order to provide a greater variety in her business.

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years, married and has four children.

Karar has been an owner of a bakery since 2007, where he sells and makes pastries and bread. He has good experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to build a stone oven and to renovate and fix his shop’s ceiling, floor and walls. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to build a stone oven and to renovate and fix his shop’s ceiling, floor and walls.

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Chhum is 38 years old and lives with two children whom he supports. 

He generates his income by operating a grocery store. He has been running this business for many years. He sells different kinds of products such as sugar, candy, noodles and snacks. This is his main source of income. 

At the moment, the business is doing well and it gives his family enough income to survive. But Chhum doesn’t want to remain the same; his dream is to see his business grow to one where customers can find anything they need. This is why he has asked for the loan to expand in his business. 

Chhum has placed his faith in God that he will be able to achieve his goals and that he will be able to aspire to have a better life. The loan will be used to buy grocery goods. Chhum hopes to be able to achieve everything he sets out to do and to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods.

loans.name: Gerberta

texts.en:
Gerberta is 50 years old and the mother of nine children.  Her children are already married. That’s why she and her husband are working for themselves. She wants to earn even while staying at home, as her husband goes in the field. So she decided to sell loads (phone cards) as a source of income. As of now, she is earning PHP 300 daily, which she uses to buy their every day needs, such as food.

She wants to increase her net profit to improve their living conditions, so Gerberta is asking for a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy additional loads to sell. She hopes she can change their every day lifestyle into a better one by earning a daily income.

loans.use: to buy additional loads (phone cards) to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Julia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Julia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Julia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Romulo Jr.

texts.en:
Romulo is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. He has been in this business for 25 years. He earns more income from farming sugarcane and fishing.

He has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. He is borrowing PHP 45,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle transport business.

Romulo dreams of saving enough money to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase materials for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Toeun

texts.en: Toeun is a 65-year-old farmer. With her husband, they earn $4 per day. They have two children, one is studying and one is a construction worker who earns $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food and $20 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a hand tractor to transport firewood to sell. This loan will help her family to have a hand tractor that they can use for farming, to rent to the villagers, and to transport firewood to sell.

loans.use: To buy a hand tractor to transport firewood to sell

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julliene is 59 years old and has six children age 18 to 31. All of her children went to school. She is a widow. 

She sells clothes and bed sheets in a store she has been running for eight years. 

Julienne would like a loan to buy more clothes and bed sheets to sell. She would like to use the profits to continue to support her children and their education.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
La señora Angelina tiene 31 años D. edad, está acompañada con el señor Delio, ella estuvo casada por 6 años y D. esa relación tuvo dos hijas D. 12 y 9 años.
La señora Angelina se dedica a la venta D. joyas desD. hace 5 años aproximadamente. Comenta que al principio fue un poco difícil ya que no tenía mucho capital, pero le fue muy bien en el negocio y ahora ya tiene más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Gracias a su trabajo ahora está construyendo para su pequeña casita donD. quiere vivir con sus hijas y con su compañero.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra D. joyas, como ser: anillos, cadenas, pulseras D. plata, lo que le permitirá ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y poder mejorar su ingreso mensual.
texts.en:
Angelina is 31 years old. She is in a relationship with Delio. She was married for six years and from that marriage she had two daughters who are 12 and 9 years old.
Angelica has been selling jewelry for about five years. She says that at first it was a little difficult, because she didn't have a lot of working capital. However, she has done very well in the business and now has a wider variety of merchandise to offer her customers. Thanks to her work she is building her small house where she intends to live with her daughters and her partner.
She requests this loan in order to purchase jewelry, such as silver bracelets, rings and chains. This will allow her to offer varied merchandise to her customers and to increase her monthly profits.

loans.use: to purchase silver bracelets, rings and chains for selling.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios has run her home-based store for almost ten years and she is able to earn about P2,000 monthly. She uses her generated income to pay for her daily household expenses and for electric bills. Though she is widower, still she is doing her best to earn a living. Remedios has been blessed with two children but they have settled into marriage and they separately live with their own families.

Remedios would like to increase the volume of stock merchandise in her home-based store because her travel expenses are costly so she would like to minimize her expenses in going to and from the market. With this in mind, she is asking for additional working capital in the amount of P15,000. This amount will give her greater profits because she will be using her requested loan amount wisely. Remedios believes that her patience will give her greater impact most especially in improving her store and living situation.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her retail store.

loans.name: Virginia Carolina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Vicente se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Virginia, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, tres de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es guardián en una escuela de la localidad.

Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica al comercio,  vende sobrecamas, sabanas y ropa interior tanto de hombres como de mujeres, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días, tres días sale a recorrer y los otros días vende en su casa, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Ella empezó su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del banco hace 15 años y  gracias a esto pudo ayudar a sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar sabanas y ropa interior. Está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo se ha mantenido y sus socias son muy cumplidas.
 
Su sueño es tener un local bien construido.
texts.en:
The “San Vicente” communal bank meets every two weeks in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place noted for being very commercial, for its traditional feast days of Saints Peter and Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.

We met Virginia here.  She’s 58 years old, married and has five children all of which are now adults but three of them still live with her.  Her husband is a watchman at a local school.

Besides being a great housewife, she’s also a merchant; she sells comforters, sheets and underwear for both men and women.  She sells door-to-door and also has a small home- based store.  She works every day.  Three days she goes out selling and the other days she sells at home.  She sells on credit and collects payments every two weeks.  She started her business with the first loan she got from the bank 15 years ago and was able to raise her family with this.

She will use this loan to buy sheets and underwear.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because the group has persisted and the members are very responsible.  Her dream is to have a well-built locale.

loans.use: to buy sheets and underwear.

loans.name: Virginia Del Carmen

texts.es: Virginia del Carmen de 66 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su sobrino el cual está bajo su cuidado. Virginia se caracteriza por ser emprendedora, responsable pero sobre todo carismática. Con mucho esfuerzo a logrado mantener activo un comedor, el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este negocio por lo que ya tiene mucha experiencia en el mismo. Gracias a su carisma se ha ganado la confianza de muchas personas en la zona por lo que ya cuenta con varios clientes fijos. Virginia trabaja muy duro para poder sacar a delante a su sobrino dado que es la única que colabora con la economía del hogar. Su sueño es poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su sobrino por lo que se esfuerza para que su negocio siga funcionando de la mejor manera posible. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en el comedor en la compra de los insumos necesarios (verduras, carnes, frutas, frijoles, arroz, gas propano, etc.) para preparar los ricos platillos que día a día ofrece a los clientes, todo esto lo hace con el fin de abarcar una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar sus niveles de venta y de ingresos y por consecuencia poder lograr su sueño de dar a su sobrino una mejor realidad.
texts.en: Virginia del Carmen is 66 years old and lives in her own home together with her nephew who is under her care. Virginia is characterized as being entrepreneurial, responsible but above all, charismatic. With a lot of dedication, she has managed to actively run a restaurant, which is her primary source of income. She has spent many years working on this business, so that now she is very experienced. Thanks to her charisma, she has gained the respect of many people in the area so that she already has several loyal customers. Virginia works very hard to be able to allow her nephew to get ahead since he is the only one that assists with the economy of their home. Her dream is to better her quality of life and that of her nephew, therefore she strives to keep her business functioning in the best way possible. She made the decision to seek this loan from Integral to invest it in the restaurant to buy the necessary inputs (vegetables, fruit, beans, rice, propane gas, etc.) to prepare the rich meals that each day she offers to her customers. All of this she does with the goal of increasing her demand which will permit her to increase her level of sales and income and consequently she will be able to realize her dream of giving her nephew a better life.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meat, fruit, beans, rice, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: Ferida

texts.en: Ferida is a 33-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom go to school. She been selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan, for four years. Ferida is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Gloire A Dieu Group

texts.fr: GLOIRE A DIEU  est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Henriette D. (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 46  ans. Henriette D .a très peu fréquenté l'école. Henriette D. est mariée à un certain Félicien. Le couple a cinq  enfants, tous scolarisés. Henriette D.  vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Henriette D. vend des tissus et des œufs depuis dix ans.  Henriette D.  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Henriette D.  sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe GLOIRE A DIEU , un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et des plateaux d’œufs.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 12 farmers in Matete District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has three children.

With a portion of this loan, Mary will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Mary plans to use the profits she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total Mary’s group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Caracol Group

texts.es:
La semejanza al caparazón de un caracol es lo que dio el segundo nombre a la comunidad donde la actividad principal es la producción de caña de azúcar, pesca, siembra de maiz y frijol, por ello los habitantes se encuentran ocupados los 365 días del año, en la comunidad se formó un grupo integrado actualmente por  integrantes, los cuales decidieron que el grupo lleve por nombre caracol de esta manera se sienten orgullosos de la comunidad mazateca donde radican.
Los integrantes del grupo so: 
María – Ropa Y Calzado 
Epifania – Taxi, Borregos 
Reyes -Taxi
Emma -Abarrotes
Isidoro -Mojarra
Jose – Calzado Por Catalogo
Emilia – Refresco, Verdura Y Pollo 
Rafael – Trasporte De Caña De Azúcar.
Doña Epifanía tiene 54 años, todos le conocen en la comunidad como Epi o la maestra pues anteriormente se desempeñaba como tal mas le ha brindado la oportunidad a su hija después de graduarse, después de enviudar  “la necesidad económica me orillo a iniciar con mi actividad” y fue así como hace 10 años inicio con el servicio de fletera (trasporte colectivo) por la necesidad de transporté que hay en la comunidad.
La necesidad de ofrecerle lo mejor a su familia y brindarles estudio a sus hijos además de solventar los gastos del funeral de su esposo, doña Epi brinda empleo a 3 personas puesto que tiene actualmente 2 fleteras y un taxi, las ganancias obtenidas las emplea para satisfacer los gastos de su hogar, el pago del seguro de viajero  y el mantenimiento de sus unidades ofreciendo un servicio de calidad a sus clientes.
Recientemente  inicio con la cría de borregos, gallinas ponedoras  lo que le ha permitido incrementar sus ingresos y empezar a ahorrar para poder adquirir una unidad nueva ampliando su concesión continuando  con el patrimonio para sus hijos es por lo que lucha día con día doña Epi como le conocen para lograr tener  5 o más unidades que brinden un servicio de calidad cuyos costos sean accesibles aumentando sus ingresos.
Los prestamos le han permitido continuar con éxito su actividad, el préstamo lo utilizara para dar mantenimiento al taxi y a una camioneta, de igual manera comprara shampo, cera, aromatizante pues los choferes se encargan de mantener limpias las unidades y brindar servicio de calidad a los clientes, por seguridad de los clientes y de los choferes cada unidad cuenta con radio para cualquier imprevisto.
“kjuechire  kui  xuta  xi  kjiminchajonji  nga stikeyanji  ton  xi b´endaan carroja, tsa  kuichu nitjin nga stikeyana ton xi bastean nga carro tjaste” Mazateco
“Gracias a las personas que nos prestan el apoyo económico, a mí para la reparación de mis carros fleteras, algún día solicitare un préstamo para completar para comprar un carro nuevo” expreso doña Epi.
El grupo agradece por las oportunidades que les han brindado con cada préstamo “dios los colme de bendiciones”
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de doña Epi justo donde tiene el taxi al que le dará mantenimiento, ella es quien viste blusa negra con rayas de colores y delante de ella esta su pequeña hija.

loans.use: Dara mantenimiento al taxi y a una camioneta, de igual manera comprara shampo, cera, aromatizante

location.town: Cosolapa Caracol, San Miguel Soyaltepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her farming business.

loans.name: Upini

texts.en: U. is 32 years old and married with three children aged 17, 15 and 11. She sells household goods like coffee, instant noodles, and some snacks. She can generate income of $12 per day; with this income, she can supplement her husband's income. She wants to have a $50 loan to expand her business.  Some of the loan will be used to acquire the driver's license for her husband so that he can become a taxi driver, and the rest will be used to buy more goods for her shop. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Selling Household Goods

loans.name: Juanita Elida

texts.en:
Juanita is an enterprising woman with a huge desire to overcome. She is married and has two children, one who is 14 years old, and another who is one month old. Juanita used to work as a secretary in an accounting office, but because of personnel reductions she had to leave. Due to the need to find a job that would give her an income with which to help her husband, and allow her time to take care of her child, she began selling clothes to her acquaintances and family three years ago. As demand grew, she began to proviD. more products.

When her baby was born, Juanita had many expenses. In order to continue working, she needs a loan of $250.00, which she will use to buy more merchandise. Her mother currently helps her tend to the business and cover the demands from her customers. She promises to pay back the loan during a period of 4 to 8 months. Juanita needs your help to continue working. Thank you for your support of those who most need it.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Juanita es una mujer emprendedora con grandes deseos D. superación, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos, uno D. 14 años D. edad y un pequeño D. apenas un mes D. nacido. Antes Juanita trabajaba D. secretaria en un despacho contable, pero por recorte D. personal salió, ante la necesidad D. obtener un empleo que le permitiera obtener un ingreso para ayudar a su esposo, así como el tiempo para cuidar a su hijo, hace trece años empezó a vender ropa entre sus conocidos y familiares, y al ver la creciente demanda empezó a surtir más productos.

Al nacer su bebé Juanita tuvo muchos gastos y para continuar trabajando necesita D. un crédito D. $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra D. mercancía, ahora cuenta con la ayuda D. su madre para atender el negocio y poder cubrir la demanda D. sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en un lapso D. 4 a 8 meses. Juanita necesita D. tu ayuda para continuar trabajando, gracias por apoyar a quien más lo necesita.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her shoes & clothing retail business

loans.name: Camilo

texts.es:
Camilo is a very hardworker. He is married and has 4 daughters, all of whom are married. He was laid off from the company where he worked for many years, and he had to continue taking care of his family. He saw the need to do something, so with what they gave him when he was laid off he assembled his own business repairing car tires. He learned what he needed to do, and for two years now he has had his shop and his business has been growing. He now has various regular clients and hopes to continue the business to improve the quality of life.

He is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise for his shop, so that he can offer a better service to his clients. He has offered to pay back in the loan in 5 months. Camilo and his family appreciate the support that you give so he can continue to grow his business.

Camilo es un hombre muy trabajador, está casado y tiene cuatro hijas mujeres, todas están casadas, él fue liquidado de la empresa en la que trabajo por mucho años y tenía que seguir manteniendo a su familia, entonces se vio en la necesidad de hacer algo, así que con lo que le dieron en su liquidación armo su propio negocio de reparación de neumáticos de carros, oficio que sabía hacer y desde hace doce años esta con su taller y ha ido creciendo con el, ya ahora tiene varios clientes fijos y desea continuar con el negocio para tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Camilo esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercadería para su taller y así brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, por la cantidad de US $ 925, que ofrece pagar en 5 meses, él y su familia agradecen el apoyo que le das para poder continuar con su negocio y su crecimiento.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Mrs. Doris O. sells provisions & foodstuff in her area in Edo State.  She is 47 years old and is married with 2 children.  She has been in this business since 2000.  She is requesting a loan of $625 to enable her to buy more provisions & foodstuff to sell.  She is currently a LAPO member.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & foodstuff  to sell

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Mrs. Hem S., age 20, works at a garment factory making on average about $1.60 per day.  Her husband would like to be a motor-taxi driver to increase the family’s income.  They have no children.  

She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase a motor-bike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business, which will enable him to earn around $2.50 each day in profit.  Her husband is pictured in the photo with the motorbike he would like to purchase to operate his business as Mrs. Hem S. was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Husna's Kinondoni Group

texts.en:
Husna is 38 years old. She is a widow who takes care of her two children who are 12 and 9. She has a fruit stand, where she sells fruit from 6:30am to 6:30pm daily. This business was started in 1997 and now brings her a monthly profit of about $280.

Husna hopes for a loan to increase the amount of food she can purchase. She will share this loan with Petronila, who has a beauty salon business.

loans.use: To buy fruit stock

loans.name: Mtoni A Group

texts.en:
Zubeda R., age 37, is married and has two children (ages 19 and 5). She owns a shop which she opened two years ago. Zubeda's store is open from 8 am to 8 pm daily, and allows her to make a monthly profit of around US$213.3.

In the past, Zubeda has taken out 2 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes to receive a new loan for further business expansion. Zubeda will share this loan with her sub-group members who have businesses in selling food, plastic scrappers, and other items.

In the picture, Zubeda is the one in the middle.

loans.use: Expansion of a shop

loans.name: Kavuga Group

texts.en:
The Kavuga Group has been together for six years and comprises 16 men and women who each have businesses in the area. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, who will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible

Anet L., the group’s chairperson, is seeking a loan to purchase a refrigerator, some chairs, and drinks to sell in her bar.

Anet runs a bar from which she serves beer and non-alcoholic beverages to the locals in her town of Mpigi. The bar is open every day of the week from 7am to midnight, and Anet works alone, caring for her youngest child during the day. The bar has been in operation since 2005, and sales have steadily increased over time.

Anet is 28 years old. She is married and has two daughters aged nine and four years. Her husband is a forest ranger. They value education highly and hope that their children become accountants or engineers.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator, some chairs, and inventory for her pub.

loans.name: Hoja De Amistad Group

texts.en:
Tania lives with her husband and three children (ages: 16, 14, and 12) in the town of Samana. She is the proud owner of “Salon de Belleza” and she plans on using this loan for shampoo, conditioner, dye, and brushes. When she is not working at the salon she loves to draw, visit with her friends, and in the future she hopes to have a bigger home for her and her family. She is a very energetic and bright woman, and is determined to see her children have a better life than her own.

These 10 women are eagerly awaiting this loan and can’t wait to put it to good use. Thank you to Kiva lenders for your continued support and generosity!

loans.use: Materials for a beauty salon

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice A. is thirty years old, married, and the mother of three children aged ten, six and four years old. She is a member of the community group called Quality Trust Group. Members guarantee loans for one another as social collateral.  She trades in underwears and children’s clothes. She sells these goods by mobile hawking.  Beatrice wants to use the loan of $175 to buy an increased stock of panties, singlets, boxer shorts and children's wears. She believes this will increase her ability to meet her customers' tastes, and therefore result in the acquisition of more income.

loans.use: To buy an increased stock of panties, singlets, boxer shorts and children's wears.

loans.name: Bubiniso

texts.en:
Bubiniso K. is 43 years old. She is married with two children. Her elder daughter is studying at the university and the younger is in school. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family, so Bubiniso is working very hard to help with the family’s expenses.

Bubiniso works in a tailoring shop. During the past five years, she gained rich experience in tailoring. Bubiniso specializes in sewing national dresses. She has always dreamed of owning a business and not having to depend on anyone else. Bubiniso believes that someday her dream will come true and she will open her own tailoring shop.

Today she is applying for a loan for the first time. She is requesting 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) for 12 months to buy new fabrics for sewing national dresses. Bubiniso thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to be accurate with her loan payments. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to make her dream become reality.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabric for sewing national dresses

loans.name: Villa Fatima Ii Group

texts.es:
The Villa Fatima II group is located in Villa Fatima Guabira. It is a group that had problems in its third loan cycle due to the departure of its president. This group has been working in the fourth cycle without any repayment delays. This is due to the support and collaboration of all of the 14 members who took responsibility and know how to work together as they are aware that it is a group guarantee. Maria Roxana J. works selling food and her home is on 21 de Julio Street.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

El grupo Villa Fatima II es un grupo que se encuentra en Villa Fatima Guabira , es un grupo que tubo problemas en el tercer ciclo, debido a la fuga de su presidenta. .Este grupo viene trabajando en el cuarto ciclo sin problemas de retraso. Gracias al apoyo y colaboración de todas las socias del grupo que son un numero de 14 personas que se responsabilizan y saben trabajar en grupo conociendo que es la garantía en grupo y no dejando atrasarse en ninguna de sus reuniones La Sra. Maria Roxana J. se dedica a la venta de comida y su domicilio es en la c/ 21 de julio.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Faustina Palomino

texts.es:
Faustina is a member of the Banco Comunal Buena Suerte community bank.

Faustina is married, is 60 years old and has 4 children. Faustina, along with her retired teacher, formed some years ago a taxi company in the city of Ayacucho. Later they became associates with more people but she is currently the chief shareholder in the company and she has two taxis. Each of the taxis are driven by employees that are paid on a daily basis.

Faustina requires a loan in the amount of 2500 soles. These funds will be invested in the repair of the engine of one of her taxi cabs.

Faustina's dream is to expand her business by purchasing more cars and to stabilize herself financially.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.

Faustina es casada, tiene 60 años y 4 hijos, Faustina junto a su esposo que es jubilado del sector educación, formaron hace algunos años una empresa D. transportes urbano en la ciudad D. Ayacucho para lo cual se asociaron otras personas más, actualmente es la socia mayoritaria D. la empresa y tiene dos unidades que son conducidas por chóferes, a quienes renumera diariamente.

Faustina necesita un préstamo D. 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la reparación del motor D. uno D. sus carros.

Los sueños D. Faustina son mejorar su negocio comprando más unidades y estabilizarse económicamente.

loans.use: Faustina requests a loan in the amount of 2500 soles.  These funds will be invested in the repair of the engine of one of her cars.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Elena es casada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Elena tiene una tienda muy surtida en su casa ubicada en el barrio Wari Accopampa, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, cereales, frutas, carnes, especerías que ella prepara por las tardes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija y también de un personal. Además Elena tiene cabinas de Internet que esta ubicado al frente de su tienda en un local alquilado y esta atendido por un personal.

Elena necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que fue invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite. Elena sueña con seguir adelante, ampliar su negocio, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elena is a partner in the Rainbow Communal Bank.

Elena is 43 years old and married, with four children. She owns a well-stocked grocery store, where she sells vegetables, grains, fruits, meats, and fresh spices. She prepares the spices every afternoon with her daughter and an employee. Elena's store is located in her home in the Wari Accopampa neighborhood. She also runs an internet cafe, located in a rented space across the street. The internet cafe is tended to by an employee.

Elena needs a loan of 3000 soles, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and cooking oil.

Elena dreams of getting ahead, expanding her business, and providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elena needs a loan of 3000 soles, which was invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Azam

texts.ru:
Узбеков Азам житель города Яван. В центре города имеет магазин , где торгует продуктами питания. Занимается данным видом бизнеса уже два года. Бизнес приносит прибыль , которую хватает лишь на то , чтобы прокормить семью. Азам  имеет большую семью . Он женат и имеет шестерых детей. 
 Для развития бизнеса необходимо дополнительное влияние финансовых средств. Поэтому он планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Это поможет ему получить дополнительную прибыль.
texts.en:
Azam U. is a citizen of the city of Yavan. He owns a store in the center of the city, where he trades groceries. He has been involved with this type of business for two years already. The business brings in profits, which are barely enough to feed his large family. Azam is married and has 6 children. To increase his business it is imperative that a financial intervention occurs. Therefore he plans to receive a loan which he plans to repay within 12 months. This will help him increase his profits.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of commodity circulation

loans.name: Abinbola

texts.en: Abinbola is married with 7 children and she is 52 years old. Abinbola is focused on her business and wants to expand her business of selling clothes and shoes. She has had her business for a long time. Abinbola lives in Ipaja, Lagos state, Nigeria. She is hoping for a loan to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Françoise

texts.en:
Françoise A. was born around 1959 in Porto-Novo and she is married to Léonard Ahouanye, a plumber. She is the mother of 6 children and 2 are still at home. Her father was a fisherman and her mother a food vendor. She learned to sew but she didn't like it much, so decided to start a business. She began by selling bouillie (nutritious soup) and afterwards she learned to sell bags of jute (plant fiber) and bags of rice. Today she sells rice, and is applying for her fourth loan to buy more supplies.

Dame A. Françoise est née vers 1959 à Porto-Novo, elle est mariée à AHOUANYE Léonard qui est un plombier de profession et est mère de 06 enfants dont deux à la charge des parents. Son père était un pêcheur et sa mère vendeuse de nourriture. Elle a été apprenti couturière mais cela ne lui répondait pas tellement et elle a entamé le commerce, au début elle a commencé par la vente de la bouillie et après elle essaye la vente des sacs de jut et du riz où elle est devenue une experte en cela et aujourd'hui vend les sacs du riz. La demande de ses clients étant devenue plus forte elle est venue nous voir, elle est à son 4eme crédit et c'est pour s'approvisionner en plusieurs sacs de riz et des sacs de jut.

loans.use: 5 bags or rice and a few dozen bags of juts (plant fiber)

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.en:
Rafoat is a hard-working woman. She is married and has three children. For the past 17 years, Rafoat has dedicated herself to selling office supplies and books for schoolboys. Her husband was employed with a construction company, but his contract ended. With her husband’s income missing, bills started to pile up and Rafoat decided to start her own business to generate her own income to try to fill the gap. She likes what she sells and has developed a stable enterprise.

Rafoat has requested a loan of $600 USD to help purchase a new supply of items to sell. She commits to paying her loan back within 12 months. This is an important matter for this family's well-being. Please help Rafoat's business grow. She truly appreciates your generosity.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today it remains a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war that ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged its already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

About IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Purchase office supplies to sell

loans.name: San Nicolas Group

texts.es: El grupo "SAN NICOLAS" esta representado por la señora Jenny y conformado por doce socias que en su mayoría radican en la Zona D. San Nicolas, por lo que surge el nombre del grupo. La mayorias D. las socias se dedica a actividades como la costurería D. prendas D. vestir y a la elavoracion D. tejidos y prendas D. lana tejidas a mano, algunas se dedican a la venta D. abarrotes, venta D. comidasy verduras frescas en un mercado altamente competitivo, pero las socias saben que su trabajo es D. buena calidad y a bajo precio por lo que la competencia pasa desapercivida. El crédito esta destinado a la compa D. materiales en insumos para un producto terminado mas fino y D. mayor calidad para competir en el mercado comercial. Las socias cuentan con experiencia en creditos solidarios pero cursan juntos su primer ciclo con la Fundacion Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The Group “San Nicolas” is represented by señora Jenny and is comprised of twelve members who, by majority live in the area of San Nicolas, hence the name of their group. The majority of the group members make clothing, producing hand-woven garments like ones of wool. Some sell groceries, food, and vegetables in a market that is very competitive, but the members of the group know that their work is of high quality and low price, and so they hardly notice the competition.
