This loan is to be used to buy materials like consumables so that they may offer refinished product of the highest quality to compete in the commercial market. The members of “San Nicolas” have some experience with supportive loans but this is their first time working with Fundacion Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for business operations.

loans.name: Arabbibi

texts.ru:
Ширинова Араббиби Туйчиевна родилась в 1958 году. Она замужем и имеет 5 детей. Араббиби по национальности узбек, живет и работает в Гисарском районе. Она торгует детскими одеждами широкого ассортимента и для любого сезона. В этом бизнесе она завоевала доверие у многих постоянных клиентов. Закупает свой товар с оптового рынка «Корвон» и продает в местном рынке «Мубориз».  А иногда сама ездит за товаром в Бишкек.
Араббиби очень хотелось бы еще закупить комплекты для новорожденных и таким образом  увеличить оборотный капитал. Для этого она хочет получить займ  в сумме 1500 сомони сроком на 3 месяца.
texts.en:
Arabbibi S. was born in 1958. She is married and has 5 children. Arabbibi lives and works in Gissarskiy region. She sells clothing for children at a local market. Arabbibi buys most of her goods at the wholesale market "Korvon," but sometimes she buys them in Beshkek. Arabbibi will use this loan to purchase clothing sets for newborns. She will repay the loan within 3 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing sets for newborns

loans.name: Aneth

texts.en:
Aneth is a snacks seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to the Makunguru group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $20. Every day, she works at her business for 11 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Tanzania, so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Aneth is 50 years old, widowed, and has five children.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Nejua

texts.en:
Nejua R. is currently in the business of selling meat, rice, beans, etc. at the hotel. She is requesting a loan to expand the business. Nejua is 37 years old and widowed. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more tables and chairs

loans.name: Ilkham

texts.en:
Ilkham M. is a 48 year old trader who has been selling sweets, confectioneries and candies in his own store for the last 8 years. He is married and has three children. The youngest studies at school and other two are studying at university.

Ilkham enjoys working in his store because this is the main source of income for his family. He is a chairman of a local municipality department, but as this job is governmental his salary is very low. He purchases his goods from near downtown because he lives in the village. As the products Ilkham sells are very popular Ilkham would like to expand his business, and for this purpose he has applied for a US $2,000 loan.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for resale

loans.name: Saima M. Nasir Group

texts.en:
My name is Saima, a 24-year-old married lady. For the past five years I have resided in a two-room brick house in Lahore, a Pakistani city famous for its historical sites and its Punjabi foods. I completed my education till 10th standard but couldn’t study further because my parents married me off to a resident of Lahore. His name is M. N. who, for the past two years, has operated a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle), an arrangement requiring him to pay half his income to the owner.

I am a mother of two daughters, neither of whom attends school because my husband’s income is inadequate. But I now have started a beauty parlor because I want to give my daughters an education so that they can have secure futures and independent lives. I have repaid my first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and am now applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for my husband so that he will get the whole income from his struggle.

I am the group leader of four other women from my locality. Bushra baji and Hamidan baji and Shamshad baji each want a loan to buy beams for their shuttering businesses. Nasreen Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is 48 years old. He lives and maintains a piggery business in the village of San Lorenzo Ilagan, Isabela. He is married to Eponela S. and they are blessed with three children. His eldest child, Sherwin, is 26 years old and a high school graduate. Joey is 24 years old and a college graduate. Adrian and is currently studying in college. 
Mario is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 for his piggery business. Mario is able to generate an income of PHP 800 for every piglet that he sells to individual buyers who also want to raise pigs. He plans to expand his piggery house into a larger space so he can raise more pigs. Mario hopes to avail the loan he is requesting because he believes it will serve as a means to continue paying for his youngest child’s education. He is dreaming that his child will finish his education. He knows that nothing is impossible if he does his best to succeed in his business endeavor.

loans.use: Expand piggery house

loans.name: Luz Rosenda

texts.es:
La señora Luz Rosenda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Rumbo al desarrollo”, vive en la Av. Perú Nº 284, Distrito de Morales, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 49 años, tiene 01 hijo que aun depende de ella.

Luz Rosenda, es una mujer luchadora que le gusta trabajar y depender de ella misma, por eso nos cuenta que desea implementar su propio negocio, y se dedica a vender productos naturales de la marca Omnilife.

Cuenta con un pequeño local, bien ambientado; ubicado en su misma casa, donde atiende al público en general, amigos y familiares.
Nos cuenta que se inició primero con una botica, y después implementó su negocio al que ahora actualmente se dedica. 
Hoy en día se ha convertido en una gran empresaria y ya es conocida por sus clientes.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00, comprará mas productos naturales Omnilife en cajas para su stock. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando una vitrina, para poner sus productos y así mostrar a sus clientes.

Luz Rosenda, esta muy segura que su negocio prosperará mas y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Luz Rosenda belongs to the Communal Bank “Women Bound for Development”, and she lives in the Morales District, San Martin Province, Department of San Martin. She lives with her partner, is 49 years old, and has 1 child that depends on her. Luz Rosenda is a determined woman who likes to work and depends on herself, because of that she tells us that she hopes to expand her own business in the sale of Omnilife brand natural products. She has a small locale, with a great environment, located in her own home where she attends to the general public, friends, and family members. She tells us that she first began with a small pharmacy and later expanded her business to that to which she currently dedicates herself. At present she has become a great businesswoman and is now well known by her clients. With this loan of 1,000 PEN she will purchase boxes Omnilife natural products for her stock. Part of the money will also be invested in the purchase of a display case in which to place her products to show to her clients. Luz Rosenda is very certain that her business will prosper even more, and thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement organization for contributing to her being able to fulfill her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more natural products.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “Renacer” es parte del centro focal Panamericana, la población que asiste a este centro se caracteriza por ser mujeres que migraron de comunidades rurales y se asentaron por lugares periurbanos, así las integrantes de la asociación Renacer tiene esta característica, poniendo en práctica negocios que aprendieron en su lugar de origen, como ser el tejido a mano.
La asociación trabaja junto  a Pro-Mujer hace más de cuatro años, su presidenta es Julia G., madre de tres hijos, ella ha formado el grupo en sus inicios con vecinas de su barrio, Julia es una de las que se dedica al tejido de guantes y gorras de invierno, afirma  que con la ayuda de créditos pudo incrementar los ingresos de sus familia, siendo así que ahora puede pagar a dos de sus hijas para aumentar la producción en sus tejidos. Otras  de las integrantes se dedican a la fabricación de  sogas y algunas  tienen negocios de producción de muebles tallados.
La mayoría de las integrantes de este grupo, solicitan créditos para comprar materia prima (lana y madera)
texts.en:
The community association "Renacer" is part of the Panamerican focal center. The women attending the center are women who migrate from rural communities and settle in periurban areas, and the members of the association "Renacer" are no exception, they carry out the kind of business they learned at their place of origen, such as knitting.

The association has been working with Pro-Mujer for more than four years. The president, Julia G., mother of three, started the group with neighbors. Julia is knitting gloves and caps for winter, as well as other members, and she states that with the support of loans she managed to increase her family income and now she is able to pay two of her daughters to increase the production. Other members make ropes and some have businesses making carved furniture. The majority of the members requests loan to buy raw material (wool and wood).

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 41 years old, is married and a mother with four children. All of her children are currently in school. They are a very humble family who wants to invest in the future. She is a petty trader and sells items like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked and dried fish, tinned tomatoes, bags of rice etc. Selling these products, she says, stock moves very fast and you can easily recover your money. She takes delivery of goods from the capital city of Kumasi.

With 25 years' experience in her business, she wants to add other foodstuffs like maize, eggs and others which are frequently demanded by her customers. She believes that this can be possible with the help of loan assistance. She wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, spices, tinned tomatoes etc. She is much convinced that the loan would help her increase her stock in the event of a price hike.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs like cooking oil, bags of rice, spices and tinned tomatoes etc.

loans.name: Cesar Hernan

texts.es: Oriundo de la provincia de Tarma, emigró a Lima con sus pequeños hijos de su primer compromiso, a fin de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. César empezó a vender desayuno hace diez años en una carreta ambulatoria, en ese entonces ayudaba a Catalina Barra Vilca, quien ahora es su esposa, con quien tuvo dos hijos más. Durante los seis meses que trabajó con ella ahorró un pequeño capital invirtiéndolo en un carrito para trabajar en la venta de desayuno pero ahora de manera independiente; con los ingresos de este negocio les dieron a sus hijos educación escolar, compraron un pequeño terreno. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD lo invirtió en la construcción de su vivienda, posteriormente compró abarrotes con un pequeño capital para empezar con  esta venta, lo que generó ganancias y actualmente es una pequeña tiendita surtida, gracias a los créditos que recibió de nuestra institución durante este año y medio. El préstamo reciente lo invirtió en su matrimonio, y piensa seguir invirtiendo en su tienda a fin de terminar en la ampliación de su casa.
texts.en:
Originally from the province of Tarma, César moved to Lima with his small children from his first marriage in order to provide them with a better quality of life. For the past ten years César has sold breakfast from an ambulatory cart. He was helping Catalina, who has now become his wife. They have two children together. During the six months that he worked with Catalina, he has saved a little bit of capital. They invested this money in their own little cart that they use to sell breakfast. They now are independent business people. With the investment in this business they have provided an education for their children and have purchased a small plot of land. With the first loan that they received from “EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD" they invested in the construction of a house. Previously he bought groceries with a small amount of capital in order to start a small grocery store. The store has generated income and actually is a small store with a variety of items thanks to the loans that he received from our institution during the last year and a half. With his most recent loan he invested in his wife’s business and he hopes to continue investing in his store until he finishes building his home.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Zoila Del Socorro

texts.es:
La microempresaria Zoila del Socorro E. tiene 37 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solamente 3 estudian los otros 2 aun no se encuentran en edad de estudiar, Doña Zoila se dedica a la actividad de costura desde un poco mas de 20 años y sus principales clientes son jóvenes del barrio a quienes les confecciona sus uniformes y trajes casuales.
Esta costurera ya ha sido beneficiada con un crédito de US 500 dólares los cuales pudo cancelar antes del tiempo previsto, ya que obtuvo un pequeño contrato en donde confecciono uniformes de una institución local. El cual aprovecha la microempresaria Zoila E. para agradecer a Kiva y a los prestamistas por su gesto tan noble al cederle ese préstamo.
Sin embargo el próximo mes de Septiembre se aproximan las fiestas patrias y desde ya tiene varios encargos para confeccionar blusas y camisas escolares al igual que faldas y pantalones de uniformes.
Para tal encargo la señora E. debe comprar la tela tanto de las camisas y blusas como de los pantalones y faldas, por lo que necesita se le financie para comprar:

2 Rollos de Tela color blanca marca Sincatex la cual compra a US 260 cada rollo  y 2 rollos de  tela color azul marca Dacron tico la cual compra a US 90 cada rollo.
texts.en:
The micro-entrepreneur Zoila del Socorro E. is 37 years old and has 5 children, of whom only 3 are in school and the other 2 are not yet school-aged. Mrs. Zoila has pursued sewing for more than 20 years, and her main clients are youngsters from the neighborhood, for whom she makes uniforms and casual clothes. This seamstress has already benefitted from a loan of $500, which she repaid before the designated time, since she got a small contract, for which she made uniforms for a local institution. Zoila E. is thankful to Kiva and the lenders for their noble gesture of granting her this loan. In September, many parties are getting closer and until then, she has many orders to make blouses and school shirts, as well as skirts and pants for uniforms. For such orders, Mrs. E. must buy enough fabric for shirts, blouses, pants and skirts. She needs the loan to buy 2 rolls of Sincatex-brand white fabric, each of which costs $260, and 2 rolls of Dacron-brand blue fabric, each of which costs $90.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Sincatex-brand white fabric and Dacron-brand blue fabric

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana es socia del Banco Comunal Inti.
Viviana es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Viviana tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hijo. Además Viviana viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende papa, carbón, verduras de acuerdo al pedido.
Viviana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Viviana son construir su casa de material noble y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.

loans.use: Para la compra de cereales.

loans.name: Cely

texts.en:
Cely has managed a general store in her village for almost nine years. She generates a weekly gross income of PHP 6,000 that she wisely budgets for her family and for business maintenance. With her dream of developing her store, she is now requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 from Kiva lenders.

Cely is 54 years old and married to Roberto, a tricycle driver. They have no children and the couple lives a simple life in the village of Barangcuag, a rural but peaceful place in which to live.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
el Sr. Bernardo O. tiene 50 años de edad, el se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado para carniceria, tambien en ocasiones compra ganado de leche.
este negocio es muy bueno ya que todas las semanas esta comprando vacas, los dias que mas se vende es antes del fin de semana ya que los carniceros compran las carnes para venderlas en los mercados comunales y locales de la ciudad de choluteca, el dia sabado y domingo es cuando mas se vende en los mercados.
ahora el necesita comprar un ganado ya que hace unos meses atras tuvo problemas y quedo sin capital y ahora se esta reponiendo de dicha perdida por tal razon es que solicita el credito.
esta es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. Bernardo O. is 50 years old and he buys and sells cattle to meat-packers and also occasionally buys milk cows. His business is very good since every week he's buying cattle. His highest sales days are before the weekends since the butchers buy meat then to sell in the local market and in stores in Cholutecca. Saturdays and Sundays are the busiest market days. At this point, he needs the loan to purchase livestock as a few months ago he had some problems that left him with no capital and he's trying to recover from his losses. This business is his only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Perenlii

texts.en:
Perenlii D. is a 43-year-old single mother who lives with her two children in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her children live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her son currently lives and works in Poland, and her daughter attends high school at home.

D. operates a dairy products business in her town. She started her business in 2001 with capital amounting to 500,000 tugrugs, and has made much progress with her business over the years. When she started, she had very few reliable dairy suppliers and had to rely on friends in the countryside. However, with years of experience, she is now well established and has many reliable suppliers and customers. Today her working capital exceeds 1,500,000 tugrugs.

D. uses her earnings to support her family and says, "All I want is to provide my children with a happy and quality life." She is requesting a 725,000 tugrug loan to purchase more dairy products to sell through the winter and early spring, when the products will be in high demand.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products to sell through the winter and early spring when the products will be in high demand

loans.name: Virgen De Cotoca Group

texts.es: El grupo “Virgen de Cotoca” esta representado por la señora Carolina y conformada por 12 miembros muy dinámicas puesto que desean realizar actividades para confraternizar y unirse mas como grupo; las señoras tienen una amistad desde hace mucho tiempo y son vecinas del barrio. desempeñan diferentes tipos de actividades comerciales y de servicio como la atención en salones de belleza, tienda de abarrotes, venta de comida y venta de cosméticos  y en cuanto al socio tiene una venta de abarrotes y cuando hay conciertos de artistas vende refrescos en el lugar de actuación la señora Carolina tiene su venta de refrescos ella desea diversificar sus productos, la mayoría de las socias tiene sus puestos de venta en la puerta de sus hogares y el resto son vendedoras ambulantes a  pesar de las adversidades la socias saben como salir adelante ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que es alto pero cuando la competencia los perjudica mueven sus puestos a lugares más alejados del mercado central consiguiendo mejores ventas. El destino del financiamiento es para surtir sus tiendas, compra de material de trabajo, compra de insumos en mayor cantidad y las promotoras de cosméticos aprovecharon las ofertas. Su mayor expectativa es agrandar sus puestos para generar un mejor ingreso para poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y una mejor calidad de vida para todas sus familias. A pesar de ser su primer ciclo los socios ya cuenta con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a entidades financieras similares a la Fundación Agocapital con la cual se encuentran agradecidos por la confianza y el apoyo económico brindado.
texts.en:
The “Virgen de Cotoca” Group, represented by Ms. Carolina, is comprised of 12 very dynamic members who wish to participate in activities together to fraternize and become more unified as a group. As they are neighbors, the women have had a friendship for a very long time. They all partake in various commercial and service activities, such as beauty salons, general stores, food sales, and cosmetics. One member has a general store, and when there are concerts in the area, he sells beverages at the venue. Ms. Carolina has her own beverage business, but would like to diversify her products. The majority of group members have stands in front of their homes, and the rest are street vendors. Despite all the adversities that they face, they know how to get ahead because their families depend on it. Concerning competition, we can say that it is high, but when it gets too tough, the group members simply move their stands away from the central market, thus boosting their sales. This loan will be used to restock their shops, purchase work materials and supplies in bulk, and the members who sell cosmetics will take advantage of the ongoing sales. Their greatest hope is to expand their stands to generate greater revenues so that they can offer their children a better future and quality of life. Despite the fact that this is their first loan cycle, the group members already have previous experience working in solidarity groups thanks to financial institutes similar to Fundación Agocapital, to which they are very grateful for their trust and monetary support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch S. lives in the Pour Ta Mouk village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder and sells the duck eggs. Her poultry business is going well, so she wants to expand it by purchasing 100 more ducks for breeding and duck food. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions.

Her husband, Mr. Im Phorn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice. This couple has four children; one is a teacher in the local school, two others are farmers, and the other child attends the local school.

loans.use: Purchase 100 more ducks for breeding and duck food

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita A. is from the village of Sta Rosa. She is 48 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Florita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Florita earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.
Florita joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Florita's third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the borrower's business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nezikokolima Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Yeko is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a hard-working business lady who has been selling agricultural products, such as matooke and sweet potatoes, for so long! Yeko started on a very small scale in the Lugazi Central market but, at the moment, she is able to make decent profits. She says that her loans enable her to stock quality produce for her customers and as a result, she gets more profits. Yeko needs a loan to help increase the capital in her business so that she is able to buy more produce to resell, especially now when the consumption rate is high. 

She is a member of a group, each requesting a loan.

loans.use: Buying more matooke for resale.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita D. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 29 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marita owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Marita is just starting this business.
In 2009, Marita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Hudaynazar

texts.ru: Мусаев Худайназар проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 57 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Мусаев Худайназар имеет среднее Техническое образование по специальности "Продавец". Животноводством занимается более 30 лет. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Hudaynazar M. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 57 years old, married and has 4 children. Hudaynazar has a secondary technical education as a salesperson. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 30 years. He raises and sells livestock. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Janyl's Group

texts.en:
Balykchy is a town in Kyrgyzstan. For many years this town has been famous for fishing. In previous times, this town was Rybachyi, which means Fishermen. Janyl J. is one of the citizens of this historical town. She is the elder daughter in her family, and that’s why she has more responsibility for the things which happen around her. As the eldest one, she has leadership qualities. After graduating from school with the help of her parents, who gave her 20,000 KGS ($445), she opened up a little business by renting a pavilion which later on became a bigger one. Now the turnover is 150,000 KGS ($3,335) and there is no more renting because they have their own pavilion. Her business is selling carpets and rugs. She sells them in the new market of Balykchy town. She is married and has a child. Her husband helps her in her business and supports her as well in life. Their revenue is about 30,000 KGS ($665). The future plans are to open another pavilion where they would sell domestic appliances. Now they decided to take out a loan to buy a new gas cooker and new oven, as the previous ones are too old.

Aynur DJ. is a forty-nine-year-old, married woman whose husband takes across passengers. She has two children, both age  fifteen and attending the local school. About three years ago they started baking spice cakes and selling them in Bishkek. They began this business with 10,000 KGS ($225). They are planning to increase their experience by expanding their assortment. At the present time, they make two kinds of pastries, and the turnover is about 20,000 ($445). They want a loan to buy coloring agents, flour, sugar and cake boxes.

Chynar A. is forty-one years old and a married woman. She has three children. The elder son is a student and a daughter is a schoolgirl.  The youngest one is at home. Her husband works as an electrician in a company. She is planning to trade with fish and provide education for her children as well, but now she works in a confectionery. Her salary is 2,000 KGS ($45). She wants a loan to make her plan come true by investing money to grow.

Kaiyrkul K. is thirty-two and a married woman. She has a husband who works in the construction business and has a salary of from 2,000 to 3,000 KGS ($45 to $65).  She has three daughters who attend the local school. Like every parent, she wants to provide for education for her children in the future.  Now she works in a confectionery for 2,000 KGS ($45) per month, but it is not enough. That is why she wants a loan to trade with fish as well.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy a new gas cooker and new oven

loans.name: Eron

texts.en: Eron is 48 years old and married with five children aged between 8 and 18 all of whom go to school. The family, which includes four additional family members she cares for, live in a three-room house. The house has electricity but no piped water. The family has three meals a day. Her monthly expenses include utility bills, school fees for her children, medication and feeding the family. Eron owns a stall in Nakawa market selling second hand clothes. She buys these clothes from city markets in Owino so incurs transportation costs to and fro. She has been in this business for ten years and has an average of 10 customers a day. Her main challenges are defaulters, the rainy season because her work place is open, and the ever increasing cost of the second hand clothes she buys. She has been with MCDT for over seven years and is on her sixteenth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second hand clothes and hopes to see her business expand.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Maria Laura

texts.es:
Maria Laura M. Ramírez tiene 28 años, es casada, y  tiene dos hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Grupo Enmanuel es un recinto que se encuentra a cuarenta y cinco minutos del Cantón Guaranda capital de la Provincia de Bolívar.  Son 17 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Ganadera son indígenas hablan Quechua en su totalidad 
Maria trabaja en la agricultura para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, arveja, trigo  y papas  además se dedica a la cría animales en la casa como borregos y gallinas los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda cada seis meses.

La cultura principal es el carnaval que se celebra todos los años en febrero.  También, a Maria  le gusta lavar, cocinar y tejer en los tiempos libres. 

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos y las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Maria Laura M. Ramírez is 28 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the canton of Guaranda in Bolívar Province.

She is a member of the Enmanuel Communal Bank, which meets at an enclosed area 45 minutes away from the canton of Guaranda, which is the capital of Bolívar Province. There are 17 members of the group in total. Guaranda is a farming and ranching community where the entire indigenous population speaks Quechua.

Maria works as a farmer in order to boost her family’s finances. The crops that she excels in growing are corn, peas, wheat, and potatoes. She also raises animals from home, including sheep and chickens. Maria sells the animals from her house and her crops at the wholesale market in Guaranda every six months. The main cultural event is Carnival, which is celebrated every year during the month of February. Maria also enjoys cooking, cleaning, and sewing during her free time.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her work around the farm, especially fertilizers and compost. Her goal is to have good economic activity for her family. The challenges that she faces are weather problems and diseases that affect her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost, fertilizers, and other supplies

loans.name: Marcony Alberto

texts.es: El  Sr. Marconi Alberto S. García   él se dedica a la venta de repuestos automotriz el tiene catorce  años de tener este negocio, es padre  de un  hijo en edad escolar, es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  Onces  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su negocio para ampliarlo más y de esta manera llegar a crecer en su negocio. Igualmente este crédito lo solicita para comprar productos para su negocio como es bomba inyectora, bujías para carros etc.
texts.en:
Marconi Alberto S. García has sold spare parts for automobiles for fourteen years. He is married and the father of one school-aged son. He has had eleven previous loans from CEPRODEL and each has allowed him to develop and improve his business and thereby help it to grow. He will use this loan to purchase items for his business, such as injection pumps, spark plugs, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for automobiles

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme commerce la vente de charbons de bois et ce depuis 2007, plus tard elle a associé à ce commerce la vente d’ignames, elle demande de WAGES un prêt pour s’approvisionner avec 20 sacs de charbons de bois, des tubercules  et divers.
Elle est célibataire et ce commerce lui permet de subvenir à ses propres besoins
texts.en:
This lady has a business selling charcoal and has been doing this since 2007. Subsequently she complemented this activity with the sale of yams. She is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to get fresh supplies: 20 sacks of charcoal, tubers and other items. She is single and this business allows her to provide for her needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and yam tubers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials for the decorations.

loans.name: Lourdes Iris

texts.es:
la sra. Lourdes Iris D. G. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en el barrio Suyapa en la ciudad de Nacaome.
Lourdes se dedica a la venta de refrescos y golosinas como ser: tacos, enchiladas, baleadas, tortillas con quesillo, burritas de carne, desayunos, etc.
tiene un par de años de tener su negocio. Lourdes dice sentirse muy feliz ya que su negocio esta creciendo cada dia un poco mas, esto se debe a que lourdes atiende a sus clientes personalmente y les brinda un servicio especial.
es muy querida por muchas personas.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar materiales para fabricar sus golosinas, las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 33 years old and lives in the Suyapa neighborhood in the city of Nacaome. She sells soft drinks and snacks such as tacos, enchiladas, baleadas, tortillas with cheese, meat burritos, breakfast, etc. She has had this business for two years. She says that she is very happy that her business is growing a bit more each day. This is because Lourdes provides personal and friendly service to her customers. She is loved by many people. She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies and ingredients to make snacks. She needs the income in order to come out ahead with her family and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante (G 3,4, 5) Group

texts.en:
Elena is the coordinator of her group, Con Dios Adelante (With God in the Lead). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in La Romana, a rural area of the country dedicated to the sugar cane harvest, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-time partner and their 4 children.

Elena is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business: purchase clothes, food and other supplies for her small neighborhood convenience store. She will use the profits to improve the lives of her children (by purchasing school supplies, shoes, backpacks) and making improvements to heir home windows. She hopes for  the well-being of her family and to own a larger store in the future. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy supplies (clothes, food) for a small convenience store.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon S. has spent her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learnt from her grandparent when she was young. She is now married and has three kids who go to school. Her husband works as a vehicle repairman and also frequently works alongside her on the farm. 

Fishing is a popular business which is able to deliver good profits for most operators. Phon S. and her husband want to operate this business to generate additional income. To start the process, Phon S. decided to look for capital in order to buy a net, trap, and other equipment needed to fish around the river.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and a mother of six children. She has suffered from the death of her father and from the inability to provide enough food and school fees for her family. She went to a private nursing school and has been unemployed.

Motivated by these difficulties, she became a GHAPE member and was trained in business management, marketing techniques, and credit discipline.

She turned to GHAPE to take a loan to invest in her oil mill. She has been very hard working for her farm production. As she says, my farm house is full of harvested crops because of my hard work.

Now she requests a loan of 500000 to buy an oil mill to produce palm oil and to farm more crops.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.

Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase an oil mill.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, palm oil, sugar, flour and beans

loans.name: Silvia Del Carmen

texts.es: Silvia del Carmen Sáenz Álvarez es una mujer de 38 años con visión y deseos de superación ella inició hace cuatro años una pequeña venta y dos años después pudo surtirla más y trasladarse con ella donde hoy es su casa de habitación, en la cual recibe el apoyo de su esposo y uno de sus hijos. El crédito lo utilizará para surtir más el negocio y de ese modo cumplir su meta hacerlo crecer y con él sacar adelanta a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Silvia is a 38 year old woman with the vision and desire to improve her life. Four years ago she began a small sales business and two years later she was able to increase her inventory and move the business into what is now her home. She receives help from her husband and one of her children. She will use the loan to buy more stock for her business thus achieving her goal of growing her business and raising her children.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock Business

loans.name: Reina Marcelina

texts.es:
la sra. Reina Marcelina M. se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de granos básicos como ser maiz y frijoles. 
Su negocio esta  ubicado en la comunidad de El Pescadero del municipio de Danlí, Reina cuenta con varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, dichos productos los vende en su casa y en comunidades cercanas.
su mercado potencial lo tiene en EL Paraíso y Danlí.
el negocio lo atiende personalmente y cuenta con una buena clientela lo que le hace ser un negocio rentable.

el credito lo utilizara  para la compra de frijoles de primera ya que se aproxima la temporada de su cosecha y piensa estar preparada para la comercialización de dicho producto ya que muchos de los productores lo venden para la siembras de postrera y necesitan efectivo inmediato tambien comprara maiz.
texts.en:
Ms. Reina Marcelina M. is a saleswoman. Her principal activity is selling basic grains like corn and beans. Her business is located in the community of El Pescadero, in the municipality of Danlí. Reina has several years of experience in this business. She sells the aforementioned products from her house and in the surrounding communities. She has potential markets in El Paraíso and Danlí. She tends her business personally and has a good customer base that makes her business profitable. She will use this loan first to purchase beans, as the harvest season is approaching and she wants to be ready for the sale of the aforementioned products, because many producers sell for the planting season and need cash immediately to buy corn.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy basic grains (beans and corn)

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza C. is from the village of Malandog, Rogongon, Iligan City. She is 34 years old. Analiza is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Analiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Analiza is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Malandog, Rogongon, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ignacia Candelaria

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.
 
La señora Ignacia tiene 35 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 14 años,  tiene tres hijos los cuales estudian en escuela y colegio. El marido se dedica a la albañilería. Es socia fundadora del banco y está muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir por la ayuda que le han brindado.

Tiene una pequeña granja donde cría chanchos, ella compra los chanchos cuando están pequeños, luego los cría y después de 4 o 5 meses los vende en pie o los faena,  los vende por libras a sus vecinos y tiendas locales, nos cuenta que en 5 meses llegan a pesar hasta 200 libras las que venden a buen precio y deja buenas ganancias, trabaja todos los días unas tres a cuatro horas, sus hijos le ayudan más que todo cuando tiene que alimentarlos.

Va a utilizar este crédito para comprar 10 chanchos, alimento y medicinas para su mejor desarrollo.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para ir a entregar directo a los mercados y frigoríficos.
texts.en:
The community bank named Maria the Helper meets in the La Sequita district belonging to Montecristi in the Manabita region. The population is hard working, dedicated, and proud of their heritage. La Sequita is a district whose inhabitants are honest and only want to work and support their families. Ignacia is 35 years old and she has lived with her boyfriend for the past 14 years. They have three children together; all are attending school. Her partner is a construction worker. She is a founding member of the this community bank and she is very grateful to Fundacion Espoir (Kiva Field Partner) for the help they have provided her. She has a small farm from where she raises pigs. She buys the pigs when they are only piglets and she raises them. When they are 4 or 5 months old she sells them as livestock or as meat, selling them to her neighbors and to local stores. When they reach 5 months of age they reach 200 lbs so she is able to sell them at a good price, yielding a good profit. She works every day about three or four hours. Her children help her, especially in feeding them. She will use her loan to purchase 10 piglets, feed, and medicines to raise them. Her dream is to purchase a car and be able to deliver the products herself, to the markets and to butcher shops.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 10 piglets, feed and livestock medicines.

loans.name: Los Emprendedores De Las Lomas Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “LOS EMPRENDEDORES D. LAS LOMAS”, está conformada por 9 socios entusiastas y luchadores quienes tienen por afinidad dedicarse al comercio minorista, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desD. hace 9 años.
Martha es una socia del grupo y a su vez asume el cargo D. tesorera desD. hace 4 meses, tiene 57 años, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, D. los cuales tres viven con ella. Martha actualmente tiene un Colegio Educativo llamado Alfonso Sagardia  Marillas desD. hace 8 años en su domicilio, se inicio en este negocio porque quería dar una mejor calidad educativa a los niños, nos cuenta que empezó con solo 12 niños en una cas D. madera. Con el esfuerzo D. su labor ha logrado mejorar la educación y la infraestructura del colegio, y su calidad D. vida. 
El reciente préstamo será utilizado para mejorar la infraestructura del colegio, nuestros socios se sienten muy agradecidos por el apoyo recibido y se comprometen en la puntualidad D. sus pagos.
texts.en:
The “LOS EMPRENDEDORES D. LAS LOMAS” (The Las Lomas Entrepreneurs) communal bank has 9 enthusiastic, hard working members who are retailers for the most part.  They have collaborated with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for the last 9 years.

Martha is a group member who also has taken on the function of Treasurer for the last four months.  She is 57 years old, married and has four children three of whom still live with her.

Martha has had a school called, Alfonso Sagardia Marillas, in her home for the last 8 years.  She started this business because she wanted to proviD. a better quality education to children.  She tells us that she started out with just 12 students in a wooden house.  With her work’s labor she has managed to improve education, the school’s infrastructure and her quality of life.

The current loan will be used to improve the school’s infrastructure.

Our members are very grateful for the support received and commit to pay their installments on time.

loans.use: To improve the school's infrastructure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Azzaya

texts.en: Azzaya G. is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. He and his family all live together in their ger /Mongolian nomadic housing tent/ and fence. Both his two sons attend secondary school and his wife operates a meat trading business after running a small cafe in the local market. Azzaya owns his own car and is a taxi driver in his town. He began his business in 2007 and has gained a lot of business experience in a short amount of time. He needs to keep his car in good condition so that he can continue to earn a living. Therefore, Azzaya is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to upgrade his car that is used as a taxi.

loans.use: To upgrade a car

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter O. O. is a 26 year-old man, married to Anastansia Kambua, with one child. He is in the motorcycle transportation business and also owns a tailoring business which is run by his wife in Changamwe. He has been in this business for the last two years. 

Walter has currently applied for his second loan with KADET to purchase more material for the tailoring business and also service his motorcycle. He plans to use the anticipated profits to help the needy and educate his child. His hope and dream for the future is to make his businesses successful.

loans.use: purchase taialoring materials and service his motocycle

loans.name: We Dae Pay Group

texts.en:
Mabinty C. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mabinty was born in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. The 27-year-old is married and has two children. Mabinty’s husband is businessman, too, and her children are attending both primary and secondary schools. 

For ten years now, Mabinty has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rubber bowls, kitchen utensils, etc. With her share of this loan, Mabinty will buy gallons of palm oil, dozens of rubber bowls and a wide variety of kitchen utensils to add to her business. 

(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Zainab Bangura handing over the loan to the clients.)

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm oil, dozens of rubber bowls and a wide variety of kitchen utensils to add to her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying sugar, soap and soft drinks for sale

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “ÑAUPASUNCHIS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Pablo; el tiene 50 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de taller de zapatería, el vende diferentes tipos de zapatos y los lleva a las diferentes tiendas, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el taller de zapatería. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer los zapatos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the  “ÑAUPASUNCHIS” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco. The member is Mr. Pablo. he is 50, lives with his partner, and has two children. He alternates his daily activities with his shoe workshop. He sells different types of shoes and brings them to the different stores. He wants to expand and improve his shoe workshop. He is requesting this loan to purchase materials to make shoes. He is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of his quotas.

loans.use: the member is requesting this loan for the purchase of materials for making shoes.

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.en:
H. Rahimjon is an ordinary man in the town of Spitamen in Tajikistan. He is a very responsible person and since his youth has been running a livestock farm with the goal of supporting his family  – his wife and two children. 

Rahimjon needs to purchase calves and goats to raise and breed in order to realize profits by selling their milk and meat. Once he has these products from his flock, he sells them in his neighborhood.  In this manner he is able to support his family.  Rahimjon is turning to you for the support that will permit him to continue developing his business.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Zoumana

texts.fr:
Monsieur Zoumana Koné est âgé de 40 ans, marié à deux  épouses et père de 2 enfants.  Ce polygame vit  au quartier  Sogomougou de la préfecture de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso).  
Pour des raisons sociales, Zoumana n’a pas eu la chance d’être instruit  raisons pour laquelle il s’est intéressé aux activités  génératrices de revenus  depuis son jeune âge, qu’il apprit  auprès de son feu père  jadis commerçant. Zoumana décida d’évoluer le commerce d’articles divers.  Cette activité lui procure assez de revenus, sa notoriété est bonne car il reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité,  Monsieur Zoumana Koné a fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  depuis maintenant 3 ans.  Il est à son  quatrième  prêt  individuel après avoir correctement remboursés sans difficulté les précédents. 
Ce nouveau prêt sera  utilisé pour l’achat de stocks de marchandises. Il s’approvisionne auprès  des grossistes  de Koutiala et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique au quartier Sogomougou de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’ hommes au comptant. 
Monsieur Zoumana compte réaliser un  bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA  qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro, satisfaire le besoin de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité. 
Il compte sur les financements de Soro pour élargir son activité dans le futur.
texts.en:
Mr. Zooming Koné is 40 years old, married to two women, and the father of two children.  He is polygamous and lives in the Sogomougou district of Koutiala (region of Sikasso).  
Because of social circumstances, Zoumana was not able to go to school.  It is for this reason that he became interested in earning money from a young age, which he learned from his late father who was a merchant.  Zoumana decided to develop a business selling various items. This work assures him sufficient income, and he is well known because he receives a good number of customers every day.  In order to meet his customers' demands and to grow his business, Mr. Zoumana Koné has been involved with the microfinance institution Soro Yirowaso for three years.   He is on his fourth individual loan after having properly repaid the preceding ones without any difficulty.  
This new loan will be used to buy merchandise.   He gets his supplies from wholesalers in Koutiala and makes his sales, in cash, from his shop in the Sogomougou region of Koutiala to a clientele of women and men.  Mr. Zoumana plans to earn a monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA which he will use to pay interest to Soro and to meet the needs of his family.  He will invest the rest in his business.   
He is counting on financing from Soro to grow his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta S. is from the village of San Miguel, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 53 years old. Violeta is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Violeta owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing food services to local community members. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Violeta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Violeta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Liloy-San Miguel, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Mrs. Yan is married to Mr. Kna, and both of them are farmers who own a more than one hectare plot of land where they grow rice. He is a water seller in his local villager to earn some profit to support his family. 

In the rice field, it is time for planting, so she needs some money to support her crop. To improve production, Mrs. Yan would like to ask for a loan to do farming this dry season. She is a mother of three children who are employed in garment factories.

loans.use: To do dry season rice farming

loans.name: Las Consentidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS CONSENTIDAS” iniciará un nuevo proceso más en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por once integrantes, las que están dirigidas por una mesa directiva que tiene como presidenta la señora Elizabeth.

La señora Elizabeth, indica que es el primer ciclo de trabajo con la A.C. “Las Consentidas” y menciona que con el préstamo piensa ampliar su producción de costura, mediante la compra de telas. Nos comenta que los clientes van a su domicilio y que allí realiza la venta de sus confecciones. Esta forma de trabajo le ayudará a apoyar un poco más a su familia.

Con respecto a las integrantes de la asociación, podemos decir que ellas llevan adelante  variados tipos de negocios, los que son: Venta de mantas, , venta de abarrotes, venta de verduras, comerciante de chompas, venta de material escolar, costura, venta de coca, venta de calzados.
texts.en:
The A.C. “Las Consentidas” (“The Pampered Ones” Communal Association) will start yet another cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. It is composed of eleven members, guided by a directive board presided over by Elizabeth.

Elizabeth says this is her first working cycle with the “Las Consentidas” Communal Association, and she says that with the loan she is requesting she will increase her sewing production by buying cloths. She told us that her customers go to her house where she sells the clothes she creates. This job will help her sustaining her family a little more.

As for the members of the group, it can be said that they engage in various kinds of activities, such as: blankets sale, grocery store, vegetables sale, jumpers sale, school supplies sale, sewing, cocoa sale, shoes sale.

loans.use: To buy cloth to produce clothes.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en:
Sahib A. is 42 years old. He is married and has three children. He sells cattle. As a rule, Sahib purchases small cattle in the central market, feeds them and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. 

Being in this business since a young age, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and to generate a stable, considerable income for his large family. 

Owing to AqroInvest and KIVA, Sahib was able to purchase more cattle and improve his living conditions. He successfully finished paying off his loan and is now planning to purchase more cattle. For this purpose, he requests 2,000 AZN that he will spend for the purchase of young cattle and feed for them.

loans.use: to purchase five calves and feed for them

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina A. is from the village of San Rafael. She is 39 years old. Christina is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $163 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Christina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. 

Christina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her child. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando P. is 41 years old, married and living in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. Rolando has run a rice farming business for 30 years. 

His loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future Rolando hopes to improve his business, buy a bigger farm and earn a bigger income to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed and renovate the stable.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 34 years old and a member of the Uplift Self-Help group under Faulu Kenya.  She runs a business with the name of Comfort Car Hire, where she hires out cars. She has employed one person.  She is also a marketer by profession.  She was previously supplying construction materials to earn a living.  

She has realized that she has improved her business with the skills she gained through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to own more cars in the future.  

With 20,000 KES, she will service her cars.

loans.use: to service her cars.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys  es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en  el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace varios años Gladys se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, etc), su negocio lo ha colocado en el mercado de la zona donde vive, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su nivel de vida.  También cría y vende ganado caprino (cabras),las cuales vende una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo en los mercados de la zona.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes y para cubrir su préstamo.  Gladys es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys, 37, lives with her husband and three children in her own house, which only has electricity.  It is located in the district of Tambogrande which belongs to the department of Lambayeque.  This area is mainly involved in agriculture, livestock farming and crafts.

For several years Gladys has been selling groceries (daily consumption products such as: milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet tissue, tuna, eggs, etc.).  Her store is set up in the market area where she lives.  With the income she earns from product sales she tries to cover household expenses and improve her lifestyle.  She also raises and sells goats at the market in the area.

To expand business she is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy more merchandise.  She wants to expand and offer more products to customers and pay back the loan.  Gladys is a responsible, dedicated and hard-working person who worries about helping her family get ahead.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Cleber Eduardo

texts.es:
Cleber Eduardo tiene 30 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los  hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz..

Cleber se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la produccion.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas que atacan a los cultivos. Su sueño es seguir mejorando en el trabajo. 

Le gusta caminar por el campo.
texts.en:
Cleber Eduardo is 30 years old and married; he lives with his wife and children.  He lives in the Ventanas Canton  in the Province of Los Rios.

This group is called SAN FRANCISCO SIBIMBE, and is located in the Sibimbe district which is part of the Ventanas Canton.  This group has 20 members who work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Cleber works in agriculture, growing corn and rice.  Purchases are made in Ventanas every month and products are sold at the market in the same locality.

He is requesting the loan to purchase supplies for production.  The support of the loan would help him financially to meet his needs.  He faces challenges such as pests that attack the crops.  His dream is to continue improving in his work.

He likes to go for walks through the countryside.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for production.

loans.name: Ng'anzuki

texts.en:
Ng'anzuki is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a family house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a maize selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding and opening another business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of maize for sale and establish a maize selling stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize for sale and establish a maize selling stall.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, a married mother of three children, all of whom are in school, lives in Uganda where she has an enterprise selling half-bricks. In business for 10 years and working 6 days each week, Rebecca sells her products wholesale from home. Her main business challenges are transportation and seasonality. She has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more half-bricks. Her main business goal is to acquire a delivery van to facilitate transportation.

Rebecca lives in a home that she owns; she has access to neither electricity nor piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more half-bricks.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Lucio; el tiene 43 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el es propietario de un carro que realiza servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco, el socio trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio quiere que termine de estudiar su hijo. 
                                              
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Santo Domingo" communal bank, located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Mr. Lucio. He is 43 years old, in a common-law marriage and has three children. He divides his time between his daily activities and his transportation business. He is the owner of a car that he uses to provide taxi service throughout the streets of Cusco. Lucio works from 5:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. He hopes this business will allow his son to finish his studies.

Lucio his happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with his repayment schedule.

loans.use: to pay his son's monthly school tuition and to buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en: Ferdinand is a 38-year-old married man with two children who are one and eight years old. He lives in his own permanent house in Ilagan, Isabela. For five years, Ferdinand has been in the motorcycle transport business. In addition, his wife operates a store. From these businesses, he has been able to buy a motorcycle. He faces the challenge on the fluctuation of fuel prices but hopes to buy another motorcycle to increase income. Ferdinand wanted to avail a loan to a avail an installment second hand motorcycle and to buy new tires for his motorcycle so he could provide smooth transportation service.

loans.use: to a avail an installment second hand motorcycle and to buy new tires for his motorcycle so he could provide smooth transportation service.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 32 years old and is engaged in buying and selling of fruits and vegetables.  She has been doing this over 16 years and earns a net income of P2,000 every month.  She is anxious because her income every month is not enough to send her eldest to college, so she doubles her perseverance just to provide the educational needs of her children.

She is requesting a loan amount of P10,000 to buy bananas, avocados, and beans to sell in the market.  She hopes to exceed her current profit to pay for her obligation to Alalay sa Kaunlaran Inc. She hopes to be able to save for the family's everyday needs, especially for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy bananas, avocados, and beans to sell in the market.

loans.name: Revelina

texts.en:
Reveline is 53 years old and the mother of three children.  Her two children are already married. That’s why she and her husband are working for the education of their youngest child. She wants to finish her youngest child's education to have an accomplishment for her children. She said that she is very happy when she sends her child through her education. She could consider herself a winner though two of her children married early.

To provide the needs of her school-aged child, she engaged herself in operating a hog fattening business. She already has five years of experience in this occupation and is earning a net income of PHP 2,000 every time she sells her hogs. She wants to increase her usual income, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy two more hogs as an additional source of net income and feed for her hogs. She wants to save for their future, especially for school for her child.

loans.use: to buy two more hogs and feed

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda tiene 33 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora. Ella vive en la zona de Esquilan Chico de la provincia de Quillacollo, se gana el pan de cada dia vendiendo la leche que obtiene de sus vacas.
Leonarda vive  con su familia, necesita el préstamo para acceder junto a compañeros de su zona a la compra de un tanque de enfriamiento para la leche y de esta manera puedan conservar mayor tiempo el producto y no entren en perdida lo que afectaría gravemente a la economía de sus familias debido a que dependen casi exclusivamente de la venta de leche cruda de buena calidad. Ella está muy agradecida con la gente que por medio de Kiva le pudo dar la oportunidad de hacer realidad su sueño.
Leonarda entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para mejorar su granja
texts.en:
Leonarda, a hard worker, is 33 years old. She lives in the Esquilan Chico area in the province of Quillacollo. She earns her daily bread by selling milk from dairy cows. Leonarda lives with her family.

She is asking for a loan, along with her nearby partners, in order to buy a cooling tank for the milk in order to keep the milk from spoiling. It is a serious loss of income to their families when they lose milk to spoilage because they rely almost entirely on the sale of fresh raw milk. 

She is very grateful to the people who help her through Kiva for the opportunity of making her dream come true. Her future plans include asking for a new loan in order to improve their farm.

loans.use: to purchase with partners a cooling tank for milk

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia, 43, is a married woman with 10 children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Nemesia has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Abaca is a palm leaf fiber used in handicrafts. Nemesia has been in this business for three years.
