She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

Nemesia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Edgar Alfredo

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 30 años de edad, está casado, tiene un hijo, vive en la casa de sus padres ya que es hijo único. Tiene un  taller en el que se dedica a la chapería y pintura hace mas de seis años en el barrio San Jose, cuenta con las herramientas necesarias para realizar la reparación de los autos.
Cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes ya que se le califica como un buen chapista de la zona, porque es responsable a la hora de recibir el trabajo y así como a la hora de entregar los vehículos terminados.
Él empezó como ayudante con su padre el taller del mismo, luego de varios años habilitó su propio taller para independizarse y poder crecer como profesional como lo es ahora. El solicita el préstamo para la compra de pinturas debido a que tiene mucho trabajo y necesita de insumos para llevarlos a cabo. Agradece a la Fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que le dan.
texts.en:
Edgar, 30, is married and has a son.  He lives in his parents’ house since he’s an only son.  He has had an auto body and paint shop for over six years in the San José neighborhood.  He has the necessary tools to repair cars.

He has a good number of customers because he’s known for being a good car body repairman in the zone; he’s responsible when he takes on a job as well as when he delivers finished repaired vehicles.

He started out as a helper in his father’s shop.  After several years he set up his own shop to become independent and be able to grow as a professional as he’s now done.  

He’s asking for the loan to buy paint because he has a lot of work and needs supplies to get it done.  He thanks the Fundación and Kiva for the opportunity they give him.

loans.use: to buy paint to use in his auto shop.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is a 46-year-old widow. She has three children between the ages of 18 and 22 years.

Immaculee sells clothes and has been in this business for five years. She needs the loan to add more clothes to her store. She plans to use the profits to pay school fees and provide food for her family. In the future, Immaculee hopes to see her business generating more profits.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Uyanga

texts.en:
Uyanga, 22, sells casual clothes in the market of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her parents in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent which is located in the ger district.

Recently, she has taken over this business from her mother, who ran the business since 1999. New businesswoman Uyanga wants to run her business successfully and to improve it day by day. She now needs monetary support amounting to 3,250,000 MNT as working capital for selling during the winter. It will influence her business profit notably, according to her business plan. The loan will be used to purchase a large amount of winter clothes from her suppliers.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of winter clothes from her suppliers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 43 years old and lives in Kinangay Sur, Clarin,Misamis Occidental . She is married with 9 children. Josephine has a shop that sells canned goods, noodles, biscuits etc.. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of 5000 to purchase additional canned goods, noodles, biscuits, etc.. Josephine has been a member of PMPC for a month.  In the future, Josephine hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is kind and patient man who lives in Estefania with his family. He enjoys his work in his farming business though he encounters some hardships in maintaining his cornfield, especially when drought or flood occurs. He plants and harvests corn and sells it to traders in the village. 

In order to keep producing good harvests, Danilo is now asking for a loan of 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to use to maintain good crop standing. He would like to use this to earn more income.

He has four children that attend school, and he aims to keep producing good output for their college education.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to use to maintain good crop standing

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Delia has a pigpen, and sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs.
Delia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Delia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 38-year-old, married man. He and his wife, Esther, have three children.

For the past 11 years, he has been in the dairy business, from which he earns a monthly income of approximately 10,000 KES. He also has a shoe-selling business.

He is applying for his fifth loan through Kiva, this time in the amount of 40,000 KES. He hopes to use the loan proceeds to buy a dairy cow for farming and to boost his shoe-selling business. He explains that he promptly and successfully repaid the previous loan. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and to increase shoe sales.

loans.name: Ricardo Javier

texts.es: Ricardo de 19 años de edad, tiene un expendio de carne ubicado en un local arrendado, de la Ciudadela 20 de julio. Allí vende carne vacuna, porcina y vísceras al por mayor y al detal. Su  clientela la conforman las tiendas, los restaurantes, otros expendios, las amas de casa y público en general. Maneja un sistema de ventas de contado y a también  credicontado. El negocio es atendido por el Ricardo, su padre y dos empleados particulares. Las compras las realiza de contado, maneja una competencia que le potencializa su clientela, y él  se sostiene por ofrecer precios justos, peso exacto, calidad y trato amable con sus clientes. Con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  comprará al por mayor y de contado, carne vacuna y porcina y obtendrá muy buenos descuentos, porque su credikiva es un nuevo capital con el que contará, para invertir un poco mas de lo acostumbrado en sus productos y responderle oportunamente a su clientela que lo amerita, a propósito de las fiestas familiares que se avecinan para recibir el año 2012.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 19 years old.  He sells meat in a rented locale in the 20 de Julio neighborhood.  He sells beef, pork and offal at wholesale and retail.  His clientele is comprised of stores, restaurants, other meat sellers, housewives and the general public.  He manages both credit and cash sales.  Ricardo, his father and two employees run the business.  

He pays cash for his purchases and has competition that vies for his clientele but he stays in business by offering fair prices, exact weights, quality and kind customer service.

He plans to use his Kiva loan, his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to pay cash to buy beef and pork at wholesale thus obtaining good discounts because with the Kiva loan he’ll have new capital to invest a bit more than usual into his products and be able to respond in an opportune way to his deserving clientele especially now that the family get-togethers to welcome 2012 are nearing.

loans.use: to buy beef and pork at wholesale and for cash.

loans.name: Radilla

texts.en:
Radilla is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Radilla is married and has three children. 

To make a living, Radilla is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps and many others. Radilla has been in her business for over three years and earns 3,600 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

Radilla is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2009, Radilla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Marie Michelle

texts.fr: Marie Michelle, 35 ans, commerçante, vit avec son mari et sa fille. Elle a démarré ses activités en vendant des vêtements d’occasion importés. Après quelques démarches auprès d’un bureau de Palmis de son quartier, elle obtient un microcrédit qui lui a permis d’augmenter son stock.

loans.use: augmenter son stock

loans.name: Nadjaf

texts.en:
Nadjaf has his own alehouse. He is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Lachin region Kosalar village. He and his 6 children settled in Khirdalan settlement. 
Having borrowed the loan $400 he bought the beer equipment. You can see this equipment in the picture. He has been engaged in pub business since 2004. 
Now he plans to buy the utensils, in order to cook our traditional dishes and to sell this dishes.
He applies for a loan of $1000 to bring about his wishes.

loans.use: To buy the utensils

loans.name: Gloria Dalia

texts.en:
Gloria is married and has two sons and one daughter. Her daughter is 2 years old and her sons are 7 and 10 years old. Her husband is a salesman. She began her business to help her husband with the household expenses, since his income wasn’t enough to support the family. Through a friend, she started in the business of selling cosmetics from the catalog of a brand that is very well-known in Mexico. Little by little, she built up a clientele base, and now she has a consistent group of regular customers who always go to her to buy her products. These products offer very good commissions, which is what attracted her to begin selling them.

Gloria is requesting a loan in the amount of $200.00, in order to buy more products. She wants to buy them in a large quantity so that she can receive a better price, sell more, and earn larger commissions for her sales, and in this way help her family to get ahead. She offers to pay back the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months. She and her family thank you for the support you give them, so she can continue with her business and make it grow, so that they can have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria esta casada y tiene tres hijos dos hombres y una mujer, la menor tiene 2 años de edad y los hombrecitos tienen 10 y 7 años respectivamente, su esposo es comerciante. Ella empezó con su negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ya que los ingresos de su esposo eran insuficientes para mantenerlos a todos y por medio de una amiga ella entro en el negocio de la venta de cosméticos por catálogo de una marca muy conocida en México, así poco a poco fue haciéndose de clientes y ahora ya tiene una cartera fija que siempre acuden a ella para comprar sus productos. Estos productos ofrecen muy buenas comisiones que fue el atractivo de ella para empezar su venta.

Gloria esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US$ 200 para poder comprar más productos y en cantidad para así poder obtener un mejor precio, vender más y obtener mejores comisiones por sus ventas y así sacar adelante a su familia, ofreciendo pagar este crédito en un período de 3 a 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen por el apoyo que le des para continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer para obtener una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
CRISTINA is 36 years old, married, and has 5 children. She works making handcrafted bracelets and belts out of silk thread, and she sells them to people who have handicrafts booths at the market in Santo Domingo. She also has in her home a small grocery store. She is part of the group Flores de Magnon 1, along with JOSEFA JIMENEZ V. (handicrafts), FRANCISCA JIMENEZ JIMENEZ (grocery store), REGINA GOMEZ JIMENEZ (grocery store), and DIEGA JIMENEZ V. (grocery store). With this loan, the group hopes to buy merchandise (such as sugar, salt, oil, crackers, pasta, and other non-perishable food) wholesale, and in this way supply their respective businesses by distributing the merchandise.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

CRISTINA , tiene 36 años , casada , tiene 5 hijos , ella se dedica a hacer pulseras y cinturones artesanales con hilos de seda y los vende a las personas que tienen locales comerciales de artesanías en el mercado de Santo Domingo , también tiene en su casa instalada una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes . Forma parte del grupo Flores de Magnon 1, junto con JOSEFA JIMENEZ V. ( artesana ) , FRANCISCA JIMENEZ JIMENEZ ( tienda de abarrotes ) , REGINA GOMEZ JIMENEZ ( tienda de abarrotes), DIEGA JIMENEZ V. (tienda de abarrotes) . Con el préstamo esperan comprar mercaderías tales como : azúcar , sal , aceite, galletas , pastas y alimentos no perecibles al por mayor y así surtir sus respectivos negocios al repartirse las mercaderías.

loans.use: grocery store

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco V. is 53 year old and married. He lives in a house located on the same land as his business. His wife Antonia is 46 yeras old, and stays busy caring for the house and the children. They have 7 children who work in the small family business, the four youngest still live with their parents.

For more than 7 years Francisco has had his own business. He has a shop where he does repair and maintenance of motorcycles and bicycles. It's the only one in the zone with the infrastructure and trained people. All of Francisco's children are his assistants, and each one has a specialty in the new models and technologies. This professional and personalized service is a highlight of his shop, and guarantees quality work.

Francisco decided to work for himself 7 years ago, abandoning his bohemian life of music. His band was very successful during the 80's. His only objective was to educate his children and offer them stability and a way to get the most out of life. He will use the loan to buy merchandise such as spark plugs, filters, headlights, fuses, etc, for a value of $1000.

El Sr. Francisco V. tiene 53 años de edad, es casado, vive en una casa ubicada en el mismo terreno que su negocio, su cónyuge, Antonia de 46 años, se ocupa del cuidado de la casa, tienen 7 hijos, quienes trabajan en la microempresa familiar, de éstos los 4 más jóvenes aun viven con sus padres. Hace más de 7 años que don Francisco trabaja por cuenta propia, posee un taller de mantenimiento y reparación de motocicletas y bicicletas, es el único en la zona aledaña con la infraestructura y personal capacitado, todos los asistentes de don Francisco son sus hijos, cada uno está especializado en los nuevos modelos y tecnologías de los biciclos actuales. Esto destaca el servicio profesional y personalizado de este taller, garantizando así un trabajo de calidad. Don Francisco decidió trabajar por cuenta propia hace 7 años- abandonó su vida bohemia de músico, cuya banda fue muy exitosa en la década de los años 80, con el único fin de educar a sus hijos, ofrecerles estabilidad y un medio de ganarse la vida. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la compra de mercaderías: bujías, filtros, rayos, focos, fusibles etc. por un valor de 1.000 U$.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: To buy merchandise - filters, spark plugs, headlights, etc.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience O. is from Edo State.  She is 42 years old, married with 6 children, and sells tailoring materials.  She has been a LAPO member for four years, and has been in business since 2003.  She is requesting a loan of $800 to enable her to buy more tailoring materials to sell.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Sokoim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokoim K., 47, is a widow with five children: two sons and three daughters. Her family lives on an island of the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Two of her children are married and live in separate houses, and the other three live under her custody. One helps her sell sweets in the morning in front of her house, and the other two study in the local school. Sokoim has been a silk weaver since she was 20 years old. It's a skill she learned from her neighbor.

Sokoim is requesting her third loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $200. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and to pay for the preparation of her loom.

loans.use: To buy silk materials and prepare loom

loans.name: Kabowa 2(C) Group

texts.en: This group has been together for nine months. Rose is 35 years old and married with 3 children.She runs a retail shop. She intends to start a poultry business with the extra profits. Juliet and Sarah both sell clothes. Jolic offers laundry sevices and wants to buy a generator with the extra profits.

loans.use: To add in stock in the shop.

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.en:
Nicasia A. was born and raised in the town of Luque. She is now married with three children, her oldest daughter helps with their mother’s business of selling various books and household items. Her husband, Agustin is a plumber and does other various types of construction work.

Since 2001, Nicasia has worked with the Fundación Paraguaya to better her business. She is now selling products in the city of Ciudad del Este, as well. With this loan, Nicasia will buy more products for her business including books, home products and more.

loans.use: To buy various items like books, small home items, and more.

loans.name: Zainabu's Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Zainabu, age 45, is married and has 5 sons. She runs a wholesale fruit business, which she started in 1990. She works daily from 6am to 6pm selling fruit. She makes a monthly profit of about $55.

In the past, Zainabu took out two loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her stock of fruit for resale. She paid these back successfully and now hopes for a new loan to open a shop. She has yet to decide what items to sell there, but she has many dreams.

She will share this loan with her group, who have businesses dealing in clothing, fish, charcoal, and food sales. The group members are guarantors of each other's loans.

In the picture, Zainabu is in the back row, second from the left.

loans.use: To open a shop

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara is a member of the communal bank Las Azucenas 2, located in the Asentamiento Humano, Union de damnificados Mz. C Lt. 8, of the Yarina Cocha district, Departamento de Uyacali. She is 42 years old and mother to three children. Her husband is an electrician. She decided to use the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, in the amount of S/. 300, to set up a small hardware store.

Currently she still has the hardware store but also sells clothing and shoes. She wakes up very early to take care of her children and take them to school. She then tends to her store.

She plans to use this loan, in the amount of S/.1,400 and that will be paid in 4 months, to purchase: nails, iron reinforcing rods, tubes/pipes, corrugated iron, clothing and shoes. Sara is very happy about the loans and the support she has received, thanks to them she is getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Sara pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas 2, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano.Unión de Damnificados Mz. C Lt. 8, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es técnico electricista. Sara con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña ferretería.

En la actualidad ella continúa con una ferretería y también se dedica a la venta de ropas y zapatos, se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus hijos llevarlos a la escuela, y luego se dedica a atender su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,400 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: clavos, fierros, tubos, calaminas, y ropa y zapatos. Sara se siente muy feliz los prestamos les han brindado mucha apoyo y gracias a ellos esta saliendo adelante.

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ayeshetu

texts.en: Ayeshetu B. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has three children who are currently in school. She is a member of the community lending group called Quality Trust Group. Members guarantee one another as social collateral for access to loans.  Ayeshetu is a retailer of charcoal at her local community.  Because charcoal is a very popular energy source for cooking in many Ghanaian homes, Ayeshetu has many customers. However, her business is constrained by limited access to the capital needed to buy larger amounts of charcoal. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $325 to buy more bags of charcoal, which she will sell to her customers in order to make a profit and support her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Izatbibi

texts.en: Izatbibi K. was born in 1961 in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is the single mother of 3 children, and she is enthusiastic about working hard to guarantee her children a successful future. Mrs. K. has been a successful client of MicroInvest since 2004 and she has not any problems repaying her previous loans. Mrs. K. has been working since she was 16, when she worked in her uncle’s shop. Thanks to a previous loan she was able to start her own business, and now she sells sweets at the local bazaar where she has a good assortment and repeat customers. Now Mrs. K. is asking KIVA for a business development loan of $350 US for 4 months so she can import new goods and widen her assortment.

loans.use: Widen assortment of goods through new imports

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Mrs. Um T. is a farmer and she lives with her husband in Toul Khsach Village, Kampong Cham Province. Mrs. T. grows rice on her large plot of farmland and earns about $1.50 per day from this activity. Her husband is a blacksmith and earns about $2.50 per day. T. cares for her family of five children and is responsible for paying for their study expenses.

She is now asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase fertilizer and seed for her farm. The loan will allow her to have enough capital to expand her crop and increase the yield from her farming efforts.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seed for her farm

loans.name: Hoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoem K. is a 42-year-old widow with five children. She is a farmer in Chambork Thom Village in the Kampong Speu Province. She raises pigs, chickens and ducks in order to help meet the financial needs of the family. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory and the other three are attending school.

Even with the income produced from the farm and the salaries of her two children, there is not enough money to build a new house. Mrs. Hoem K. is requesting a loan to add to her current savings to be able to begin construction of a new home.

loans.use: To add money to a current savings account in order to build a new home

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Jose V., mi unico trabajo desde niño es y ha sido la zapateria, tengo 3 años de tener mi propio taller, esto me ayuda a salir adelante con mis hijos, actualmente necesito tener una mayor produccion de zapatos ya que las exigencias de mis clientes son grandes, pero no tengo el capital para poder comprar mas materia prima, por tal razon necesito una ayuda para poder salir adelante con mi negocio y con mis hijos. gracias
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Jose V.; my only job since I was a child has been that of a cobbler. For the past 3 years, I have worked in my own workshop which helps me to move forward with my children. Currently, I need to increase my shoe production since I have many orders from my customers, but I don’t have the necessary capital to purchase more raw materials. This is why I need financial assistance in order to grow my business and take care of my children. Thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for the repair and manufacture of shoes

loans.name: Aniko

texts.en:
Aniko is an entrepreneur who sells clothing and footwear. She lives and runs her business in Beregovo, a town in Western Ukraine. Aniko has been in this business for about seven years. Her vending kiosk has a reputation for having a wide assortment of quality merchandise and a favorable location in the local marketplace called "Progress.” Currently, she has over $3000 in inventory. Her net profit amounts to $600 a month.

Aniko is requesting a loan for 1500 Grivnas ($300 USD) to increase her turnover capital and sale rates. She is hoping to keep her business self-sustainable and running smoothly in the future. Moreover, she is aiming at further expansion of her small venture, too. We believe current financial assistance will add to success of Aniko's business and will help her fulfill her endeavors.   

Note: This is a short-term express loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: increase turnover capital

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 51 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 11 hijos,  vive en el Jr. Los Incas, Sector Totorjahuira del Distrito de Tinicachi, Provincia de Yunguyo- Puno.nnEs una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Lujan”-Yunguyo hace 07 años con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital y compro productos veterinarios. Antes de iniciar con este negocio vendía frazadas  y telas posteriormente  junto a su esposo, cambio de negocio y se dedico a vender productos veterinarios en Juliaca, Arequipa y Cuzco.nnCon el préstamo que solicitara de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles y que pagara en 04 cuotas comprara mas productos veterinarios como 1 docena de Jarabes contra parásitos a  S/. 356.00, Vitaminas   a  S/. 213.00, inyecciones a S/. 343.50 nuevos soles.nn “Gracias a los prestamos pude construir mi casita” - nos dice la Sra. ElenannSu mayor deseo es abrir una tienda de productos veterinarios en Puno o en Juliacan
texts.en:
Elena tiene 51 au00f1os de edad, es conviviente y madre de 11 hijos, vive en el Jr. Los Incas, Sector Totorjahuira del Distrito de Tinicachi, Provincia de Yunguyo- Puno.nnEs una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal u201cVirgen de Lujanu201d-Yunguyo hace 07 au00f1os con el primer pru00e9stamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles aumento su capital y compro productos veterinarios. Antes de iniciar con este negocio vendu00eda frazadas y telas posteriormente junto a su esposo, cambio de negocio y se dedico a vender productos veterinarios en Juliaca, Arequipa y Cuzco.nnCon el pru00e9stamo que solicitara de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles y que pagara en 04 cuotas comprara mas productos veterinarios como 1 docena de Jarabes contra paru00e1sitos a S/. 356.00, Vitaminas a S/. 213.00, inyecciones a S/. 343.50 nuevos soles.nn u201cGracias a los prestamos pude construir mi casitau201d - nos dice la Sra. ElenannSu mayor deseo es abrir una tienda de productos veterinarios en Puno o en Juliacan

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de productos veterinarios.

loans.name: Irayda

texts.es:
La señora Irayda es socia del Banco Comunal “LA MUJER RIOJANA” y vive en el departamento D. San Martín, provincia D. Rioja, distrito D. Rioja. Se dedica a la confección D. prendas D. vestir para damas caballeros y niños, también venD. cosméticos. Su taller D. costura está ubicado en su propia casa, en el Jr: Angaisa 240.   

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,000, el cual será pagado en 06 cuotas, comprará hilos D. colores variados, telas D. diferente tipo como algodón, licra, polipima, en variados diseños y D. buena calidad en metros, también blondas, botones,  cierres y otros accesorios que necesita para realizar sus trabajos y satisfacer la  exigencia D. la clientela, además desea invertir en zapatos y aprovechar las fiestas D. fin D. año como las promociones, bautizos, navidad y año nuevo.
  
La Señora IRAYDA tiene 38 años D. edad, vive con una D. sus hijas que aún está estudiando y con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura. Su meta es llegar a tener su tienda D. zapatos porque le parece más rentable.
texts.en:
Irayda is a member of the "La Mujer Riojana" Community Bank; she lives in the Department of San Martín, province of Rioja, district of Rioja. She makes clothes for women, men and children, and she sells cosmetics. Her sewing workshop is located in her house at Jr. Angaisa 240.

With this loan of $325, which she will repay in 6 instalments, she will buy thread in assorted colours, assorted fabrics such as cotton, lycra, polypima, in a range of designs and in good quality, bulk, as well as lace, buttons, fasteners and other accessories she needs for her work and to satisfy customer demand. She also wants to invest in shoes and take advantage of the year-end holidays as well as promotions, christenings, Christmas and New Year.

Irayda is 38 years old; she lives with her daughters, who are still studying, and with her husband, who is a farmer. Her ambition is to have a shoe shop, since she thinks that will be more profitable.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy thread, fabric, lace, buttons, fasteners, and shoes.

loans.name: Akbarali

texts.en:
Akbarali is 51 years old and lives with his wife and 4 chidlren.  He is a humble farmer dedicated to producing such fruits as apricots, peaches, pears, etc.  He also produces feed for the animals inside his land.  This is why he has to leave early in the morning, and it takes time to go back home too. 

When he sees the harvest of his land, it comforts him and wants to harvest even more.  However, in order to do that he needs to invest large amounts of money.  He knows that with a larger harvest, he will have better results, and the fruit has to be of better quality in order to get more income from the sales.  

Aside from cultivating his land, Akbarali is also engaged in livestock.  Currently, he has 8 sheep.  He wants to increase his production and purchase more sheep to breed.  That’s the reason that he applied to IMON International for a loan of 4000 Somoni ($1200 USD) for the term of 10 months. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others.  

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  

While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition.  Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.  To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of saplings and sheep

loans.name: Doem

texts.en: Mrs. Doem N. is a villager in Chreaek village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Yin Him, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land on which they cultivate rice. However, they are facing a problem because their field is infertile. Thus, Mrs. Doem N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions. She is 39 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the field

loans.name: Sulton

texts.en:
Sulton H. is 64 years old. He is married with two adult children. Sulton works in agriculture and has always been efficient in his labors. The role of father, which he has carried out for 37 years, has helped him to understand the sacrifice and hard labor of the women of the house. He works farming different kinds of fruits all day, trying to take care of them and fertilize them, mainly during harvest, which is what he loves the most. This time, he would like to invest in the purchase of supplies to protect his crops, so as to have a better harvest and sell his crops outside of his hometown. This will allow him to better provide for his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other substances for his garden.

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en: Vidadi is 21 years old and single. He lives in Khachmaz town. Two years ago he started an orchard business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian sells underwear, ready made and baby items. She has been in this business since 1998.

Marian travels to Idumota (Lagos) to buy her underwear, ready made and baby items in wholesale and sells to retailers in her locality.

Marian is hard working, very optimistic about the future of her business and that of her immediate family. She is 40 years old and married with five children. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more underwear, baby items, and ready made to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase underwear, ready made and baby items to sell.

loans.name: Jitahidi Group

texts.en:
Malaki, a potatoes and clothes seller in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for five years, currently earns an average monthly profit of $60 working eight hours a day at her business.  She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania in order to buy more potatoes and clothes for the business.  She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her enterprise and save money for future use.  

Malaki, 27 and married, has a nine-year-old child and also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mwanaharusi and Rukia, each of whom has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Romoke

texts.en: Romoke sells drinks and provisions. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN 140,000 (US$ 975) to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you. She is 48 years old, married, and has 5 children. She says thanks to all.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Hoja

texts.ru: Хакимов Худжа проживает водном из отдаленных кишлаков города Яван. Возраст 46 лет, женат . Имеет пятерых детей. Зарабатывает на жизнь путем выращивания сельхоз культур. Имеет участок земли. В данный момент необходимо посееть лук и другие овощи. Поэтому он обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы закупить семена и удобрения. Это поможет ему получить своевременно урожай. Таким образом он сможет сделать запас для своей семьи , а так же получить прибыль от проданной продукции.
texts.en:
Hoja H. lives in a remote village of Yavan. He is 46 years old and is married with five children. He owns a plot of land and makes a living by cultivating vegetables. At the moment he needs to plant onions and other vegetables, and he is applying for a loan that he would use for the purchase of seeds and fertilizers. This would help him harvest the vegetables on time, stock food for the family and sells the rest at a profit.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vista Alegre” que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Queñuani, distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 57 años D. edad y es madre D. 08 hijos (D. los cuales solo uno esta a su lado), es D. estado civil casada, y no tiene estudios.  Vive en el Barrio Río D. la plata.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace casi 2 años.  Su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que utilizó para la comapra D. sacos D. naylon. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, que es la compra D. sacos D. naylon, para luego distribuirlo en las ferias D. la zona.

Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando para poder dar estudios a su hijo.

A ella le gustan los ahorros  y las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Ms. Petrona A. is a member of the “Vista Alegre” Microfinance Institute, which is located in the Queñuani community, district of Yunguyo, province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. She is a 57-year-old married mother of 8 children, only one of whom still lives with her. She has had no formal schooling, and she lives in the Rio D. la Plata neighborhood.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost 2 years. Her first loan was for 300.00 PEN, which she used for purchasing sacks of nylon.

At this time, she needs a 1,500.00 PEN loan so that she can invest it in her current business—buying sacks of nylon—so that she can then distribute it at the local markets.

Her greatest dream is to continue working so that she can proviD. her son with an education.

She likes her microfinance institute's meetings and savings.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of polythylene

loans.name: Elizabeth De La Concepcion

texts.es: Elizabeth de la Concepción M. tiene 34 años de edad. Esta casada con Mario. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y no estudian. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de cosméticos. Con este negocio Elizabeth aporta lo necesario para brindarle a su familia el alimento diario, además su esposo labora como cargador de maletas en el mercado, pero lo que el gana no es suficiente para mantener a sus familia, es por eso que juntos con mucho esfuerzo para sacar adelante a sus hijos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para a compra de cosméticos como lápiz labial, pintura de uñas, Perfumes y cremas. Su deseo es vender todos los productos para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Elizabeth de la Concepción M. is 34 years old. She is married to Mario. She has two children in her care who are not yet in school. She has been in this business for more than 6 years. She makes a living in the buying and selling of cosmetics. With this business Elizabeth makes enough to provide food for her family, her husband also works as a bag carrier at the market, but his income is not enough to support the family. Together they work hard to get their children ahead. The loan that she is requesting is for working capital, to purchase cosmetics such as lipsticks, nail polishes, perfumes and creams. Her wish is to sell all the products to obtain more income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es: Mayela tiene 34 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive con el padre de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su infancia ha realizado los trabajos agrícolas; sembrando papas, arvejas y habas, pero de todos sus cultivos el que le resulta más fácil en la recolección son las habas y aunque las papas y arvejas requieren mayor esfuerzo físico, son mucho más rentables. Cada día Mayela se levanta muy temprano para alistar el almuerzo, ya que a las 8 de la mañana ya tiene que estar removiendo la tierra de sus cultivos juntamente con su esposo. Pero cuando le toca regar sus chacras se desvela, pues inicia a las 9 de la noche hasta 1 o 2 de la madrugada, debido al turno que le dan en la junta de regantes del agua de su comunidad. De este modo viene trabajando con sus cultivos y lo realiza con mucho cariño, puesto que sabe que gracias a ello obtiene los ingresos económicos para el sostenimiento de su familia y la educación de sus hijos. De salirle muy bien sus próximas y futuras cosechas, Mayela espera poder adquirir terrenos de regadío. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, durante los 7 ciclos pasados demostró pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y asimismo trata de asistir a todas sus reuniones de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy cómoda junto a sus compañeros. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos, además de una bolsa de arvejas (semilla) de un tipo de mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Mayela, 34, is a very hard working woman. She lives with the father of her three children in her own house. Since she was very young she has been doing agricultural work like planting potatoes, peas, and beans. Of all of her crops, beans are the easiest to gather. Even though the potatoes and peas require much more physical effort, they are much more profitable. Every day Mayela gets up very early to get breakfast ready. By eight in the morning she has to be working the fields with her husband. When it is time to water her crops, she does not sleep. She starts at nine at night and waters until one or two in the morning. This is the turn given to her by the water rights board in her community. This is how she works her crops, and she does so with much affection. She knows that thanks to them, she receives the income to support her family and educate her children. By doing well in the next and future harvests, Mayela hopes to be able to acquire irrigated land. This is her eighth loan with MFP. During the previous seven loan cycles she has shown that she makes her payments on time. She tries to attend all of her community bank’s meetings, where she feels very comfortable being with her colleagues. The money she is asking for is to buy chemical fertilizers and a bag of better quality pea seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey M. is a farmer in Chroy Slaeng village in Takeo province. She now faces a small problem in her rice farming, because her rice field is infertile. She decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and she will use the rest of the loan to buy a pump in order to water her field.

Mrs. Srey M. is 37 years old and the mother of five children: four of whom are attending the local school and the youngest one stays at home because that child is only 5 years old. Her husband, Mr. Eim Rith, is a laborer who makes a small income to support the family. Her husband and youngest son are also present in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and a water pump

loans.name: Lysbeth

texts.es:
Lisbeth es socia del Banco Comunal “Diana de Gales”, en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Tiene estudios de educación superior (profesora de primaria).  Vive en el Barrio Victoria.

Lisbeth es socia nueva, y requiere un primer préstamo de   S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le servirá para aumentar su capital en su negocio de venta de golosinas, ella va a comprar gaseosas, galletas, chocolates, caramelos, etc.

Su deseo es comprarse una casita.

A ella le gustan las facilidades en los préstamos y pagos.

loans.use: Para la compra de gaseosas, galletas, chocolates, caramelos, etc.

loans.name: Koriko

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’Agoè Nyivé à Lomé où elle vend des vêtements de friperie de toute catégorie ; elle est mariée et est mère de 03 enfants. C’est pour aider son mari maçon à supporter les charges financières de leur foyer qu’elle a décidé en 2004 de vendre des vêtements de friperie. Actuellement elle n’a pratiquement plus de stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 bals de friperie de catégorie diverses. Elle est persuadée que ce nouvel achat améliorera encore plus leur vie quotidienne.
texts.en:
This woman livs in the Agoè Nyivé neighborhood in Lomé, where she sells second-hand clothing of all sorts. She's married and the mother of 3 children. In order to help her husand, a bricklayer, with the household expenses, she decided to start selling second-hand clothing in 2004. She's now almost out of stock, this is why she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 15 bales of second-hand clothing of all sorts. She's sure that his new purchase will improve their daily life.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 bales of second-hand cloting

loans.name: Concisa

texts.en:
Concisa N. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 54 years old. Concisa is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Concisa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Concisa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years with an approximated average monthly earnings of 5,000 PHP for these activities.

In 2006, Concisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Concisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Concisa is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Concisa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es: La señora Paola se dedica a la venta de Hamburguesas , ella tiene un año de antiguedad en el negocio. Ha demostradfo ser una cliente responsable, este Crédito es  su tercera secuencia. La Sra. Paola es de extracción humilde, vive en casa de sus abuelos.El negocio que tiene es el segundo ingreso de la familia puesto que el esposo, Don Efrain, trabaja de obrero en una fabrica. El crédito que se le dio a la Sra. Paola fue para mejorar el carrito donde vende hamburguesas, ademas, para la compra de una mesa y sillas.
texts.en:
Paola's business is selling hamburgers and she has been running this business for a long time. She has demonstrated herself to be a responsible client, as this credit will be her third in a row. Paola is of humble origins and lives in her grandparents' house. Her business is the second of her family's investments, as her husband, Don Efrain, is a worker at a factory. The loan made to Paola was to improve the cart where she sells hamburgers as well as to buy a table and chairs.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS AL CARRITO REPARTIDOR DE HAMBURGUESAS

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia S. is from the village of Salimpuno in the town of Sapang Dalaga. She is 45 years old. Lilia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector by raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn and  cassava for sale. In 2005, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 6th cycle loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.
 About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Epifania Margarita

texts.es:
Epifania vive en la Av. Castell zona 16 de Febrero de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive en alquiler junto a su mama, tiene un hijo de cinco años, por razones familiares es que su esposo la abandono ella sola mantienes a su hijo y la vez sale adelante en la vida.

La señora trabaja en un empresa de muebles hace cuatro años, además vende perfumes, y otros productos en la misma empresa.


El crédito lo destinara para la compra de perfumes y otros productos. 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con IMPRO  la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Epifania lives on Castell Avenue in the February 16th district of the city of El Alto. She lives in a rental property with her mother and her 5 year old son. Her husband abandoned the family, so she must raise her son alone and provide for his success in life.

Epifania worked at a furniture company four years ago, but she now sells perfumes and other products. Her loan will be used to purchase more items to add to her inventory.

This is Epifania’s second loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicates she is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfumes & other products

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 44-year-old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their six children. Mahmoud has been in the sanitation business since 1985. Mahmoud requested this loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase some tools and electricA. wires for his work. Mahmoud has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time.

Mahmoud is speciA. in his work because of his experience. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a big network, but after almost 25 years of experience, he has an extremely big network. Mahmoud decided on doing this business because he learned it when he was young. His plan for the future is to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase some tools and electrical wires for his work

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna F. is from the town of Gamu. She is 47 years old. Lorna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a specialized retail store selling vegetables in the local community. Lorna earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Lorna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Lorna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Humar

texts.en:
O. is 53 years old man who lives with his wife and five children in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a nomadic tent. His two oldest sons help with the family business while his daughters study at a university. 

O. operates a transportation service. He began his business in 1993 after working for several years as a driver for a private company. Besides transporting people and their goods, he also transports coal where he can sell it for a profit.  

He says, “I want to buy two more trucks for my sons in order for them to have their own transport services.” 

O. is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~$1050) loan to purchase parts for his truck and to purchase coal to sell in Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for his truck and coal.

loans.name: George Otieno

texts.en:
George Otieno A. is a 31-year-old man who is married and the father of two children.

George is the sole owner of a fish business, buying fish at Homabay in Western Kenya and selling it in the coastal towns of Kenya. He used to run a retail shop but abandoned it since, he says, he saw great profits in the fish business.

George needs a loan of Kshs 50,000 which he plans to use to increase his stock of fish.

loans.use: To increase his stock of fish

loans.name: Gallido

texts.en:
Gallido M. is from the village of Del Carmen, Iligan City. He is 35 years old. Gallido is single. To make a living, Gallido owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily-use products in the local community. Gallido has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gallido joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gallido is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gallido from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Luinab, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
el señor Luis Enrique P. F. es soltero y tiene dos hijos, radica en el barrio Suyapa de la ciudad de Nacaome Valle.
Luis se dedica al comercio tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion la cual administra muy bien, tiene 1 año de tener su negocio.
esta solicitando el prestamo para surtir mas su negocio y desea que este año las ventas se mejoren. 
 
su mayor deseo es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean unos buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Luis is single and has two children. He resides in the Suyapa neighborhood of the city Nacaome Valle.

Luis runs a grocery store from his home, and he manages it very well. He has had his business for one year.

He is requesting a loan to better stock his store and he wants sales to improve this year.

His greatest wish is that his children will finish school and become good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, chicken, corn and wheat flour, tortillas, soft drinks, dairy products, powdered milk, toilet paper, sanitary towels, pills, candles, matches

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en: Darwin V., 30, manages a small sari-sari (variety) store. He says that his business provides his family an average income of Php 2,000 a day. He has four children, the eldest is 11. He wants to grow his business more.  He would like to request a loan of Php 10,000 to buy additional merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise

loans.name: Princesas De Cuautlapan Group

texts.en:
This group is called the Princesses of Cuautlapan because that is the name of the community from which the members come plus there they treat their women like princesses. It is located in the Cuautlapan community, in the municipality of Ixtaczoquitlan in the state of VeraC., Mexico. The group is maD. up of 13 members. Alejandra O. M. is the president of the group - she sells snacks (peanuts, seeds, pork scratchings) and she has asked for 3,000 pesos with which to buy ingredients to prepare her snacks. Also in the group is Mrs. Rosa Maria C. F. who is 34 years old and only went to primary school. She makes and sells tamales, which she sells in the streets from a cart. On Wednesdays she sells them together with her husband who works in the same business. They have been selling tamales for 21 years and she is asking for a loan in order to buy plantain leaves in which to wrap the tamales. She is married and has 4 children of 19, 17, 15 and 12 years of age. She began selling tamales from her house but after the birth of her children she needed to go out with her husband into the street to sell them and increase their sales. This business is the family's only source of income; thanks to the business they have been able to build a house on land they inherited and educate their children, all of whom are currently studying and also helping to sell tamales. As well as buying a small second-hand van to use to transport the tricycle from which they sell their tamales to other communities and increase their sales, she dreams of one day buying some land and having rooms for rent and securing a future for when she can no longer work, and perhaps buying a new car. All of this will help to grow her business thanks to loans.

The other members of this group and their occupations are:

Elizabeth H. F., selling clothes;

Guadalupe Fidelia R. Gómez, grocery store;

María Isabel Báez A., selling ceramics;

María Silvia M. Martínez, selling clothes;

Leticia León Sánchez, selling Tupperware and pewter;

Bibiana Ivonne D. L. C. Ramírez, selling shoes from a catalogue;

Inés Rosa F. Martínez, buying and selling recycled goods,

Janette S. Vásquez, selling bags;

Ana Patricia ElizalD. Báez, selling snacks;

Marisol Ríos C., selling blankets and sandals;

and María Teresa Álvarez Cerón, selling clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for the products they sell

loans.name: Nestor Filomeno

texts.es:
Néstor es natural de la ciudad de Puno, tiene 42 años y tiene un hijo, él es un padre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario apoyar a su hijo.

Néstor es odontólogo, por la mañanas trabaja en ESSALUD y  por las tardes atiende su propio consultorio.
  
Néstor pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son cuatro años que participa en el banco comunal. Su primer crédito del socio fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente, el socio requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para curar dientes como por ejemplo resinas, etc. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Nestor is a native of the city of Puno. He is 42 years old and has a son. He is a responsible father who always looks for opportunities to advance and to help his son through his daily efforts.

Nestor is an odontologist. In the mornings he works at ESSALUD, and in the afternoons he works at his own practice.

Nestor belongs to the community bank "Tercer Milenio" (Third Millenium) of the Arariwa Association. He has already participated in the community bank for four years. His first loan as a member was for 100 dollars, which he invested in his business. Now he needs a loan to buy materials for treating teeth, such as resins, etc.

This community bank member is grateful for the opportunity offered by the loans and thus promises to make his payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to treat teeth, such as resins, etc.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard has been a retailer in Naivasha Town for the past 33 years. He sells domestic products like plastic cups, plates etc. He now wants to stock cereals to sell in his shop because they are in demand. He is 50 years old, married to Beatrice Wanjiku, and they have five school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. With the proceeds from this loan, he plans to buy 10 bags of rice, 5 bags of maize and 5 bags of beans in bulk to sell.  

He plans to expand his shop so that clients can walk in and select different products for themselves in the near future.

loans.use: To stock his shop with cereals

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor Silvia D. es una mujer emprendedora dispuesta a ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Ellos son padres de 2 niños a los cuales quieren ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. Flor Silvia inicio desde hace una año un negocio de abarrotes el cual es llamado “Miscelánea Michell” este fue instalado en su misma casa, pensado en la seguridad de sus 2 hijos. Ahora ella recurre a esta institución pidiendo el apoyo para seguir surtiendo su negocio para ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor calidad de producto que hay en el mercado.
texts.en:
Flor S. D. is an enterprising woman who likes to help her husband with household expenses. They have two children to whom they would like to offer a better quality of life. A year ago, Flor S. started a grocery store called “Miscelánea Michell.” She opened the store in her own house, thinking of the safety of her two children. Now she is asking this institution for help to continue supplying her store in order to offer her customers higher quality products than are in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es:
La familia de Nancy  tiene un negocio de confecciones  fabrican sabanas y cortinas  ella  trabaja  en la sección corte y a la vez dirige al personal que allí labora, las ganancias que obtiene por su trabajo las ahorra por que su mayor anhelo es  comprarse un terreno para construir su propia casa  y acondicionar un lugar para dedicarse a la venta de comidas con su propio restaurante.
Nancy  es la presidenta del grupo “SANTA ROSA” ya lleva en el cargo 2 años, son 10 socias todas  vecinas del mismo lugar, su préstamo  reciente  lo usara para empezar a vender  algunos platos típicos  y así  emprender su  sueño de tener su restaurante ella sabe que en futuro le ira muy bien por que tiene muchas amistades que disfrutan de su sazón. 

*La Sra., Nancy es la primera de las sentadas esta con buzo negro
texts.en:
Nancy’s family owns a business that manufactures bed linens and curtains. She is responsible for cutting the material as well as managing the staff who work there. Her greatest wish is to use her savings and the revenue generated from her business to buy a plot of land for building her own house and opening a restaurant where she can sell food.

Nancy is the President of the “Santa Rosa” Group and was elected to this position two years ago. The group has ten members who are all neighbors from the same area. Her most recent loan will be used to start selling traditional dishes since her dream is have her own restaurant. She knows that she will do well in the future because she has many friends who enjoy her cooking.

*Sra. Nancy is the first person seated wearing a black pullover.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies to start a food business

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: El Sr. A. A. Julian, vive en la urbanización Sebastían Barranca B-14, perteneciente al Distrito de Santiago. Tiene a cargo a su madre quien es viuda . Trabaja como obrero de campo  en  Agrícola Chapi desde hace 2 años. Cuenta con casa propia a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Solicita el financiamiento para realizar acabados a su vivienda a fin de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre. El Sr. A. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Julian A. A. lives in the neighborhood of Sebastían Barranca B-14, which is part of the district of Santiago. He looks after his mother who is a widow. Julian has been working as a field laborer on the Chapi Farm for two years. He has his own house and is making the final touches.

Julian is requesting a loan so that he can complete the finishing touches to his home so that he can provide his mother a better quality of life. He is grateful for the support that has been provided with this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete the finishing touches to his house

loans.name: Chanthoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthoeun U. (shown in the picture), and her husband, Mr. Chanthol Thorn, have been married for almost two years and just have a young daughter. The family lives in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Chanthoeun sells soup and pickled fruits at her home. She used to be a hairdresser as well. Her husband has been a motorbike repairer for more than five years. He runs the business at his own shop next to his house. 

Chanthoeun is asking for a loan in the amount of US $600 to pay for school fees for her brother who is in his third year of banking. She also will use a part of the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for school fees for her brother

loans.name: Donna Mae

texts.en: Donna Mae P. is a married woman who lives in Proper, Barangay Gen. Malvar, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a rice-retailing business. Her husband, Rogelio P., who is 44 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are from 10 to 16 years old. Donna Mae joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, thus uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 5th loan, Donna Mae is borrowing PHP 11,000 which she intends to use to buy rice and additional items for her general store so that she can continue to save for future home repairs and for the education of her children. Donna Mae is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more rice and additional items for her general store

loans.name: Mobateli Plus Group

texts.en:
Freddy is the chairman of a community bank named “Mobateli Plus”, which is composed of 19 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Freddy is 32 years old and single. He runs a telephone booth, a beauty shop and sells beverages. He started selling beverages in 2005 with a beginning capital of $50. With hard work and determination, his business prospered and he diversified by opening a telephone booth and a beauty shop. 

His businesses are located in the heart of the city of Kinshasa. He has already received five loans from Hope DRC and repaid them correctly. Freddy intends with the next loan to purchase a freezer and 30 prepaid cards. He will also use the loan as working capital to increase his inventory.

He makes $60 profit each week. His ambition is to open a drugstore in his area.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and prepaid cards and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REAL”; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Beatriz; ella tiene 42 años de edad y la socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista; La socia  prepara refrigerios y comidas suaves en su casa para hacer box lunch para turistas y jardines para niños, la socia tiene contrata con diferentes agencias de viajes y aventura, ella prepara diversas variedades de almuerzos fríos para llevar a los diversos tours que se ofrece en la ciudad del Cusco; ella es la encargada de ofrecer una gama de alternativas vegetarianas y platillos peruanos, también postres y refrigerios menores para los tours. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para su negocio.

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “REAL” ["Royal"] communal bank. She lives in the district of Santiago, in the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Beatriz, and she is 42 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She divides her time between her household activities and her retail business. She prepares refrigerated platters and simple foods in her home to make box lunches for tourists and child care centers. She has contracts with various travel agencies and tour programs, and she prepares diverse kinds of cold lunches for participants in the various tours offered in the city of Cusco. She is the one they rely upon to offer a range of vegetarian alternatives and Peruvian dishes, as well as desserts and snack plates for the tours. She is requesting the loan to buy supplies for her business. Beatriz values and appreciates the loan granted to her, since it will permit her to expand her business and have a better quality of life; accordingly, she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies for her business

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
José Guadalupe Vázquez R. es un hombre muy trabajador que esta pendiente de la comodidad de su familia; es por ello que quiere terminar de construir un cuarto que con ahorros propios ha ido levantando pero en este momento el quiere un préstamo para comprar mas material y pagar mano de obra para su proyecto se realice.
José quedo viudo lo cual recibe pensión por sus 4 hijos y también el quedo deshabilitado lo cual no puede trabajar pero recibe su pago cada mes.
texts.en:
José Guadalupe V. R. is a hard-working man that is mindful of his family's comfort. Because of this he wants to finish the construction of a bedroom that he started with his own savings. At this time he would like a loan to buy more materials and to pay for labor to do the project. José is a widower and receives financial support for his 4 children since he is disabled and can't work. He receives his payment monthly.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials and to pay for labor

loans.name: Dewi Fortuna Group

texts.en: Jero P. S. is a 32-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali. She is the group leader of this eleven-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Dewi Fortuna (PK-10295). Jero P. S. is married and has two adult children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 200,000 IDR a month. In 2010, Jero P. S. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be her first from MUK. Jero P. S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. ***************************************************** Jero P. S. 0 (0) merupakan 32 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Jero P. S. adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 11 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Dewi Fortuna (PK-10295). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Jero P. S. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Jero P. S. menghasilkan sekitar 200,000 IDR. Dalam 2010, Jero P. S. bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Jero P. S. meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a 61-year-old mother of three who lives with her husband and children in Barrio Cuba, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. Antonia is a busy entrepreneur; she has a business selling clothes that she makes as well as various catalog items. In the picture, you can see Antonia with the products she sells. 

In Costa Rica, many workers receive a bonus in December in the form of an extra salary payment. For example, if normally a person receives two deposits per month (for the same amount) he/she will receive a third deposit in December. Antonia would like to stock up on inventory items in order to be able to satisfy the anticipated surge in demand for her products in the coming months. As a result, Antonia hopes to use this loan to invest in various catalog items such as shoes, perfume and kitchen wear, as well as sewing materials (thread, needles). Antonia says that business has been good recently and that now is an excellent time for her to look for sources of working capital. 

Antonia organizes her day in accordance with a strict schedule. In the mornings, she wakes up early to prepare breakfast and lunch for her husband and children. She also carries out various domestic responsibilities during this time. In the afternoons, she dedicates her time to her business, making sales, collecting payments and sewing.
